240 // Returns the default item type, used for the null item (default constructed),
241 // the returned pointer is always valid, it's never cleared by the @ref Item_factory.
242 static const itype *nullitem()
243 {
244  static itype nullitem_m;
245  return &nullitem_m;
246 }
247 
248 item &null_item_reference()
249 {
250  static item result{};
251  // reset it, in case a previous caller has changed it
252  result = item();
253  return result;
254 }
255 
256 namespace item_internal
257 {
258 static bool goes_bad_temp_cache = false;
259 static const item *goes_bad_temp_cache_for = nullptr;
260 static bool goes_bad_cache_fetch()
261 {
262  return goes_bad_temp_cache;
263 }
264 static void goes_bad_cache_set( const item *i )
265 {
266  goes_bad_temp_cache = i->goes_bad();
267  goes_bad_temp_cache_for = i;
268 }
269 static void goes_bad_cache_unset()
270 {
271  goes_bad_temp_cache = false;
272  goes_bad_temp_cache_for = nullptr;
273 }
274 static bool goes_bad_cache_is_for( const item *i )
275 {
276  return goes_bad_temp_cache_for == i;
277 }
278 
279 struct scoped_goes_bad_cache {
280  explicit scoped_goes_bad_cache( item *i ) {
281  goes_bad_cache_set( i );
282  }
283  ~scoped_goes_bad_cache() {
284  goes_bad_cache_unset();
285  }
286 };
287 } // namespace item_internal
288 
289 const int item::INFINITE_CHARGES = INT_MAX;
290 
291 item::item() : bday( calendar::start_of_cataclysm )
292 {
293  type = nullitem();
294  charges = 0;
295  contents = item_contents( type->pockets );
296  select_itype_variant();
297 }
298 
299 item::item( const itype *type, time_point turn, int qty ) : type( type ), bday( turn )
300 {
301  contents = item_contents( type->pockets );
302  if( type->countdown_interval > 0_seconds ) {
303  countdown_point = calendar::turn + type->countdown_interval;
304  }
305  item_vars = type->item_variables;
306 
307  update_prefix_suffix_flags();
308  if( has_flag( flag_CORPSE ) ) {
309  corpse = &type->source_monster.obj();
310  if( !type->source_monster.is_null() && !type->source_monster->zombify_into.is_empty() ) {
311  set_var( "zombie_form", type->source_monster->zombify_into.c_str() );
312  }
313  }
314 
315  if( qty >= 0 ) {
316  if( type->can_have_charges() ) {
317  charges = qty;
318  } else if( qty > 1 ) {
319  debugmsg( "Tried to set charges for item %s that could not have them!", tname() );
320  }
321  } else {
322  if( type->tool && type->tool->rand_charges.size() > 1 ) {
323  const int charge_roll = rng( 1, type->tool->rand_charges.size() - 1 );
324  const int charge_count = rng( type->tool->rand_charges[charge_roll - 1],
325  type->tool->rand_charges[charge_roll] );
326  ammo_set( ammo_default(), charge_count );
327  } else {
328  charges = type->charges_default();
329  }
330  }
331 
332  if( has_flag( flag_SPAWN_ACTIVE ) ) {
333  activate();
334  }
335 
336  if( has_flag( flag_COLLAPSE_CONTENTS ) ) {
337  for( item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_standard_pockets() ) {
338  pocket->settings.set_collapse( true );
339  }
340  } else {
341  auto const mag_filter = []( item_pocket const & pck ) {
342  return pck.is_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE ) ||
343  pck.is_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL );
344  };
345  for( item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_pockets( mag_filter ) ) {
346  pocket->settings.set_collapse( true );
347  }
348  }
349 
350  if( has_flag( flag_NANOFAB_TEMPLATE ) ) {
351  itype_id nanofab_recipe =
352  item_group::item_from( type->nanofab_template_group ).typeId();
353  set_var( "NANOFAB_ITEM_ID", nanofab_recipe.str() );
354  }
355 
356  select_itype_variant();
357  if( type->gun ) {
358  for( const itype_id &mod : type->gun->built_in_mods ) {
359  item it( mod, turn, qty );
360  it.set_flag( flag_IRREMOVABLE );
361  put_in( it, pocket_type::MOD );
362  }
363  for( const itype_id &mod : type->gun->default_mods ) {
364  put_in( item( mod, turn, qty ), pocket_type::MOD );
365  }
366 
367  } else if( type->magazine ) {
368  if( type->magazine->count > 0 ) {
369  put_in( item( type->magazine->default_ammo, calendar::turn, type->magazine->count ),
370  pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
371  }
372 
373  } else if( has_temperature() ) {
374  active = true;
375  last_temp_check = bday;
376 
377  } else if( type->tool ) {
378  if( ammo_remaining() && !ammo_types().empty() ) {
379  ammo_set( ammo_default(), ammo_remaining() );
380  }
381  }
382 
383  if( ( type->gun || type->tool ) && !magazine_integral() ) {
384  set_var( "magazine_converted", 1 );
385  }
386 
387  if( !type->snippet_category.empty() ) {
388  snip_id = SNIPPET.random_id_from_category( type->snippet_category );
389  }
390 
391  if( type->expand_snippets ) {
392  set_var( "description", SNIPPET.expand( type->description.translated() ) );
393  }
394 
395  if( has_itype_variant() && itype_variant().expand_snippets ) {
396  set_var( "description", SNIPPET.expand( variant_description() ) );
397  }
398 
399  if( current_phase == phase_id::PNULL ) {
400  current_phase = type->phase;
401  }
402  // item always has any relic properties from itype.
403  if( type->relic_data ) {
404  relic_data = type->relic_data;
405  }
406 }
407 
408 item::item( const itype_id &id, time_point turn, int qty )
409  : item( find_type( id ), turn, qty ) {}

412  : item( type, turn, type->charges_default() ) {}
413

415  : item( find_type( id ), turn, tag ) {}
416 
417 item::item( const itype *type, time_point turn, solitary_tag )
418  : item( type, turn, type->count_by_charges() ? 1 : -1 ) {}
419 
420 item::item( const itype_id &id, time_point turn, solitary_tag tag )
421  : item( find_type( id ), turn, tag ) {}
422 
423 safe_reference<item> item::get_safe_reference()
424 {
425  return anchor->reference_to( this );
426 }
427 
428 static const item *get_most_rotten_component( const item &craft )
429 {
430  const item *most_rotten = nullptr;
431  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : craft.components ) {
432  if( !tvp.second.front().goes_bad() ) {
433  // they're all the same type, so this should be the same for all
434  continue;
435  }
436  for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
437  if( !most_rotten || it.get_relative_rot() > most_rotten->get_relative_rot() ) {
438  most_rotten = &it;
439  }
440  }
441  }
442  return most_rotten;
443 }
444 
445 // sorts with localized_compare, and enumerates entries, if more than \p max entries
446 // the rest are abbreviated into " and %d more"
447 static std::string enumerate_lcsorted_with_limit( const std::vector<std::string> &v,
448  const int max = 5 )
449 {
450  if( max < 1 ) {
451  debugmsg( "Expected max to be 1 or more" );
452  return std::string();
453  }
454  std::vector<std::string> c( std::min<size_t>( max, v.size() ) );
455  std::partial_sort_copy( v.begin(), v.end(), c.begin(), c.end(), localized_compare );
456  const int more = static_cast<int>( v.size() - c.size() );
457  if( more == 0 ) {
458  return enumerate_as_string( c );
459  }
460  const std::string res = enumerate_as_string( c, enumeration_conjunction::none );
461  return string_format( max == 1 ? _( "%s and %d more" ) : _( "%s, and %d more" ), res, more );
462 }
463 
464 static time_duration get_shortest_lifespan_from_components( const item &craft )
465 {
466  const item *shortest_lifespan_component = nullptr;
467  time_duration shortest_lifespan = 0_turns;
468  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : craft.components ) {
469  if( !tvp.second.front().goes_bad() ) {
470  // they're all the same type, so this should be the same for all
471  continue;
472  }
473  for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
474  time_duration lifespan = it.get_shelf_life() - it.get_rot();
475  if( !shortest_lifespan_component || ( lifespan < shortest_lifespan ) ) {
476  shortest_lifespan_component = &it;
477  shortest_lifespan = shortest_lifespan_component->get_shelf_life() -
478  shortest_lifespan_component->get_rot();
479  }
480  }
481  }
482  return shortest_lifespan;
483 }
484 
485 static bool shelf_life_less_than_each_component( const item &craft )
486 {
487  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : craft.components ) {
488  if( !tvp.second.front().goes_bad() || !tvp.second.front().is_comestible() ) {
489  // they're all the same type, so this should be the same for all
490  continue;
491  }
492  for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
493  if( it.get_shelf_life() < craft.get_shelf_life() ) {
494  return false;
495  }
496  }
497  }
498  return true;
499 }
500 
501 // There are two ways rot is inherited:
502 // 1) Inherit the remaining lifespan of the component with the lowest remaining lifespan
503 // 2) Inherit the relative rot of the component with the highest relative rot
504 //
505 // Method 1 is used when the result of the recipe has a lower maximum shelf life than all of
506 // its component's maximum shelf lives. Relative rot is not good to inherit in this case because
507 // it can make an extremely short resultant remaining lifespan on the product.
508 //
509 // Method 2 is used when any component has a longer maximum shelf life than the result does.
510 // Inheriting the lowest remaining lifespan can not be used in this case because it would break
511 // food preservation recipes.
512 static void inherit_rot_from_components( item &it )
513 {
514  if( shelf_life_less_than_each_component( it ) ) {
515  const time_duration shortest_lifespan = get_shortest_lifespan_from_components( it );
516  if( shortest_lifespan > 0_turns && shortest_lifespan < it.get_shelf_life() ) {
517  it.set_rot( it.get_shelf_life() - shortest_lifespan );
518  return;
519  }
520  // Fallthrough: shortest_lifespan <= 0_turns (all components are rotten)
521  }
522 
523  const item *most_rotten = get_most_rotten_component( it );
524  if( most_rotten ) {
525  it.set_relative_rot( most_rotten->get_relative_rot() );
526  }
527 }
528 
529 item::item( const recipe *rec, int qty, item_components items, std::vector<item_comp> selections )
530  : item( "craft", calendar::turn )
531 {
532  craft_data_ = cata::make_value<craft_data>();
533  craft_data_->making = rec;
534  craft_data_->disassembly = false;
535  craft_data_->batch_size = qty;
536  components = std::move( items );
537  craft_data_->comps_used = std::move( selections );
538 
539  if( has_temperature() ) {
540  active = true;
541  last_temp_check = bday;
542  if( goes_bad() ) {
543  inherit_rot_from_components( *this );
544  }
545  }
546 
547  for( item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
548  for( item &component : tvp.second ) {
549  for( const flag_id &f : component.get_flags() ) {
550  if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
551  set_flag( f );
552  }
553  }
554  for( const flag_id &f : component.type->get_flags() ) {
555  if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
556  set_flag( f );
557  }
558  }
559  }
560  }
561 }
562 
563 item::item( const recipe *rec, int qty, item &component )
564  : item( "disassembly", calendar::turn )
565 {
566  craft_data_ = cata::make_value<craft_data>();
567  craft_data_->making = rec;
568  craft_data_->disassembly = true;
569  craft_data_->batch_size = qty;
570  item_components items;
571  items.add( component );
572  components = items;
573 
574  if( has_temperature() ) {
575  active = true;
576  last_temp_check = bday;
577  if( goes_bad() ) {
578  inherit_rot_from_components( *this );
579  }
580  }
581 
582  for( item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
583  for( item &comp : tvp.second ) {
584  for( const flag_id &f : comp.get_flags() ) {
585  if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
586  set_flag( f );
587  }
588  }
589  for( const flag_id &f : comp.type->get_flags() ) {
590  if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
591  set_flag( f );
592  }
593  }
594  }
595  }
596 }
597 
598 item::item( const item & ) = default;
599 item::item( item && ) noexcept = default;
600 item::~item() = default;
601 item &item::operator=( const item & ) = default;
602 item &item::operator=( item && ) noexcept = default;
603 
604 item item::make_corpse( const mtype_id &mt, time_point turn, const std::string &name,
605  const int upgrade_time )
606 {
607  if( !mt.is_valid() ) {
608  debugmsg( "tried to make a corpse with an invalid mtype id" );
609  }
610 
611  std::string corpse_type = mt == mtype_id::NULL_ID() ? "corpse_generic_human" : "corpse";
612 
613  item result( corpse_type, turn );
614  result.corpse = &mt.obj();
615 
616  if( result.corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_REVIVES ) ) {
617  if( one_in( 20 ) ) {
618  result.set_flag( flag_REVIVE_SPECIAL );
619  }
620  result.set_var( "upgrade_time", std::to_string( upgrade_time ) );
621  }
622 
623  if( !mt->zombify_into.is_empty() ) {
624  result.set_var( "zombie_form", mt->zombify_into.c_str() );
625  }
626 
627  // This is unconditional because the const itemructor above sets result.name to
628  // "human corpse".
629  result.corpse_name = name;
630 
631  return result;
632 }
633 
634 item &item::convert( const itype_id &new_type, Character *carrier )
635 {
636  // Carry over relative rot similar to crafting
637  const double rel_rot = get_relative_rot();
638  type = find_type( new_type );
639  set_relative_rot( rel_rot );
640  requires_tags_processing = true; // new type may have "active" flags
641  item temp( *this );
642  temp.contents = item_contents( type->pockets );
643  for( const item *it : contents.mods() ) {
644  if( !temp.put_in( *it, pocket_type::MOD ).success() ) {
645  debugmsg( "failed to insert mod" );
646  }
647  }
648  temp.update_modified_pockets();
649  temp.contents.combine( contents, true );
650  contents = temp.contents;
651  current_phase = new_type->phase;
652  if( count_by_charges() != new_type->count_by_charges() ) {
653  charges = new_type->charges_default();
654  }
655 
656  if( temp.type->countdown_interval > 0_seconds ) {
657  countdown_point = calendar::turn + type->countdown_interval;
658  active = true;
659  }
660  if( carrier && carrier->has_item( *this ) ) {
661  carrier->on_item_acquire( *this );
662  }
663 
664  update_prefix_suffix_flags();
665  return *this;
666 }
667 
668 item &item::deactivate( const Character *ch, bool alert )
669 {
670  if( !active ) {
671  return *this; // no-op
672  }
673 
674  if( type->revert_to ) {
675  if( ch && alert && !type->tool->revert_msg.empty() ) {
676  ch->add_msg_if_player( m_info, type->tool->revert_msg.translated(), tname() );
677  }
678  convert( *type->revert_to );
679  active = false;
680 
681  }
682  return *this;
683 }
684 
685 item &item::activate()
686 {
687  if( active ) {
688  return *this; // no-op
689  }
690 
691  active = true;
692 
693  return *this;
694 }
695 
696 bool item::activate_thrown( const tripoint &pos )
697 {
698  return type->invoke( nullptr, *this, pos ).value_or( 0 );
699 }
700 
701 units::energy item::mod_energy( const units::energy &qty )
702 {
703  if( !is_vehicle_battery() ) {
704  debugmsg( "Tried to set energy of non-battery item" );
705  return 0_J;
706  }
707 
708  units::energy val = energy_remaining( nullptr ) + qty;
709  if( val < 0_J ) {
710  return val;
711  } else if( val > type->battery->max_capacity ) {
712  energy = type->battery->max_capacity;
713  } else {
714  energy = val;
715  }
716  return 0_J;
717 }
718 
719 item &item::ammo_set( const itype_id &ammo, int qty )
720 {
721  if( !ammo->ammo ) {
722  if( !has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
723  debugmsg( "can't set ammo %s in %s as it is not an ammo", ammo.c_str(), type_name() );
724  }
725  return *this;
726  }
727  const ammotype &ammo_type = ammo->ammo->type;
728  if( qty < 0 ) {
729  // completely fill an integral or existing magazine
730  //if( magazine_current() ) then we need capacity of the magazine instead of the item maybe?
731  if( magazine_integral() || magazine_current() ) {
732  qty = ammo_capacity( ammo_type );
733 
734  // else try to add a magazine using default ammo count property if set
735  } else if( !magazine_default( true ).is_null() ) {
736  item mag( magazine_default( true ) );
737  if( mag.type->magazine->count > 0 ) {
738  qty = mag.type->magazine->count;
739  } else {
740  qty = mag.ammo_capacity( ammo_type );
741  }
742  }
743  }
744 
745  if( qty <= 0 ) {
746  ammo_unset();
747  return *this;
748  }
749 
750  // handle reloadable tools and guns with no specific ammo type as special case
751  if( ammo.is_null() && ammo_types().empty() ) {
752  if( magazine_integral() ) {
753  if( is_tool() ) {
754  charges = std::min( qty, ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) );
755  } else if( is_gun() ) {
756  const item temp_ammo( ammo_default(), calendar::turn, std::min( qty, ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) ) );
757  put_in( temp_ammo, pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
758  }
759  }
760  return *this;
761  }
762 
763  // check ammo is valid for the item
764  std::set<itype_id> mags = magazine_compatible();
765  if( ammo_types().count( ammo_type ) == 0 && !( magazine_current() &&
766  magazine_current()->ammo_types().count( ammo_type ) ) &&
767  !std::any_of( mags.begin(), mags.end(), [&ammo_type]( const itype_id & mag ) {
768  return mag->magazine->type.count( ammo_type );
769  } ) ) {
770  debugmsg( "Tried to set invalid ammo of %s for %s", ammo.c_str(), typeId().c_str() );
771  return *this;
772  }
773 
774  if( is_magazine() ) {
775  ammo_unset();
776  item set_ammo( ammo, calendar::turn, std::min( qty, ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) ) );
777  if( has_flag( flag_NO_UNLOAD ) ) {
778  set_ammo.set_flag( flag_NO_DROP );
779  set_ammo.set_flag( flag_IRREMOVABLE );
780  }
781  put_in( set_ammo, pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
782 
783  } else {
784  if( !magazine_current() ) {
785  itype_id mag = magazine_default();
786  if( !mag->magazine ) {
787  debugmsg( "Tried to set ammo of %s without suitable magazine for %s",
788  ammo.c_str(), typeId().c_str() );
789  return *this;
790  }
791 
792  item mag_item( mag );
793  // if default magazine too small fetch instead closest available match
794  if( mag_item.ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) < qty ) {
795  std::vector<item> opts;
796  for( const itype_id &mag_type : mags ) {
797  if( mag_type->magazine->type.count( ammo_type ) ) {
798  opts.emplace_back( mag_type );
799  }
800  }
801  if( opts.empty() ) {
802  const std::string magazines_str = enumerate_as_string( mags,
803  []( const itype_id & mag ) {
804  const std::string ammotype_str = enumerate_as_string( mag->magazine->type,
805  []( const ammotype & a ) {
806  return a.str();
807  } );
808  return string_format( _( "%s (taking %s)" ), mag.str(), ammotype_str );
809  } );
810  debugmsg( "Cannot find magazine fitting %s with any capacity for ammo %s "
811  "(ammotype %s). Magazines considered were %s",
812  typeId().str(), ammo.str(), ammo_type.str(), magazines_str );
813  return *this;
814  }
815  std::sort( opts.begin(), opts.end(), [&ammo_type]( const item & lhs, const item & rhs ) {
816  return lhs.ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) < rhs.ammo_capacity( ammo_type );
817  } );
818  auto iter = std::find_if( opts.begin(), opts.end(), [&qty, &ammo_type]( const item & mag ) {
819  return mag.ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) >= qty;
820  } );
821  if( iter != opts.end() ) {
822  mag = iter->typeId();
823  } else {
824  mag = opts.back().typeId();
825  }
826  }
827  put_in( item( mag ), pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL );
828  }
829  item *mag_cur = magazine_current();
830  if( mag_cur != nullptr ) {
831  mag_cur->ammo_set( ammo, qty );
832  }
833  }
834  return *this;
835 }
836 
837 item &item::ammo_unset()
838 {
839  if( !is_tool() && !is_gun() && !is_magazine() ) {
840  // do nothing
841  } else if( is_magazine() ) {
842  if( is_money() ) { // charges are set wrong on cash cards.
843  charges = 0;
844  }
845  contents.clear_magazines();
846  } else if( magazine_integral() ) {
847  charges = 0;
848  if( is_gun() ) {
849  contents.clear_magazines();
850  }
851  } else if( magazine_current() ) {
852  magazine_current()->ammo_unset();
853  }
854 
855  return *this;
856 }
857 
858 int item::damage() const
859 {
860  return damage_;
861 }
862 
863 int item::degradation() const
864 {
865  return degradation_;
866 }
867 
868 void item::rand_degradation()
869 {
870  if( type->degrade_increments() == 0 ) {
871  return; // likely count_by_charges
872  }
873  set_degradation( rng( 0, damage() ) * 50.0f / type->degrade_increments() );
874 }
875 
876 int item::damage_level( bool precise ) const
877 {
878  return precise ? damage_ : type->damage_level( damage_ );
879 }
880 
881 float item::damage_adjusted_melee_weapon_damage( float value ) const
882 {
883  if( type->count_by_charges() ) {
884  return value; // count by charges items don't have partial damage
885  }
886  return value * ( 1.0f - 0.1f * std::max( 0, damage_level() - 1 ) );
887 }
888 
889 float item::damage_adjusted_gun_damage( float value ) const
890 {
891  if( type->count_by_charges() ) {
892  return value; // count by charges items don't have partial damage
893  }
894  return value - 2 * std::max( 0, damage_level() - 1 );
895 }
896 
897 float item::damage_adjusted_armor_resist( float value ) const
898 {
899  if( type->count_by_charges() ) {
900  return value; // count by charges items don't have partial damage
901  }
902  return value * ( 1.0f - std::max( 0, damage_level() - 1 ) * 0.125f );
903 }
904 
905 void item::set_damage( int qty )
906 {
907  damage_ = std::clamp( qty, degradation_, max_damage() );
908 }
909 
910 void item::set_degradation( int qty )
911 {
912  if( type->degrade_increments() > 0 ) {
913  degradation_ = std::clamp( qty, 0, max_damage() );
914  } else {
915  degradation_ = 0;
916  }
917  set_damage( damage_ );
918 }
919 
920 item item::split( int qty )
921 {
922  if( !count_by_charges() || qty <= 0 || qty >= charges ) {
923  return item();
924  }
925  item res = *this;
926  res.charges = qty;
927  charges -= qty;
928  return res;
929 }
930 
931 bool item::is_null() const
932 {
933  // Actually, type should never by null at all.
934  return ( type == nullptr || type == nullitem() || typeId().is_null() );
935 }
936 
937 bool item::is_frozen_liquid() const
938 {
939  return made_of( phase_id::SOLID ) && made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID );
940 }
941 
942 bool item::covers( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const
943 {
944  // if the item has no armor data it doesn't cover that part
945  const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
946  if( armor == nullptr ) {
947  return false;
948  }
949 
950  bool has_sub_data = false;
951 
952  // If the item has no sub location info and covers the part's parent,
953  // then assume that the item covers that sub body part.
954  for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->sub_data ) {
955  if( !data.sub_coverage.empty() ) {
956  has_sub_data = true;
957  }
958  }
959 
960  if( !has_sub_data ) {
961  return covers( bp->parent );
962  }
963 
964  bool does_cover = false;
965  bool subpart_cover = false;
966 
967  iterate_covered_sub_body_parts_internal( get_side(), [&]( const sub_bodypart_str_id & covered ) {
968  does_cover = does_cover || bp == covered;
969  } );
970 
971  return does_cover || subpart_cover;
972 }
973 
974 bool item::covers( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
975 {
976  bool does_cover = false;
977  bool subpart_cover = false;
978  iterate_covered_body_parts_internal( get_side(), [&]( const bodypart_str_id & covered ) {
979  does_cover = does_cover || bp == covered;
980  } );
981 
982  return does_cover || subpart_cover;
983 }
984 
985 std::optional<side> item::covers_overlaps( const item &rhs ) const
986 {
987  if( get_layer() != rhs.get_layer() ) {
988  return std::nullopt;
989  }
990  const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
991  if( armor == nullptr ) {
992  return std::nullopt;
993  }
994  const islot_armor *rhs_armor = rhs.find_armor_data();
995  if( rhs_armor == nullptr ) {
996  return std::nullopt;
997  }
998  body_part_set this_covers;
999  for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->data ) {
1000  if( data.covers.has_value() ) {
1001  this_covers.unify_set( *data.covers );
1002  }
1003  }
1004  body_part_set rhs_covers;
1005  for( const armor_portion_data &data : rhs_armor->data ) {
1006  if( data.covers.has_value() ) {
1007  rhs_covers.unify_set( *data.covers );
1008  }
1009  }
1010  if( this_covers.intersect_set( rhs_covers ).any() ) {
1011  return rhs.get_side();
1012  } else {
1013  return std::nullopt;
1014  }
1015 }
1016 
1017 std::vector<sub_bodypart_id> item::get_covered_sub_body_parts() const
1018 {
1019  return get_covered_sub_body_parts( get_side() );
1020 }
1021 
1022 std::vector<sub_bodypart_id> item::get_covered_sub_body_parts( const side s ) const
1023 {
1024  std::vector<sub_bodypart_id> res;
1025  iterate_covered_sub_body_parts_internal( s, [&]( const sub_bodypart_id & bp ) {
1026  res.push_back( bp );
1027  } );
1028  return res;
1029 }
1030 
1031 body_part_set item::get_covered_body_parts() const
1032 {
1033  return get_covered_body_parts( get_side() );
1034 }
1035 
1036 body_part_set item::get_covered_body_parts( const side s ) const
1037 {
1038  body_part_set res;
1039  iterate_covered_body_parts_internal( s, [&]( const bodypart_str_id & bp ) {
1040  res.set( bp );
1041  } );
1042  return res;
1043 }
1044 
1045 namespace
1046 {
1047 
1048 const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> &left_side_parts()
1049 {
1050  static const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> result{ {
1051  body_part_arm_l,
1052  body_part_hand_l,
1053  body_part_leg_l,
1054  body_part_foot_l
1055  } };
1056  return result;
1057 }
1058 
1059 const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> &right_side_parts()
1060 {
1061  static const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> result{ {
1062  body_part_arm_r,
1063  body_part_hand_r,
1064  body_part_leg_r,
1065  body_part_foot_r
1066  } };
1067  return result;
1068 }
1069 
1070 } // namespace
1071 
1072 static void iterate_helper_sbp( const item *i, const side s,
1073  const std::function<void( const sub_bodypart_str_id & )> &cb )
1074 {
1075  const islot_armor *armor = i->find_armor_data();
1076  if( armor == nullptr ) {
1077  return;
1078  }
1079 
1080  for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->sub_data ) {
1081  if( !data.sub_coverage.empty() ) {
1082  if( !armor->sided || s == side::BOTH || s == side::num_sides ) {
1083  for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.sub_coverage ) {
1084  cb( bpid );
1085  }
1086  continue;
1087  }
1088  for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.sub_coverage ) {
1089  if( bpid->part_side == s || bpid->part_side == side::BOTH ) {
1090  cb( bpid );
1091  }
1092  }
1093  }
1094  }
1095 }
1096 
1097 void item::iterate_covered_sub_body_parts_internal( const side s,
1098  const std::function<void( const sub_bodypart_str_id & )> &cb ) const
1099 {
1100  iterate_helper_sbp( this, s, cb );
1101 
1102  //check for ablative armor too
1103  if( is_ablative() ) {
1104  for( const item_pocket *pocket : get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
1105  if( !pocket->empty() ) {
1106  // get the contained plate
1107  const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
1108 
1109  iterate_helper_sbp( &ablative_armor, s, cb );
1110  }
1111  }
1112  }
1113 }
1114 
1115 static void iterate_helper( const item *i, const side s,
1116  const std::function<void( const bodypart_str_id & )> &cb )
1117 {
1118  const islot_armor *armor = i->find_armor_data();
1119  if( armor == nullptr ) {
1120  return;
1121  }
1122 
1123  // If we are querying for only one side of the body, we ignore coverage
1124  // for parts on the opposite side of the body.
1125  const auto &opposite_side_parts = s == side::LEFT ? right_side_parts() : left_side_parts();
1126 
1127  for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->data ) {
1128  if( data.covers.has_value() ) {
1129  if( !armor->sided || s == side::BOTH || s == side::num_sides ) {
1130  for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
1131  cb( bpid );
1132  }
1133  continue;
1134  }
1135  for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
1136  if( std::find( opposite_side_parts.begin(), opposite_side_parts.end(),
1137  bpid ) == opposite_side_parts.end() ) {
1138  cb( bpid );
1139  }
1140  }
1141  }
1142  }
1143 }
1144 
1145 void item::iterate_covered_body_parts_internal( const side s,
1146  const std::function<void( const bodypart_str_id & )> &cb ) const
1147 {
1148  iterate_helper( this, s, cb );
1149 
1150  //check for ablative armor too
1151  if( is_ablative() ) {
1152  for( const item_pocket *pocket : get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
1153  if( !pocket->empty() ) {
1154  // get the contained plate
1155  const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
1156 
1157  iterate_helper( &ablative_armor, s, cb );
1158  }
1159  }
1160  }
1161 }
1162 
1163 bool item::is_sided() const
1164 {
1165  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1166  return t ? t->sided : false;
1167 }
1168 
1169 side item::get_side() const
1170 {
1171  // MSVC complains if directly cast double to enum
1172  return static_cast<side>( static_cast<int>( get_var( STATIC( std::string{ "lateral" } ),
1173  static_cast<int>( side::BOTH ) ) ) );
1174 }
1175 
1176 bool item::set_side( side s )
1177 {
1178  if( !is_sided() ) {
1179  return false;
1180  }
1181 
1182  if( s == side::BOTH ) {
1183  erase_var( "lateral" );
1184  } else {
1185  set_var( "lateral", static_cast<int>( s ) );
1186  }
1187 
1188  return true;
1189 }
1190 
1191 bool item::swap_side()
1192 {
1193  return set_side( opposite_side( get_side() ) );
1194 }
1195 
1196 bool item::is_ablative() const
1197 {
1198  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1199  return t ? t->ablative : false;
1200 }
1201 
1202 bool item::has_additional_encumbrance() const
1203 {
1204  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1205  return t ? t->additional_pocket_enc : false;
1206 }
1207 
1208 bool item::has_ripoff_pockets() const
1209 {
1210  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1211  return t ? t->ripoff_chance : false;
1212 }
1213 
1214 bool item::has_noisy_pockets() const
1215 {
1216  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1217  return t ? t->noisy : false;
1218 }
1219 
1220 bool item::is_worn_only_with( const item &it ) const
1221 {
1222  return is_power_armor() && it.is_power_armor() && it.covers( bodypart_id( "torso" ) );
1223 }
1224 bool item::is_worn_by_player() const
1225 {
1226  return get_player_character().is_worn( *this );
1227 }
1228 
1229 item item::in_its_container( int qty ) const
1230 {
1231  return in_container( type->default_container.value_or( itype_null ), qty,
1232  type->default_container_sealed, type->default_container_variant.value_or( "" ) );
1233 }
1234 
1235 item item::in_container( const itype_id &cont, int qty, bool sealed,
1236  const std::string &variant ) const
1237 {
1238  if( cont.is_null() ) {
1239  return *this;
1240  }
1241 
1242  if( qty <= 0 ) {
1243  qty = count();
1244  }
1245  item container( cont, birthday() );
1246  if( !variant.empty() ) {
1247  container.set_itype_variant( variant );
1248  }
1249  if( container.is_container() ) {
1250  container.fill_with( *this, qty );
1251  container.invlet = invlet;
1252  if( sealed ) {
1253  container.seal();
1254  }
1255  if( !container.has_item_with( [&cont]( const item & it ) {
1256  return it.typeId() == cont;
1257  } ) ) {
1258  debugmsg( "ERROR: failed to put %s in its container %s", typeId().c_str(), cont.c_str() );
1259  return *this;
1260  }
1261  container.add_automatic_whitelist();
1262  return container;
1263  } else if( is_software() && container.is_software_storage() ) {
1264  container.put_in( *this, pocket_type::SOFTWARE );
1265  container.invlet = invlet;
1266  return container;
1267  }
1268  return *this;
1269 }
1270 
1271 void item::add_automatic_whitelist()
1272 {
1273  std::vector<item_pocket *> pkts = get_all_contained_pockets();
1274  if( pkts.size() == 1 && contents_only_one_type() ) {
1275  pkts.front()->settings.whitelist_item( contents.first_item().typeId() );
1276  pkts.front()->settings.set_priority( 100 );
1277  }
1278 }
1279 
1280 void item::clear_automatic_whitelist()
1281 {
1282  std::vector<item_pocket *> pkts = get_all_contained_pockets();
1283  if( pkts.size() == 1 && !pkts.front()->settings.was_edited() ) {
1284  cata::flat_set<itype_id> const &wl = pkts.front()->settings.get_item_whitelist();
1285  if( !wl.empty() ) {
1286  pkts.front()->settings.clear_item( *wl.begin() );
1287  pkts.front()->settings.set_priority( 0 );
1288  }
1289  }
1290 }
1291 
1292 void item::update_modified_pockets()
1293 {
1294  std::optional<const pocket_data *> mag_or_mag_well;
1295  std::vector<const pocket_data *> container_pockets;
1296 
1297  // Prevent cleanup of pockets belonging to the item base type
1298  for( const pocket_data &pocket : type->pockets ) {
1299  if( pocket.type == pocket_type::CONTAINER ) {
1300  container_pockets.push_back( &pocket );
1301  } else if( pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE ||
1302  pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL ) {
1303  mag_or_mag_well = &pocket;
1304  }
1305  }
1306 
1307  // Prevent cleanup of added modular pockets
1308  for( const item *it : contents.get_added_pockets() ) {
1309  for( const pocket_data &pocket : it->type->pockets ) {
1310  if( pocket.type == pocket_type::CONTAINER ) {
1311  container_pockets.push_back( &pocket );
1312  }
1313  }
1314  }
1315 
1316  for( const item *mod : mods() ) {
1317  if( mod->type->mod ) {
1318  for( const pocket_data &pocket : mod->type->mod->add_pockets ) {
1319  if( pocket.type == pocket_type::CONTAINER ) {
1320  container_pockets.push_back( &pocket );
1321  } else if( pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE ||
1322  pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL ) {
1323  mag_or_mag_well = &pocket;
1324  }
1325  }
1326  }
1327  }
1328 
1329  contents.update_modified_pockets( mag_or_mag_well, container_pockets );
1330 }
1331 
1332 int item::charges_per_volume( const units::volume &vol, bool suppress_warning ) const
1333 {
1334  if( count_by_charges() ) {
1335  if( type->volume == 0_ml ) {
1336  if( !suppress_warning ) {
1337  debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname() );
1338  }
1339  return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1340  }
1341  // Type cast to prevent integer overflow with large volume containers like the cargo
1342  // dimension
1343  return vol * static_cast<int64_t>( type->stack_size ) / type->volume;
1344  } else {
1345  units::volume my_volume = volume();
1346  if( my_volume == 0_ml ) {
1347  if( !suppress_warning ) {
1348  debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname() );
1349  }
1350  return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1351  }
1352  return vol / my_volume;
1353  }
1354 }
1355 
1356 int item::charges_per_weight( const units::mass &m, bool suppress_warning ) const
1357 {
1358  if( count_by_charges() ) {
1359  if( type->weight == 0_gram ) {
1360  if( !suppress_warning ) {
1361  debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero weight", tname() );
1362  }
1363  return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1364  }
1365  return m / type->weight;
1366  } else {
1367  units::mass my_weight = weight();
1368  if( my_weight == 0_gram ) {
1369  if( !suppress_warning ) {
1370  debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero weight", tname() );
1371  }
1372  return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1373  }
1374  return m / my_weight;
1375  }
1376 }
1377 
1378 bool item::display_stacked_with( const item &rhs, bool check_components ) const
1379 {
1380  return !count_by_charges() && stacks_with( rhs, check_components );
1381 }
1382 
1383 bool item::can_combine( const item &rhs ) const
1384 {
1385  if( !contents.empty() || !rhs.contents.empty() ) {
1386  return false;
1387  }
1388  if( !count_by_charges() ) {
1389  return false;
1390  }
1391  if( !stacks_with( rhs, true, true ) ) {
1392  return false;
1393  }
1394  return true;
1395 }
1396 
1397 bool item::combine( const item &rhs )
1398 {
1399  if( !can_combine( rhs ) ) {
1400  return false;
1401  }
1402  if( has_temperature() ) {
1403  if( goes_bad() ) {
1404  //use maximum rot between the two
1405  set_relative_rot( std::max( get_relative_rot(),
1406  rhs.get_relative_rot() ) );
1407  }
1408  const float lhs_energy = get_item_thermal_energy();
1409  const float rhs_energy = rhs.get_item_thermal_energy();
1410  if( rhs_energy > 0 && lhs_energy > 0 ) {
1411  const float combined_specific_energy = ( lhs_energy + rhs_energy ) / ( to_gram(
1412  weight() ) + to_gram( rhs.weight() ) );
1413  set_item_specific_energy( units::from_joule_per_gram( combined_specific_energy ) );
1414  }
1415 
1416  }
1417  charges += rhs.charges;
1418  if( !rhs.has_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES ) ) {
1419  unset_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES );
1420  }
1421  return true;
1422 }
1423 
1424 bool item::same_for_rle( const item &rhs ) const
1425 {
1426  if( type != rhs.type ) {
1427  return false;
1428  }
1429  if( charges != rhs.charges ) {
1430  return false;
1431  }
1432  if( !contents.empty_with_no_mods() || !rhs.contents.empty_with_no_mods() ) {
1433  return false;
1434  }
1435  if( has_itype_variant( false ) != rhs.has_itype_variant( false ) ||
1436  ( has_itype_variant( false ) && rhs.has_itype_variant( false ) &&
1437  itype_variant().id != rhs.itype_variant().id ) ) {
1438  return false;
1439  }
1440  return stacks_with( rhs, true, false, false, 0, 999, true );
1441 }
1442 
1443 namespace
1444 {
1445 
1446 bool _stacks_whiteblacklist( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1447 {
1448  bool wbl = false;
1449  if( lhs.get_contents().size() == rhs.get_contents().size() ) {
1450  std::vector<item_pocket const *> const lpkts = lhs.get_all_contained_pockets();
1451  std::vector<item_pocket const *> const rpkts = rhs.get_all_contained_pockets();
1452  if( lpkts.size() == rpkts.size() ) {
1453  wbl = true;
1454  for( std::size_t i = 0; i < lpkts.size(); i++ ) {
1455  wbl &= lpkts[i]->settings.get_item_whitelist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_item_whitelist() &&
1456  lpkts[i]->settings.get_item_blacklist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_item_blacklist() &&
1457  lpkts[i]->settings.get_category_whitelist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_category_whitelist() &&
1458  lpkts[i]->settings.get_category_blacklist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_category_blacklist();
1459  if( !wbl ) {
1460  break;
1461  }
1462  }
1463  }
1464  }
1465  return wbl;
1466 }
1467 
1468 bool _stacks_weapon_mods( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1469 {
1470  item const *const lb = lhs.is_gun() ? lhs.gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) : nullptr;
1471  item const *const rb = rhs.is_gun() ? rhs.gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) : nullptr;
1472  return ( ( lb && rb ) || ( !lb && !rb ) ) &&
1473  lhs.has_flag( flag_REMOVED_STOCK ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_REMOVED_STOCK ) &&
1474  lhs.has_flag( flag_DIAMOND ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_DIAMOND );
1475 }
1476 
1477 bool _stacks_location_hint( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1478 {
1479  static const std::string omt_loc_var = "spawn_location_omt";
1480  const tripoint_abs_omt this_loc( lhs.get_var( omt_loc_var, tripoint_max ) );
1481  const tripoint_abs_omt that_loc( rhs.get_var( omt_loc_var, tripoint_max ) );
1482  if( this_loc == that_loc ) {
1483  return true;
1484  } else if( this_loc.raw() != tripoint_max && that_loc.raw() != tripoint_max ) {
1485  const tripoint_abs_omt player_loc( ms_to_omt_copy( get_map().getabs(
1486  get_player_character().pos() ) ) );
1487  const int this_dist = rl_dist( player_loc, this_loc );
1488  const int that_dist = rl_dist( player_loc, that_loc );
1489  static const auto get_bucket = []( const int dist ) {
1490  if( dist < 1 ) {
1491  return 0;
1492  } else if( dist < 6 ) {
1493  return 1;
1494  } else if( dist < 30 ) {
1495  return 2;
1496  } else {
1497  return 3;
1498  }
1499  };
1500  return get_bucket( this_dist ) == get_bucket( that_dist );
1501  }
1502  return false;
1503 }
1504 
1505 bool _stacks_rot( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool combine_liquid )
1506 {
1507  // Stack items that fall into the same "bucket" of freshness.
1508  // Distant buckets are larger than near ones.
1509  std::pair<int, clipped_unit> my_clipped_time_to_rot =
1510  clipped_time( std::max( lhs.get_shelf_life() - lhs.get_rot(), 0_seconds ) );
1511  std::pair<int, clipped_unit> other_clipped_time_to_rot =
1512  clipped_time( std::max( rhs.get_shelf_life() - rhs.get_rot(), 0_seconds ) );
1513 
1514  return ( ( combine_liquid && lhs.made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) &&
1515  rhs.made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) ||
1516  my_clipped_time_to_rot == other_clipped_time_to_rot ) &&
1517  lhs.rotten() == rhs.rotten();
1518 }
1519 
1520 bool _stacks_mushy_dirty( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1521 {
1522  return lhs.has_flag( flag_MUSHY ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_MUSHY ) &&
1523  lhs.has_own_flag( flag_DIRTY ) == rhs.has_own_flag( flag_DIRTY );
1524 }
1525 
1526 bool _stacks_food_status( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1527 {
1528  return ( lhs.is_fresh() == rhs.is_fresh() || lhs.is_going_bad() == rhs.is_going_bad() ||
1529  lhs.rotten() == rhs.rotten() ) &&
1530  _stacks_mushy_dirty( lhs, rhs );
1531 }
1532 
1533 bool _stacks_food_traits( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1534 {
1535  return ( !lhs.is_food() && !rhs.is_food() ) ||
1536  ( lhs.is_food() && rhs.is_food() &&
1537  lhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_POISON ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_POISON ) &&
1538  lhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_HALLU ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_HALLU ) );
1539 }
1540 
1541 bool _stacks_food_irradiated( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1542 {
1543  return lhs.has_flag( flag_IRRADIATED ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_IRRADIATED );
1544 }
1545 
1546 bool _stacks_food_perishable( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool check_cat )
1547 {
1548  return !check_cat || ( !lhs.is_food() && !rhs.is_food() ) ||
1549  ( lhs.is_food() && rhs.is_food() && lhs.goes_bad() == rhs.goes_bad() &&
1550  lhs.has_flag( flag_INEDIBLE ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_INEDIBLE ) );
1551 }
1552 
1553 bool _stacks_clothing_size( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1554 {
1555  avatar &u = get_avatar();
1556  item::sizing const u_sizing = lhs.get_sizing( u );
1557  return u_sizing == rhs.get_sizing( u ) &&
1558  ( u_sizing == item::sizing::ignore ||
1559  ( lhs.has_flag( flag_FIT ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_FIT ) &&
1560  lhs.has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) ) );
1561 }
1562 
1563 bool _stacks_wetness( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool precise )
1564 {
1565  return lhs.wetness == rhs.wetness || ( !precise && ( lhs.wetness > 0 ) == ( rhs.wetness > 0 ) );
1566 }
1567 
1568 bool _stacks_cbm_status( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1569 {
1570  return ( !lhs.is_bionic() && !rhs.is_bionic() ) ||
1571  ( lhs.is_bionic() && rhs.is_bionic() &&
1572  lhs.has_flag( flag_NO_PACKED ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_NO_PACKED ) &&
1573  lhs.has_flag( flag_NO_STERILE ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_NO_STERILE ) );
1574 }
1575 
1576 bool _stacks_ethereal( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1577 {
1578  static const std::string varname( "ethereal" );
1579  return ( !lhs.ethereal && !rhs.ethereal ) ||
1580  ( lhs. ethereal && rhs.ethereal && lhs.get_var( varname ) == rhs.get_var( varname ) );
1581 }
1582 
1583 bool _stacks_ups( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1584 {
1585  return ( !lhs.is_tool() && !rhs.is_tool() ) ||
1586  ( lhs.is_tool() && rhs.is_tool() &&
1587  lhs.has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) );
1588 }
1589 
1590 bool _stacks_mods( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1591 {
1592  const std::vector<const item *> this_mods = lhs.mods();
1593  const std::vector<const item *> that_mods = rhs.mods();
1594  if( lhs.is_armor() && rhs.is_armor() && lhs.has_clothing_mod() != rhs.has_clothing_mod() ) {
1595  return false;
1596  }
1597  if( this_mods.size() != that_mods.size() ) {
1598  return false;
1599  }
1600  for( const item *it1 : this_mods ) {
1601  bool match = false;
1602  const bool i1_isnull = it1 == nullptr;
1603  for( const item *it2 : that_mods ) {
1604  const bool i2_isnull = it2 == nullptr;
1605  if( i1_isnull != i2_isnull ) {
1606  continue;
1607  } else if( it1 == it2 || it1->typeId() == it2->typeId() ) {
1608  match = true;
1609  break;
1610  }
1611  }
1612  if( !match ) {
1613  return false;
1614  }
1615  }
1616  return true;
1617 }
1618 
1619 bool _stacks_variant( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1620 {
1621  return ( !lhs.has_itype_variant() && !rhs.has_itype_variant() ) ||
1622  ( lhs.has_itype_variant() && rhs.has_itype_variant() &&
1623  lhs.itype_variant().id == rhs.itype_variant().id );
1624 }
1625 
1626 bool _stacks_components( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool check_components )
1627 {
1628  return ( !check_components && !lhs.is_comestible() && !lhs.is_craft() ) ||
1629  // Only check if at least one item isn't using the default recipe or is comestible
1630  ( lhs.components.empty() && rhs.components.empty() ) ||
1631  ( lhs.get_uncraft_components() == rhs.get_uncraft_components() );
1632 }
1633 
1634 } // namespace
1635 
1636 stacking_info item::stacks_with( const item &rhs, bool check_components, bool combine_liquid,
1637  bool check_cat, int depth, int maxdepth, bool precise ) const
1638 {
1639  tname::segment_bitset bits;
1640  if( type == rhs.type ) {
1641  bits.set( tname::segments::TYPE );
1642  bits.set( tname::segments::WHEEL_DIAMETER );
1643  bits.set( tname::segments::WHITEBLACKLIST, _stacks_whiteblacklist( *this, rhs ) );
1644  }
1645 
1646  if( !check_cat && bits.none() ) {
1647  return {};
1648  }
1649 
1650  bits.set( tname::segments::CATEGORY,
1651  !check_cat ||
1652  get_category_of_contents( depth, maxdepth ).get_id() ==
1653  rhs.get_category_of_contents( depth, maxdepth ).get_id() );
1654 
1655  if( check_cat && bits.none() ) {
1656  return {};
1657  }
1658 
1659  bits.set( tname::segments::VARIANT, _stacks_variant( *this, rhs ) );
1660  bool const same_type = bits[tname::segments::TYPE] && bits[tname::segments::VARIANT];
1661 
1662  bits.set( tname::segments::RELIC, is_same_relic( rhs ) );
1663 
1664  // This function is also used to test whether items counted by charges should be merged, for that
1665  // check the, the charges must be ignored. In all other cases (tools/guns), the charges are important.
1666  bits.set( tname::segments::CHARGES,
1667  same_type && ( count_by_charges() || charges == rhs.charges ) );
1668  bits.set( tname::segments::FAVORITE_PRE, is_favorite == rhs.is_favorite );
1669  bits.set( tname::segments::FAVORITE_POST, is_favorite == rhs.is_favorite );
1670  bits.set( tname::segments::DURABILITY,
1671  damage_level( precise ) == rhs.damage_level( precise ) && degradation_ == rhs.degradation_ );
1672  bits.set( tname::segments::BURN, burnt == rhs.burnt );
1673  bits.set( tname::segments::ACTIVE, active == rhs.active );
1674  bits.set( tname::segments::FILTHY, is_filthy() == rhs.is_filthy() );
1675  bits.set( tname::segments::WETNESS, _stacks_wetness( *this, rhs, precise ) );
1676  bits.set( tname::segments::WEAPON_MODS, _stacks_weapon_mods( *this, rhs ) );
1677 
1678  if( combine_liquid && same_type && has_temperature() && made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
1679  // we can combine liquids of same type and different temperatures
1680  bits.set( tname::segments::TAGS, equal_ignoring_elements( rhs.get_flags(), get_flags(),
1681  { flag_COLD, flag_FROZEN, flag_HOT, flag_NO_PARASITES, flag_FROM_FROZEN_LIQUID } ) );
1682  bits.set( tname::segments::TEMPERATURE );
1683  } else {
1684  bits.set( tname::segments::TEMPERATURE, is_same_temperature( rhs ) );
1685  bits.set( tname::segments::TAGS, item_tags == rhs.item_tags );
1686  }
1687 
1688  bits.set( tname::segments::CUSTOM_ITEM_PREFIX, bits[tname::segments::TAGS] );
1689  bits.set( tname::segments::CUSTOM_ITEM_SUFFIX, bits[tname::segments::TAGS] );
1690 
1691  bits.set( tname::segments::FAULTS, faults == rhs.faults );
1692  bits.set( tname::segments::TECHNIQUES, techniques == rhs.techniques );
1693  bits.set( tname::segments::OVERHEAT, overheat_symbol() == rhs.overheat_symbol() );
1694  bits.set( tname::segments::DIRT, get_var( "dirt", 0 ) == rhs.get_var( "dirt", 0 ) );
1695  bits.set( tname::segments::SEALED, all_pockets_sealed() == rhs.all_pockets_sealed() );
1696  bits.set( tname::segments::CBM_STATUS, _stacks_cbm_status( *this, rhs ) );
1697  bits.set( tname::segments::BROKEN, is_broken() == rhs.is_broken() );
1698  bits.set( tname::segments::UPS, _stacks_ups( *this, rhs ) );
1699  // Guns that differ only by dirt/shot_counter can still stack,
1700  // but other item_vars such as label/note will prevent stacking
1701  static const std::set<std::string> ignore_keys = { "dirt", "shot_counter", "spawn_location_omt", "ethereal" };
1702  bits.set( tname::segments::VARS, map_equal_ignoring_keys( item_vars, rhs.item_vars, ignore_keys ) );
1703  bits.set( tname::segments::ETHEREAL, _stacks_ethereal( *this, rhs ) );
1704  bits.set( tname::segments::LOCATION_HINT, _stacks_location_hint( *this, rhs ) );
1705 
1706  bool const this_goes_bad = goes_bad();
1707  bool const that_goes_bad = rhs.goes_bad();
1708  if( this_goes_bad && that_goes_bad ) {
1709  if( same_type ) {
1710  bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_STATUS,
1711  _stacks_rot( *this, rhs, combine_liquid ) && _stacks_mushy_dirty( *this, rhs ) );
1712 
1713  } else {
1714  bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_STATUS, _stacks_food_status( *this, rhs ) );
1715  }
1716  bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_IRRADIATED, _stacks_food_irradiated( *this, rhs ) );
1717  } else if( !this_goes_bad && !that_goes_bad ) {
1718  bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_STATUS );
1719  bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_IRRADIATED );
1720  }
1721 
1722  bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_TRAITS, _stacks_food_traits( *this, rhs ) );
1723  bits.set( tname::segments::CORPSE,
1724  ( corpse == nullptr && rhs.corpse == nullptr ) ||
1725  ( corpse != nullptr && rhs.corpse != nullptr && corpse->id == rhs.corpse->id &&
1726  corpse_name == rhs.corpse_name ) );
1727  bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_PERISHABLE, _stacks_food_perishable( *this, rhs, check_cat ) );
1728  bits.set( tname::segments::CLOTHING_SIZE, _stacks_clothing_size( *this, rhs ) );
1729  bits.set( tname::segments::BROKEN, is_broken() == rhs.is_broken() );
1730  // In-progress crafts are always distinct items. Easier to handle for the player,
1731  // and there shouldn't be that many items of this type around anyway.
1732  bits.set( tname::segments::CRAFT, !craft_data_ && !rhs.craft_data_ );
1733  bits.set( tname::segments::COMPONENTS, same_type &&
1734  _stacks_components( *this, rhs, check_components ) );
1735  bits.set( tname::segments::LINK,
1736  link_length() == rhs.link_length() && max_link_length() == rhs.max_link_length() );
1737  bits.set( tname::segments::MODS, _stacks_mods( *this, rhs ) );
1738  bits.set( tname::segments::last_segment );
1739 
1740  // only check contents if everything else matches
1741  bool const b_contents =
1742  ( bits | tname::tname_contents ).all() && contents.stacks_with( rhs.contents, depth, maxdepth );
1743  bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS, b_contents );
1744  bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS_FULL, b_contents );
1745  bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS_ABREV, b_contents );
1746  bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS_COUNT, b_contents );
1747  return { bits };
1748 }
1749 
1750 bool item::same_contents( const item &rhs ) const
1751 {
1752  return get_contents().same_contents( rhs.get_contents() );
1753 }
1754 
1755 bool item::merge_charges( const item &rhs )
1756 {
1757  if( !count_by_charges() || !stacks_with( rhs ) ) {
1758  return false;
1759  }
1760  // Prevent overflow when either item has "near infinite" charges.
1761  if( charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES / 2 || rhs.charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES / 2 ) {
1762  charges = INFINITE_CHARGES;
1763  return true;
1764  }
1765  // We'll just hope that the item counter represents the same thing for both items
1766  if( item_counter > 0 || rhs.item_counter > 0 ) {
1767  item_counter = ( static_cast<double>( item_counter ) * charges + static_cast<double>
1768  ( rhs.item_counter ) * rhs.charges ) / ( charges + rhs.charges );
1769  }
1770  charges += rhs.charges;
1771  return true;
1772 }
1773 
1774 int item::obtain_cost( const item &it ) const
1775 {
1776  return contents.obtain_cost( it );
1777 }
1778 
1779 int item::insert_cost( const item &it ) const
1780 {
1781  return contents.insert_cost( it );
1782 }
1783 
1784 ret_val<void> item::put_in( const item &payload, pocket_type pk_type,
1785  const bool unseal_pockets, Character *carrier )
1786 {
1787  ret_val<item *> result = contents.insert_item( payload, pk_type, false, unseal_pockets );
1788  if( !result.success() ) {
1789  debugmsg( "tried to put an item (%s) count (%d) in a container (%s) that cannot contain it: %s",
1790  payload.typeId().str(), payload.count(), typeId().str(), result.str() );
1791  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( result.str() );
1792  }
1793  if( pk_type == pocket_type::MOD ) {
1794  update_modified_pockets();
1795  }
1796  if( carrier ) {
1797  result.value()->on_pickup( *carrier );
1798  }
1799  on_contents_changed();
1800  return ret_val<void>::make_success( result.str() );
1801 }
1802 
1803 void item::force_insert_item( const item &it, pocket_type pk_type )
1804 {
1805  contents.force_insert_item( it, pk_type );
1806  update_inherited_flags();
1807 }
1808 
1809 void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const int value )
1810 {
1811  std::ostringstream tmpstream;
1812  tmpstream.imbue( std::locale::classic() );
1813  tmpstream << value;
1814  item_vars[name] = tmpstream.str();
1815 }
1816 
1817 void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const long long value )
1818 {
1819  std::ostringstream tmpstream;
1820  tmpstream.imbue( std::locale::classic() );
1821  tmpstream << value;
1822  item_vars[name] = tmpstream.str();
1823 }
1824 
1825 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-no-long)
1826 void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const long value )
1827 {
1828  std::ostringstream tmpstream;
1829  tmpstream.imbue( std::locale::classic() );
1830  tmpstream << value;
1831  item_vars[name] = tmpstream.str();
1832 }
1833 
1834 void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const double value )
1835 {
1836  item_vars[name] = string_format( "%f", value );
1837 }
1838 
1839 double item::get_var( const std::string &name, const double default_value ) const
1840 {
1841  const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1842  if( it == item_vars.end() ) {
1843  return default_value;
1844  }
1845  const std::string &val = it->second;
1846  char *end;
1847  errno = 0;
1848  double result = strtod( val.data(), &end );
1849  if( errno != 0 ) {
1850  debugmsg( "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s",
1851  val, strerror( errno ) );
1852  return default_value;
1853  }
1854  if( end != val.data() + val.size() ) {
1855  if( *end == ',' ) {
1856  // likely legacy format with localized ',' for fraction separator instead of '.'
1857  std::string converted_val = val;
1858  converted_val[end - val.data()] = '.';
1859  errno = 0;
1860  double result = strtod( converted_val.data(), &end );
1861  if( errno != 0 ) {
1862  debugmsg( "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s",
1863  val, strerror( errno ) );
1864  return default_value;
1865  }
1866  if( end != converted_val.data() + converted_val.size() ) {
1867  debugmsg( "Stray characters at end of floating point value %s in item::get_var", val );
1868  }
1869  return result;
1870  }
1871  debugmsg( "Stray characters at end of floating point value %s in item::get_var", val );
1872  }
1873  return result;
1874 }
1875 
1876 void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const tripoint &value )
1877 {
1878  item_vars[name] = string_format( "%d,%d,%d", value.x, value.y, value.z );
1879 }
1880 
1881 tripoint item::get_var( const std::string &name, const tripoint &default_value ) const
1882 {
1883  const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1884  if( it == item_vars.end() ) {
1885  return default_value;
1886  }
1887  std::vector<std::string> values = string_split( it->second, ',' );
1888  cata_assert( values.size() == 3 );
1889  auto convert_or_error = []( const std::string_view s ) {
1890  ret_val<int> result = try_parse_integer<int>( s, false );
1891  if( result.success() ) {
1892  return result.value();
1893  } else {
1894  debugmsg( "Error parsing tripoint coordinate in item::get_var: %s", result.str() );
1895  return 0;
1896  }
1897  };
1898  return tripoint( convert_or_error( values[0] ),
1899  convert_or_error( values[1] ),
1900  convert_or_error( values[2] ) );
1901 }
1902 
1903 void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const std::string &value )
1904 {
1905  item_vars[name] = value;
1906 }
1907 
1908 std::string item::get_var( const std::string &name, const std::string &default_value ) const
1909 {
1910  const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1911  if( it == item_vars.end() ) {
1912  return default_value;
1913  }
1914  return it->second;
1915 }
1916 
1917 std::string item::get_var( const std::string &name ) const
1918 {
1919  return get_var( name, "" );
1920 }
1921 
1922 std::optional<std::string> item::maybe_get_var( const std::string &name ) const
1923 {
1924  const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1925  return it == item_vars.end() ? std::nullopt : std::optional<std::string> { it->second };
1926 }
1927 
1928 bool item::has_var( const std::string &name ) const
1929 {
1930  return item_vars.count( name ) > 0;
1931 }
1932 
1933 void item::erase_var( const std::string &name )
1934 {
1935  item_vars.erase( name );
1936 }
1937 
1938 void item::clear_vars()
1939 {
1940  item_vars.clear();
1941 }
1942 
1943 // TODO: Get rid of, handle multiple types gracefully
1944 static int get_ranged_pierce( const common_ranged_data &ranged )
1945 {
1946  if( ranged.damage.empty() ) {
1947  return 0;
1948  }
1949 
1950  return ranged.damage.damage_units.front().res_pen;
1951 }
1952 
1953 std::string item::info( bool showtext ) const
1954 {
1955  std::vector<iteminfo> dummy;
1956  return info( showtext, dummy );
1957 }
1958

1960 {
1961  return info( showtext, iteminfo, 1 );
1962 }
1963 
1964 std::string item::info( bool showtext, std::vector<iteminfo> &iteminfo, int batch ) const
1965 {
1966  return info( iteminfo, showtext ? &iteminfo_query::all : &iteminfo_query::notext, batch );
1967 }
1968 
1969 // Generates a long-form description of the freshness of the given rottable food item.
1970 // NB: Doesn't check for non-rottable!
1971 static std::string get_freshness_description( const item &food_item )
1972 {
1973  // So, skilled characters looking at food that is neither super-fresh nor about to rot
1974  // can guess its age as one of {quite fresh,midlife,past midlife,old soon}, and also
1975  // guess about how long until it spoils.
1976  const double rot_progress = food_item.get_relative_rot();
1977  const time_duration shelf_life = food_item.get_shelf_life();
1978  time_duration time_left = shelf_life - ( shelf_life * rot_progress );
1979 
1980  // Correct for an estimate that exceeds shelf life -- this happens especially with
1981  // fresh items.
1982  if( time_left > shelf_life ) {
1983  time_left = shelf_life;
1984  }
1985 
1986  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1987  if( food_item.is_fresh() ) {
1988  // Fresh food is assumed to be obviously so regardless of skill.
1989  if( player_character.can_estimate_rot() ) {
1990  return string_format( _( "* This food looks as <good>fresh</good> as it can be. "
1991  "It still has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." ),
1992  to_string_approx( time_left ) );
1993  } else {
1994  return _( "* This food looks as <good>fresh</good> as it can be." );
1995  }
1996  } else if( food_item.is_going_bad() ) {
1997  // Old food likewise is assumed to be fairly obvious.
1998  if( player_character.can_estimate_rot() ) {
1999  return string_format( _( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "
2000  "It's just <info>%s</info> from becoming inedible." ),
2001  to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2002  } else {
2003  return _( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "
2004  "It's on the brink of becoming inedible." );
2005  }
2006  }
2007 
2008  if( !player_character.can_estimate_rot() ) {
2009  // Unskilled characters only get a hint that more information exists...
2010  return _( "* This food looks <info>fine</info>. If you were more skilled in "
2011  "cooking or survival, you might be able to make a better estimation." );
2012  }
2013 
2014  // Otherwise, a skilled character can determine the below options:
2015  if( rot_progress < 0.3 ) {
2016  //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2017  return string_format( _( "* This food looks <good>quite fresh</good>. "
2018  "It has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." ),
2019  to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2020  } else if( rot_progress < 0.5 ) {
2021  //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2022  return string_format( _( "* This food looks like it is reaching its <neutral>midlife</neutral>. "
2023  "There's <info>%s</info> before it spoils." ),
2024  to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2025  } else if( rot_progress < 0.7 ) {
2026  //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2027  return string_format( _( "* This food looks like it has <neutral>passed its midlife</neutral>. "
2028  "Edible, but will go bad in <info>%s</info>." ),
2029  to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2030  } else {
2031  //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2032  return string_format( _( "* This food looks like it <bad>will be old soon</bad>. "
2033  "It has <info>%s</info>, so if you plan to use it, it's now or never." ),
2034  to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2035  }
2036 }
2037 
2038 item::sizing item::get_sizing( const Character &p ) const
2039 {
2040  const islot_armor *armor_data = find_armor_data();
2041  if( !armor_data ) {
2042  return sizing::ignore;
2043  }
2044  bool to_ignore = true;
2045  for( const armor_portion_data &piece : armor_data->data ) {
2046  if( piece.encumber != 0 ) {
2047  to_ignore = false;
2048  }
2049  }
2050  if( to_ignore ) {
2051  return sizing::ignore;
2052  } else {
2053  const bool small = p.get_size() == creature_size::tiny;
2054 
2055  const bool big = p.get_size() == creature_size::huge;
2056 
2057  if( has_flag( flag_INTEGRATED ) ) {
2058  if( big ) {
2059  return sizing::big_sized_big_char;
2060  } else if( small ) {
2061  return sizing::small_sized_small_char;
2062  } else {
2063  return sizing::human_sized_human_char;
2064  }
2065  }
2066 
2067  // due to the iterative nature of these features, something can fit and be undersized/oversized
2068  // but that is fine because we have separate logic to adjust encumbrance per each. One day we
2069  // may want to have fit be a flag that only applies if a piece of clothing is sized for you as there
2070  // is a bit of cognitive dissonance when something 'fits' and is 'oversized' and the same time
2071  const bool undersize = has_flag( flag_UNDERSIZE );
2072  const bool oversize = has_flag( flag_OVERSIZE );
2073 
2074  if( undersize ) {
2075  if( small ) {
2076  return sizing::small_sized_small_char;
2077  } else if( big ) {
2078  return sizing::small_sized_big_char;
2079  } else {
2080  return sizing::small_sized_human_char;
2081  }
2082  } else if( oversize ) {
2083  if( big ) {
2084  return sizing::big_sized_big_char;
2085  } else if( small ) {
2086  return sizing::big_sized_small_char;
2087  } else {
2088  return sizing::big_sized_human_char;
2089  }
2090  } else {
2091  if( big ) {
2092  return sizing::human_sized_big_char;
2093  } else if( small ) {
2094  return sizing::human_sized_small_char;
2095  } else {
2096  return sizing::human_sized_human_char;
2097  }
2098  }
2099  }
2100 }
2101 
2102 static int get_base_env_resist( const item &it )
2103 {
2104  const islot_armor *t = it.find_armor_data();
2105  if( t == nullptr ) {
2106  if( it.is_pet_armor() ) {
2107  return it.type->pet_armor->env_resist * it.get_relative_health();
2108  } else {
2109  return 0;
2110  }
2111  }
2112 
2113  return t->avg_env_resist() * it.get_relative_health();
2114 }
2115 
2116 bool item::is_owned_by( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
2117 {
2118  // owner.is_null() implies faction_id( "no_faction" ) which shouldn't happen, or no owner at all.
2119  // either way, certain situations this means the thing is available to take.
2120  // in other scenarios we actually really want to check for id == id, even for no_faction
2121  if( get_owner().is_null() ) {
2122  return available_to_take;
2123  }
2124  if( !c.get_faction() ) {
2125  debugmsg( "Character %s has no faction", c.disp_name() );
2126  return false;
2127  }
2128  return c.get_faction()->id == get_owner();
2129 }
2130 
2131 bool item::is_owned_by( const monster &m, bool available_to_take ) const
2132 {
2133  // owner.is_null() implies faction_id( "no_faction" ) which shouldn't happen, or no owner at all.
2134  // either way, certain situations this means the thing is available to take.
2135  // in other scenarios we actually really want to check for id == id, even for no_faction
2136  if( get_owner().is_null() ) {
2137  return available_to_take;
2138  }
2139  for( const std::pair<const faction_id, faction> &fact : g->faction_manager_ptr->all() ) {
2140  if( fact.second.mon_faction != m.faction.id() ) {
2141  continue;
2142  }
2143  return fact.first == get_owner();
2144  }
2145  return false;
2146 }
2147 
2148 bool item::is_old_owner( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
2149 {
2150  if( get_old_owner().is_null() ) {
2151  return available_to_take;
2152  }
2153  if( !c.get_faction() ) {
2154  debugmsg( "Character %s has no faction.", c.disp_name() );
2155  return false;
2156  }
2157  return c.get_faction()->id == get_old_owner();
2158 }
2159 
2160 std::string item::get_old_owner_name() const
2161 {
2162  if( !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_old_owner() ) ) {
2163  debugmsg( "item::get_owner_name() item %s has no valid nor null faction id", tname() );
2164  return "no owner";
2165  }
2166  return g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_old_owner() )->name;
2167 }
2168 
2169 std::string item::get_owner_name() const
2170 {
2171  if( !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_owner() ) ) {
2172  debugmsg( "item::get_owner_name() item %s has no valid nor null faction id ", tname() );
2173  return "no owner";
2174  }
2175  return g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_owner() )->name;
2176 }
2177 
2178 void item::set_owner( const faction_id &new_owner )
2179 {
2180  owner = new_owner;
2181  for( item *e : contents.all_items_top() ) {
2182  e->set_owner( new_owner );
2183  }
2184 }
2185 
2186 void item::set_owner( const Character &c )
2187 {
2188  if( !c.get_faction() ) {
2189  debugmsg( "item::set_owner() Character %s has no valid faction", c.disp_name() );
2190  return;
2191  }
2192  set_owner( c.get_faction()->id );
2193 }
2194 
2195 faction_id item::get_owner() const
2196 {
2197  validate_ownership();
2198  return owner;
2199 }
2200 
2201 faction_id item::get_old_owner() const
2202 {
2203  validate_ownership();
2204  return old_owner;
2205 }
2206 
2207 void item::validate_ownership() const
2208 {
2209  if( !old_owner.is_null() && !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( old_owner, false ) ) {
2210  remove_old_owner();
2211  }
2212  if( !owner.is_null() && !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( owner, false ) ) {
2213  remove_owner();
2214  }
2215 }
2216 
2217 static void insert_separation_line( std::vector<iteminfo> &info )
2218 {
2219  if( info.empty() || info.back().sName != "--" ) {
2220  info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", "--" );
2221  }
2222 }
2223 
2224 /*
2225  * 0 based lookup table of accuracy - monster defense converted into number of hits per 10000
2226  * attacks
2227  * data painstakingly looked up at http://onlinestatbook.com/2/calculators/normal_dist.html
2228  */
2229 static constexpr std::array<double, 41> hits_by_accuracy = {
2230  0, 1, 2, 3, 7, // -20 to -16
2231  13, 26, 47, 82, 139, // -15 to -11
2232  228, 359, 548, 808, 1151, // -10 to -6
2233  1587, 2119, 2743, 3446, 4207, // -5 to -1
2234  5000, // 0
2235  5793, 6554, 7257, 7881, 8413, // 1 to 5
2236  8849, 9192, 9452, 9641, 9772, // 6 to 10
2237  9861, 9918, 9953, 9974, 9987, // 11 to 15
2238  9993, 9997, 9998, 9999, 10000 // 16 to 20
2239 };
2240 
2241 double item::effective_dps( const Character &guy, Creature &mon ) const
2242 {
2243  const float mon_dodge = mon.get_dodge();
2244  float base_hit = guy.get_dex() / 4.0f + guy.get_hit_weapon( *this );
2245  base_hit *= std::max( 0.25f, 1.0f - guy.avg_encumb_of_limb_type( body_part_type::type::torso ) /
2246  100.0f );
2247  float mon_defense = mon_dodge + mon.size_melee_penalty() / 5.0f;
2248  constexpr double hit_trials = 10000.0;
2249  const int rng_mean = std::max( std::min( static_cast<int>( base_hit - mon_defense ), 20 ),
2250  -20 ) + 20;
2251  double num_all_hits = hits_by_accuracy[ rng_mean ];
2252  /* critical hits have two chances to occur: triple critical hits happen much less frequently,
2253  * and double critical hits can only occur if a hit roll is more than 1.5 * monster dodge.
2254  * Not the hit roll used to determine the attack, another one.
2255  * the way the math works, some percentage of the total hits are eligible to be double
2256  * critical hits, and the rest are eligible to be triple critical hits, but in each case,
2257  * only some small percent of them actually become critical hits.
2258  */
2259  const int rng_high_mean = std::max( std::min( static_cast<int>( base_hit - 1.5 * mon_dodge ),
2260  20 ), -20 ) + 20;
2261  double num_high_hits = hits_by_accuracy[ rng_high_mean ] * num_all_hits / hit_trials;
2262  double double_crit_chance = guy.crit_chance( 4, 0, *this );
2263  double crit_chance = guy.crit_chance( 0, 0, *this );
2264  double num_low_hits = std::max( 0.0, num_all_hits - num_high_hits );
2265 
2266  double moves_per_attack = guy.attack_speed( *this );
2267  // attacks that miss do no damage but take time
2268  double total_moves = ( hit_trials - num_all_hits ) * moves_per_attack;
2269  double total_damage = 0.0;
2270  double num_crits = std::min( num_low_hits * crit_chance + num_high_hits * double_crit_chance,
2271  num_all_hits );
2272  // critical hits are counted separately
2273  double num_hits = num_all_hits - num_crits;
2274  // sum average damage past armor and return the number of moves required to achieve
2275  // that damage
2276  const auto calc_effective_damage = [ &, moves_per_attack]( const double num_strikes,
2277  const bool crit, const Character & guy, Creature & mon ) {
2278  bodypart_id bp = bodypart_id( "torso" );
2279  Creature *temp_mon = &mon;
2280  double subtotal_damage = 0;
2281  damage_instance base_damage;
2282  guy.roll_all_damage( crit, base_damage, true, *this, "WEAPON", &mon, bp );
2283  damage_instance dealt_damage = base_damage;
2284  // TODO: Modify DPS calculation to consider weakpoints.
2285  resistances r = resistances( *static_cast<monster *>( temp_mon ) );
2286  for( damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_damage.damage_units ) {
2287  dmg_unit.amount -= std::min( r.get_effective_resist( dmg_unit ), dmg_unit.amount );
2288  }
2289 
2290  dealt_damage_instance dealt_dams;
2291  for( const damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_damage.damage_units ) {
2292  int cur_damage = 0;
2293  int total_pain = 0;
2294  temp_mon->deal_damage_handle_type( effect_source::empty(), dmg_unit, bp,
2295  cur_damage, total_pain );
2296  if( cur_damage > 0 ) {
2297  dealt_dams.dealt_dams[dmg_unit.type] += cur_damage;
2298  }
2299  }
2300  double damage_per_hit = dealt_dams.total_damage();
2301  subtotal_damage = damage_per_hit * num_strikes;
2302  double subtotal_moves = moves_per_attack * num_strikes;
2303 
2304  if( has_technique( RAPID ) ) {
2305  Creature *temp_rs_mon = &mon;
2306  damage_instance rs_base_damage;
2307  guy.roll_all_damage( crit, rs_base_damage, true, *this, "WEAPON", &mon, bp );
2308  damage_instance dealt_rs_damage = rs_base_damage;
2309  for( damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_rs_damage.damage_units ) {
2310  dmg_unit.damage_multiplier *= 0.66;
2311  }
2312  // TODO: Modify DPS calculation to consider weakpoints.
2313  resistances rs_r = resistances( *static_cast<monster *>( temp_rs_mon ) );
2314  for( damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_rs_damage.damage_units ) {
2315  dmg_unit.amount -= std::min( rs_r.get_effective_resist( dmg_unit ), dmg_unit.amount );
2316  }
2317  dealt_damage_instance rs_dealt_dams;
2318  for( const damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_rs_damage.damage_units ) {
2319  int cur_damage = 0;
2320  int total_pain = 0;
2321  temp_rs_mon->deal_damage_handle_type( effect_source::empty(), dmg_unit, bp,
2322  cur_damage, total_pain );
2323  if( cur_damage > 0 ) {
2324  rs_dealt_dams.dealt_dams[dmg_unit.type] += cur_damage;
2325  }
2326  }
2327  double rs_damage_per_hit = rs_dealt_dams.total_damage();
2328  subtotal_moves *= 0.5;
2329  subtotal_damage *= 0.5;
2330  subtotal_moves += moves_per_attack * num_strikes * 0.33;
2331  subtotal_damage += rs_damage_per_hit * num_strikes * 0.5;
2332  }
2333  return std::make_pair( subtotal_moves, subtotal_damage );
2334  };
2335  std::pair<double, double> crit_summary = calc_effective_damage( num_crits, true, guy, mon );
2336  total_moves += crit_summary.first;
2337  total_damage += crit_summary.second;
2338  std::pair<double, double> summary = calc_effective_damage( num_hits, false, guy, mon );
2339  total_moves += summary.first;
2340  total_damage += summary.second;
2341  return total_damage * to_moves<double>( 1_seconds ) / total_moves;
2342 }
2343 
2344 struct dps_comp_data {
2345  mtype_id mon_id;
2346  bool display;
2347  bool evaluate;
2348 };
2349 
2350 static const std::vector<std::pair<translation, dps_comp_data>> dps_comp_monsters = {
2351  { to_translation( "Best" ), { pseudo_debug_mon, true, false } },
2352  { to_translation( "Vs. Agile" ), { mon_zombie_smoker, true, true } },
2353  { to_translation( "Vs. Armored" ), { mon_zombie_soldier_no_weakpoints, true, true } },
2354  { to_translation( "Vs. Mixed" ), { mon_zombie_survivor_no_weakpoints, false, true } },
2355 };
2356 
2357 std::map<std::string, double> item::dps( const bool for_display, const bool for_calc,
2358  const Character &guy ) const
2359 {
2360  std::map<std::string, double> results;
2361  for( const std::pair<translation, dps_comp_data> &comp_mon : dps_comp_monsters ) {
2362  if( ( comp_mon.second.display != for_display ) &&
2363  ( comp_mon.second.evaluate != for_calc ) ) {
2364  continue;
2365  }
2366  monster test_mon = monster( comp_mon.second.mon_id );
2367  results[ comp_mon.first.translated() ] = effective_dps( guy, test_mon );
2368  }
2369  return results;
2370 }
2371 
2372 std::map<std::string, double> item::dps( const bool for_display, const bool for_calc ) const
2373 {
2374  return dps( for_display, for_calc, get_avatar() );
2375 }
2376 
2377 double item::average_dps( const Character &guy ) const
2378 {
2379  double dmg_count = 0.0;
2380  const std::map<std::string, double> &dps_data = dps( false, true, guy );
2381  for( const std::pair<const std::string, double> &dps_entry : dps_data ) {
2382  dmg_count += dps_entry.second;
2383  }
2384  return dmg_count / dps_data.size();
2385 }
2386 
2387 void item::basic_info( std::vector<iteminfo> &info, const iteminfo_query *parts, int batch,
2388  bool /* debug */ ) const
2389 {
2390  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_MOD_SRC ) ) {
2391  info.emplace_back( "BASE", string_format( _( "Origin: %s" ), enumerate_as_string( type->src,
2392  []( const std::pair<itype_id, mod_id> &source ) {
2393  return string_format( "'%s'", source.second->name() );
2394  }, enumeration_conjunction::arrow ) ) );
2395  insert_separation_line( info );
2396  }
2397 
2398  const std::string space = " ";
2399  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_MATERIAL ) ) {
2400  const std::vector<const material_type *> mat_types = made_of_types();
2401  if( !mat_types.empty() ) {
2402  const std::string material_list = enumerate_as_string( mat_types,
2403  []( const material_type * material ) {
2404  return string_format( "<stat>%s</stat>", material->name() );
2405  }, enumeration_conjunction::none );
2406  info.emplace_back( "BASE", string_format( _( "Material: %s" ), material_list ) );
2407  }
2408  }
2409  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_VOLUME ) ) {
2410  info.push_back( vol_to_info( "BASE", _( "Volume: " ), volume() * batch, 3 ) );
2411  }
2412  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_WEIGHT ) ) {
2413  info.push_back( weight_to_info( "BASE", space + _( "Weight: " ), weight() * batch ) );
2414  info.back().bNewLine = true;
2415  }
2416  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_LENGTH ) && length() > 0_mm ) {
2417  info.emplace_back( "BASE", _( "Length: " ),
2418  string_format( "<num> %s", length_units( length() ) ),
2419  iteminfo::lower_is_better,
2420  convert_length( length() ), length().value() );
2421  }
2422  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_OWNER ) && !owner.is_null() ) {
2423  info.emplace_back( "BASE", string_format( _( "Owner: %s" ),
2424  _( get_owner_name() ) ) );
2425  }
2426  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_CATEGORY ) ) {
2427  info.emplace_back( "BASE", _( "Category: " ),
2428  "<header>" + get_category_shallow().name_header() + "</header>" );
2429  }
2430 
2431  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION ) ) {
2432  insert_separation_line( info );
2433  const std::map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator idescription =
2434  item_vars.find( "description" );
2435  const std::optional<translation> snippet = SNIPPET.get_snippet_by_id( snip_id );
2436  if( snippet.has_value() ) {
2437  // Just use the dynamic description
2438  info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", snippet.value().translated() );
2439 
2440  // only ever do the effect for a snippet the first time you see it
2441  if( !get_avatar().has_seen_snippet( snip_id ) ) {
2442  // Have looked at the item so call the on examine EOC for the snippet
2443  const std::optional<talk_effect_t> examine_effect = SNIPPET.get_EOC_by_id( snip_id );
2444  if( examine_effect.has_value() ) {
2445  // activate the effect
2446  dialogue d( get_talker_for( get_avatar() ), nullptr );
2447  examine_effect.value().apply( d );
2448  }
2449 
2450  //note that you have seen the snippet
2451  get_avatar().add_snippet( snip_id );
2452  }
2453  } else if( idescription != item_vars.end() ) {
2454  info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", idescription->second );
2455  } else if( has_itype_variant() ) {
2456  info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", variant_description() );
2457  } else {
2458  if( has_flag( flag_MAGIC_FOCUS ) ) {
2459  info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
2460  _( "This item is a <info>magical focus</info>. "
2461  "You can cast spells with it in your hand." ) );
2462  }
2463  if( is_craft() ) {
2464  const std::string desc = ( typeId() == itype_disassembly ) ?
2465  _( "This is an in progress disassembly of %s. "
2466  "It is %d percent complete." ) : _( "This is an in progress %s. "
2467  "It is %d percent complete." );
2468  const int percent_progress = item_counter / 100000;
2469  info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", string_format( desc,
2470  craft_data_->making->result_name(),
2471  percent_progress ) );
2472  } else {
2473  info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", type->description.translated() );
2474  }
2475  }
2476  insert_separation_line( info );
2477  }
2478 
2479  insert_separation_line( info );
2480 
2481  if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_REQUIREMENTS ) ) {
2482  // Display any minimal stat or skill requirements for the item
2483  std::vector<std::string> req;
2484  if( get_min_str() > 0 ) {
2485  req.push_back( string_format( "%s %d", _( "strength" ), get_min_str() ) );
2486  }
2487  if( type->min_dex > 0 ) {
2488  req.push_back( string_format( "%s %d", _( "dexterity" ), type->min_dex ) );
2489  }
2490  if( type->min_int > 0 ) {
2491  req.push_back( string_format( "%s %d", _( "intelligence" ), type->min_int ) );
2492  }
2493  if( type->min_per > 0 ) {
2494  req.push_back( string_format( "%s %d", _( "perception" ), type->min_per ) );
2495  }
2496  for( const std::pair<skill_id, int> &sk : sorted_lex( type->min_skills ) ) {
2497  req.push_back( string_format( "%s %d", sk.first->name(), sk.second ) );
2498  }
2499  if( !req.empty() ) {
2500  info.emplace_back( "BASE", _( "<bold>Minimum requirements</bold>:" ) );
2501  info.emplace_back( "BASE", enumerate_as_string( req ) );
2502  insert_separation_line( info );
2503  }
2504  }
2505 
2506  if( has_var( "contained_name" ) && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_CONTENTS ) ) {
2507  info.emplace_back( "BASE", string_format( _( "Contains: %s" ),
