6360  switch( rating.value() ) {
6361  case EDIBLE:
6362  case TOO_FULL:
6363  ret = c_cyan;
6364 
6365  // Show old items as yellow
6366  if( is_going_bad() ) {
6367  ret = c_yellow;
6368  }
6369  // Show perishables as a separate color
6370  else if( goes_bad() ) {
6371  ret = c_light_cyan;
6372  }
6373 
6374  break;
6375  case INEDIBLE:
6376  case INEDIBLE_MUTATION:
6377  ret = c_dark_gray;
6378  break;
6379  case ALLERGY:
6380  case ALLERGY_WEAK:
6381  case CANNIBALISM:
6382  case PARASITES:
6383  ret = c_red;
6384  break;
6385  case ROTTEN:
6386  ret = c_brown;
6387  break;
6388  case NAUSEA:
6389  ret = c_pink;
6390  break;
6391  case NO_TOOL:
6392  break;
6393  }
6394  } else if( is_gun() ) {
6395  // Guns are green if you are carrying ammo for them
6396  // ltred if you have ammo but no mags
6397  // Gun with integrated mag counts as both
6398  for( const ammotype &at : ammo_types() ) {
6399  // get_ammo finds uncontained ammo, find_ammo finds ammo in magazines
6400  bool has_ammo = !player_character.get_ammo( at ).empty() ||
6401  !player_character.find_ammo( *this, false, -1 ).empty();
6402  bool has_mag = magazine_integral() || !player_character.find_ammo( *this, true, -1 ).empty();
6403  if( has_ammo && has_mag ) {
6404  ret = c_green;
6405  break;
6406  } else if( has_ammo || has_mag ) {
6407  ret = c_light_red;
6408  break;
6409  }
6410  }
6411  } else if( is_ammo() ) {
6412  // Likewise, ammo is green if you have guns that use it
6413  // ltred if you have the gun but no mags
6414  // Gun with integrated mag counts as both
6415  bool has_gun = player_character.cache_has_item_with( "is_gun", &item::is_gun,
6416  [this]( const item & i ) {
6417  return i.ammo_types().count( ammo_type() );
6418  } );
6419  bool has_mag = player_character.cache_has_item_with( "is_gun", &item::is_gun,
6420  [this]( const item & i ) {
6421  return i.magazine_integral() && i.ammo_types().count( ammo_type() );
6422  } );
6423  has_mag = has_mag ? true :
6424  player_character.cache_has_item_with( "is_magazine", &item::is_magazine,
6425  [this]( const item & i ) {
6426  return i.ammo_types().count( ammo_type() );
6427  } );
6428 
6429  if( has_gun && has_mag ) {
6430  ret = c_green;
6431  } else if( has_gun || has_mag ) {
6432  ret = c_light_red;
6433  }
6434  } else if( is_magazine() ) {
6435  // Magazines are green if you have guns and ammo for them
6436  // ltred if you have one but not the other
6437  bool has_gun = player_character.cache_has_item_with( "is_gun", &item::is_gun,
6438  [this]( const item & it ) {
6439  return it.magazine_compatible().count( typeId() ) > 0;
6440  } );
6441  bool has_ammo = !player_character.find_ammo( *this, false, -1 ).empty();
6442  if( has_gun && has_ammo ) {
6443  ret = c_green;
6444  } else if( has_gun || has_ammo ) {
6445  ret = c_light_red;
6446  }
6447  } else if( is_book() ) {
6448  const islot_book &tmp = *type->book;
6449  if( player_character.has_identified( typeId() ) ) {
6450  if( tmp.skill && // Book can improve skill: blue
6451  player_character.get_skill_level_object( tmp.skill ).can_train() &&
6452  player_character.get_knowledge_level( tmp.skill ) >= tmp.req &&
6453  player_character.get_knowledge_level( tmp.skill ) < tmp.level
6454  ) { //NOLINT(bugprone-branch-clone)
6455  ret = c_light_blue;
6456  } else if( type->can_use( "MA_MANUAL" ) &&
6457  !player_character.martial_arts_data->has_martialart( martial_art_learned_from( *type ) ) ) {
6458  ret = c_light_blue;
6459  } else if( tmp.skill && // Book can't improve skill right now, but maybe later: pink
6460  player_character.get_skill_level_object( tmp.skill ).can_train() &&
6461  player_character.get_knowledge_level( tmp.skill ) < tmp.level ) {
6462  ret = c_pink;
6463  } else if( !player_character.studied_all_recipes(
6464  *type ) ) { // Book can't improve skill anymore, but has more recipes: yellow
6465  ret = c_yellow;
6466  }
6467  } else if( ( tmp.skill || type->can_use( "MA_MANUAL" ) ) ||
6468  !player_character.studied_all_recipes( *type ) ) {
6469  // Book can teach you something and hasn't been identified yet
6470  ret = c_red;
6471  } else {
6472  // "just for fun" book that they haven't read yet
6473  ret = c_light_red;
6474  }
6475  }
6476  return ret;
6477 }
6478 
6479 void item::on_wear( Character &p )
6480 {
6481  if( is_sided() && get_side() == side::BOTH ) {
6482  if( has_flag( flag_SPLINT ) ) {
6483  set_side( side::LEFT );
6484  if( ( covers( bodypart_id( "leg_l" ) ) && p.is_limb_broken( bodypart_id( "leg_r" ) ) &&
6485  !p.worn_with_flag( flag_SPLINT, bodypart_id( "leg_r" ) ) ) ||
6486  ( covers( bodypart_id( "arm_l" ) ) && p.is_limb_broken( bodypart_id( "arm_r" ) ) &&
6487  !p.worn_with_flag( flag_SPLINT, bodypart_id( "arm_r" ) ) ) ) {
6488  set_side( side::RIGHT );
6489  }
6490  } else if( has_flag( flag_TOURNIQUET ) ) {
6491  set_side( side::LEFT );
6492  if( ( covers( bodypart_id( "leg_l" ) ) &&
6493  p.has_effect( effect_bleed, body_part_leg_r ) &&
6494  !p.worn_with_flag( flag_TOURNIQUET, bodypart_id( "leg_r" ) ) ) ||
6495  ( covers( bodypart_id( "arm_l" ) ) && p.has_effect( effect_bleed, body_part_arm_r ) &&
6496  !p.worn_with_flag( flag_TOURNIQUET, bodypart_id( "arm_r" ) ) ) ) {
6497  set_side( side::RIGHT );
6498  }
6499  } else {
6500  // for sided items wear the item on the side which results in least encumbrance
6501  int lhs = 0;
6502  int rhs = 0;
6503  set_side( side::LEFT );
6504  for( const bodypart_id &bp : p.get_all_body_parts() ) {
6505  lhs += p.get_part_encumbrance_data( bp ).encumbrance;
6506  }
6507 
6508  set_side( side::RIGHT );
6509  for( const bodypart_id &bp : p.get_all_body_parts() ) {
6510  rhs += p.get_part_encumbrance_data( bp ).encumbrance;
6511  }
6512 
6513  set_side( lhs <= rhs ? side::LEFT : side::RIGHT );
6514  }
6515  }
6516 
6517  // if game is loaded - don't want ownership assigned during char creation
6518  if( get_player_character().getID().is_valid() ) {
6519  handle_pickup_ownership( p );
6520  }
6521  p.on_item_acquire( *this );
6522  p.on_item_wear( *this );
6523 }
6524 
6525 void item::on_takeoff( Character &p )
6526 {
6527  p.on_item_takeoff( *this );
6528 
6529  if( is_sided() ) {
6530  set_side( side::BOTH );
6531  }
6532  // reset any pockets to not have restrictions
6533  if( is_ablative() ) {
6534  for( item_pocket *pocket : get_all_standard_pockets() ) {
6535  pocket->set_no_rigid( {} );
6536  }
6537  }
6538 }
6539 
6540 int item::on_wield_cost( const Character &you ) const
6541 {
6542  int mv = 0;
6543  // weapons with bayonet/bipod or other generic "unhandiness"
6544  if( has_flag( flag_SLOW_WIELD ) && !is_gunmod() ) {
6545  float d = 32.0f; // arbitrary linear scaling factor
6546  if( is_gun() ) {
6547  d /= std::max( you.get_skill_level( gun_skill() ), 1.0f );
6548  } else if( is_melee() ) {
6549  d /= std::max( you.get_skill_level( melee_skill() ), 1.0f );
6550  }
6551 
6552  int penalty = get_var( "volume", volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor ) * d;
6553  mv += penalty;
6554  }
6555 
6556  // firearms with a folding stock or tool/melee without collapse/retract iuse
6557  if( has_flag( flag_NEEDS_UNFOLD ) && !is_gunmod() ) {
6558  int penalty = 50; // 200-300 for guns, 50-150 for melee, 50 as fallback
6559  if( is_gun() ) {
6560  penalty = std::max( 0, 300 - static_cast<int>( you.get_skill_level( gun_skill() ) * 10 ) );
6561  } else if( is_melee() ) {
6562  penalty = std::max( 0, 150 - static_cast<int>( you.get_skill_level( melee_skill() ) * 10 ) );
6563  }
6564 
6565  mv += penalty;
6566  }
6567  return mv;
6568 }
6569 
6570 void item::on_wield( Character &you )
6571 {
6572  int wield_cost = on_wield_cost( you );
6573  you.mod_moves( -wield_cost );
6574 
6575  std::string msg;
6576 
6577  msg = _( "You wield your %s." );
6578 
6579  // if game is loaded - don't want ownership assigned during char creation
6580  if( get_player_character().getID().is_valid() ) {
6581  handle_pickup_ownership( you );
6582  }
6583  you.add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, msg, tname() );
6584 
6585  if( !you.martial_arts_data->selected_is_none() ) {
6586  you.martial_arts_data->martialart_use_message( you );
6587  }
6588 
6589  // Update encumbrance and discomfort in case we were wearing it
6590  you.flag_encumbrance();
6591  you.calc_discomfort();
6592  you.on_item_acquire( *this );
6593 }
6594 
6595 void item::handle_pickup_ownership( Character &c )
6596 {
6597  if( is_owned_by( c ) ) {
6598  return;
6599  }
6600  // Add ownership to item if unowned
6601  if( owner.is_null() ) {
6602  set_owner( c );
6603  } else {
6604  if( !is_owned_by( c ) && c.is_avatar() ) {
6605  const auto sees_stealing = [&c, this]( const Creature & cr ) {
6606  const npc *const as_npc = cr.as_npc();
6607  const monster *const as_monster = cr.as_monster();
6608  bool owned_by = false;
6609  if( as_npc ) {
6610  owned_by = is_owned_by( *as_npc );
6611  } else if( as_monster ) {
6612  owned_by = is_owned_by( *as_monster );
6613  }
6614  return &cr != &c && owned_by && rl_dist( cr.pos(), c.pos() ) < MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE &&
6615  cr.sees( c.pos() );
6616  };
6617  const auto sort_criteria = []( const Creature * lhs, const Creature * rhs ) {
6618  const npc *const lnpc = lhs->as_npc();
6619  const npc *const rnpc = rhs->as_npc();
6620  if( !lnpc && !rnpc ) {
6621  const monster *const lmon = lhs->as_monster();
6622  const monster *const rmon = rhs->as_monster();
6623  // Sort more difficult monsters first
6624  return ( lmon ? lmon->type->difficulty : 0 ) > ( rmon ? rmon->type->difficulty : 0 );
6625  } else if( lnpc && !rnpc ) {
6626  return true;
6627  } else if( !lnpc && rnpc ) {
6628  return false;
6629  }
6630  return npc::theft_witness_compare( lnpc, rnpc );
6631  };
6632  std::vector<Creature *> witnesses = g->get_creatures_if( sees_stealing );
6633  std::sort( witnesses.begin(), witnesses.end(), sort_criteria );
6634  for( Creature *c : witnesses ) {
6635  const npc *const elem = c->as_npc();
6636  if( !elem ) {
6637  // Sorted to have NPCs first
6638  break;
6639  }
6640  elem->say( "<witnessed_thievery>", 7 );
6641  }
6642  if( !witnesses.empty() ) {
6643  set_old_owner( get_owner() );
6644  witnesses[0]->witness_thievery( this );
6645  }
6646  set_owner( c );
6647  }
6648  }
6649 }
6650 
6651 void item::on_pickup( Character &p )
6652 {
6653  // Fake characters are used to determine pickup weight and volume
6654  if( p.is_fake() ) {
6655  return;
6656  }
6657  // if game is loaded - don't want ownership assigned during char creation
6658  if( get_player_character().getID().is_valid() ) {
6659  handle_pickup_ownership( p );
6660  }
6661  contents.on_pickup( p, this );
6662 
6663  p.flag_encumbrance();
6664  p.on_item_acquire( *this );
6665 }
6666 
6667 void item::update_inherited_flags()
6668 {
6669  inherited_tags_cache.clear();
6670 
6671  auto const inehrit_flags = [this]( FlagsSetType const & Flags ) {
6672  for( flag_id const &f : Flags ) {
6673  if( f->inherit() ) {
6674  inherited_tags_cache.emplace( f );
6675  }
6676  }
6677  };
6678 
6679  for( const item *e : is_gun() ? gunmods() : toolmods() ) {
6680  // gunmods fired separately do not contribute to base gun flags
6681  if( !e->is_gun() ) {
6682  inehrit_flags( e->get_flags() );
6683  inehrit_flags( e->type->get_flags() );
6684  }
6685  }
6686 
6687  for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_contained_pockets() ) {
6688  if( pocket->inherits_flags() ) {
6689  for( const item *e : pocket->all_items_top() ) {
6690  inehrit_flags( e->get_flags() );
6691  inehrit_flags( e->type->get_flags() );
6692  }
6693  }
6694  }
6695  update_prefix_suffix_flags();
6696 }
6697 
6698 void item::update_prefix_suffix_flags()
6699 {
6700  prefix_tags_cache.clear();
6701  suffix_tags_cache.clear();
6702  auto const insert_prefix_suffix_flags = [this]( FlagsSetType const & Flags ) {
6703  for( flag_id const &f : Flags ) {
6704  update_prefix_suffix_flags( f );
6705  }
6706  };
6707  insert_prefix_suffix_flags( get_flags() );
6708  insert_prefix_suffix_flags( type->get_flags() );
6709  insert_prefix_suffix_flags( inherited_tags_cache );
6710 }
6711 
6712 void item::update_prefix_suffix_flags( const flag_id &f )
6713 {
6714  if( !f->item_prefix().empty() ) {
6715  prefix_tags_cache.emplace( f );
6716  }
6717  if( !f->item_suffix().empty() ) {
6718  suffix_tags_cache.emplace( f );
6719  }
6720 }
6721 
6722 void item::on_contents_changed()
6723 {
6724  contents.update_open_pockets();
6725  cached_relative_encumbrance.reset();
6726  encumbrance_update_ = true;
6727  update_inherited_flags();
6728  cached_category.timestamp = calendar::turn_max;
6729  if( empty_container() ) {
6730  clear_automatic_whitelist();
6731  }
6732 }
6733 
6734 std::string item::dirt_symbol() const
6735 {
6736  // these symbols are unicode square characters of different heights, representing a rough
6737  // estimation of fouling in a gun. This appears instead of "faulty" since most guns will
6738  // have some level of fouling in them, and usually it is not a big deal.
6739  switch( static_cast<int>( get_var( "dirt", 0 ) / 2000 ) ) {
6740  // *INDENT-OFF*
6741  case 1: return "<color_white>\u2581</color>";
6742  case 2: return "<color_light_gray>\u2583</color>";
6743  case 3: return "<color_light_gray>\u2585</color>";
6744  case 4: return "<color_dark_gray>\u2587</color>";
6745  case 5: return "<color_brown>\u2588</color>";
6746  default: return "";
6747  // *INDENT-ON*
6748  }
6749 }
6750 
6751 std::string item::overheat_symbol() const
6752 {
6753 
6754  if( !is_gun() || type->gun->overheat_threshold <= 0.0 ) {
6755  return "";
6756  }
6757  double modifier = 0;
6758  float multiplier = 1.0f;
6759  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
6760  modifier += mod->type->gunmod->overheat_threshold_modifier;
6761  multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->overheat_threshold_multiplier;
6762  }
6763  if( faults.count( fault_overheat_safety ) ) {
6764  return string_format( _( "<color_light_green>\u2588VNT </color>" ) );
6765  }
6766  switch( std::min( 5, static_cast<int>( get_var( "gun_heat",
6767  0 ) / std::max( type->gun->overheat_threshold * multiplier + modifier, 5.0 ) * 5.0 ) ) ) {
6768  case 1:
6769  return "";
6770  case 2:
6771  return string_format( _( "<color_yellow>\u2583HEAT </color>" ) );
6772  case 3:
6773  return string_format( _( "<color_light_red>\u2585HEAT </color>" ) );
6774  case 4:
6775  return string_format( _( "<color_red>\u2587HEAT! </color>" ) ); // NOLINT(cata-text-style)
6776  case 5:
6777  return string_format( _( "<color_pink>\u2588HEAT!! </color>" ) ); // NOLINT(cata-text-style)
6778  default:
6779  return "";
6780  }
6781 }
6782 
6783 std::string item::degradation_symbol() const
6784 {
6785  const int inc = max_damage() / 5;
6786  const int dgr_lvl = degradation() / ( inc > 0 ? inc : 1 );
6787  std::string dgr_symbol;
6788 
6789  switch( dgr_lvl ) {
6790  case 0:
6791  dgr_symbol = colorize( "\u2588", c_light_green );
6792  break;
6793  case 1:
6794  dgr_symbol = colorize( "\u2587", c_yellow );
6795  break;
6796  case 2:
6797  dgr_symbol = colorize( "\u2585", c_magenta );
6798  break;
6799  case 3:
6800  dgr_symbol = colorize( "\u2583", c_light_red );
6801  break;
6802  default:
6803  dgr_symbol = colorize( "\u2581", c_red );
6804  break;
6805  }
6806  return type->degrade_increments() == 0 ? "" : dgr_symbol;
6807 }
6808 
6809 std::string item::tname( unsigned int quantity, bool with_prefix ) const
6810 {
6811  return tname( quantity, with_prefix ? tname::default_tname : tname::unprefixed_tname );
6812 }
6813 
6814 std::string item::tname( unsigned int quantity, tname::segment_bitset const &segments ) const
6815 {
6816  std::string ret;
6817 
6818  for( size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>( tname::segments::last_segment ); i++ ) {
6819  tname::segments const idx = static_cast<tname::segments>( i );
6820  if( !segments[idx] ) {
6821  continue;
6822  }
6823  ret += tname::print_segment( idx, *this, quantity, segments );
6824  }
6825 
6826  if( item_vars.find( "item_note" ) != item_vars.end() ) {
6827  //~ %s is an item name. This style is used to denote items with notes.
6828  return string_format( _( "*%s*" ), ret );
6829  }
6830 
6831  return ret;
6832 }
6833 
6834 std::string item::display_money( unsigned int quantity, unsigned int total,
6835  const std::optional<unsigned int> &selected ) const
6836 {
6837  if( selected ) {
6838  //~ This is a string to display the selected and total amount of money in a stack of cash cards.
6839  //~ %1$s is the display name of cash cards.
6840  //~ %2$s is the total amount of money.
6841  //~ %3$s is the selected amount of money.
6842  //~ Example: "cash cards $15.35 of $20.48"
6843  return string_format( pgettext( "cash card and money", "%1$s %3$s of %2$s" ), tname( quantity ),
6844  format_money( total ), format_money( *selected ) );
6845  } else {
6846  //~ This is a string to display the total amount of money in a stack of cash cards.
6847  //~ %1$s is the display name of cash cards.
6848  //~ %2$s is the total amount of money on the cash cards.
6849  //~ Example: "cash cards $20.48"
6850  return string_format( pgettext( "cash card and money", "%1$s %2$s" ), tname( quantity ),
6851  format_money( total ) );
6852  }
6853 }
6854 
6855 std::string item::display_name( unsigned int quantity ) const
6856 {
6857  std::string name = tname( quantity );
6858  std::string sidetxt;
6859  std::string amt;
6860  std::string cable;
6861 
6862  switch( get_side() ) {
6863  case side::BOTH:
6864  case side::num_sides:
6865  break;
6866  case side::LEFT:
6867  sidetxt = string_format( " (%s)", _( "left" ) );
6868  break;
6869  case side::RIGHT:
6870  sidetxt = string_format( " (%s)", _( "right" ) );
6871  break;
6872  }
6873  avatar &player_character = get_avatar();
6874  int amount = 0;
6875  int max_amount = 0;
6876  bool show_amt = false;
6877  // We should handle infinite charges properly in all cases.
6878  if( is_book() && get_chapters() > 0 ) {
6879  // a book which has remaining unread chapters
6880  amount = get_remaining_chapters( player_character );
6881  } else if( magazine_current() ) {
6882  show_amt = true;
6883  const item *mag = magazine_current();
6884  amount = ammo_remaining();
6885  const itype *adata = mag->ammo_data();
6886  if( adata ) {
6887  max_amount = mag->ammo_capacity( adata->ammo->type );
6888  } else {
6889  max_amount = mag->ammo_capacity( item_controller->find_template(
6890  mag->ammo_default() )->ammo->type );
6891  }
6892 
6893  } else if( !ammo_types().empty() ) {
6894  // anything that can be reloaded including tools, magazines, guns and auxiliary gunmods
6895  // but excluding bows etc., which have ammo, but can't be reloaded
6896  amount = ammo_remaining();
6897  const itype *adata = ammo_data();
6898  if( adata ) {
6899  max_amount = ammo_capacity( adata->ammo->type );
6900  } else {
6901  max_amount = ammo_capacity( item_controller->find_template( ammo_default() )->ammo->type );
6902  }
6903  show_amt = !has_flag( flag_RELOAD_AND_SHOOT );
6904  } else if( count_by_charges() && !has_infinite_charges() ) {
6905  // A chargeable item
6906  amount = charges;
6907  const itype *adata = ammo_data();
6908  if( adata ) {
6909  max_amount = ammo_capacity( adata->ammo->type );
6910  } else if( !ammo_default().is_null() ) {
6911  max_amount = ammo_capacity( item_controller->find_template( ammo_default() )->ammo->type );
6912  }
6913  } else if( is_vehicle_battery() ) {
6914  show_amt = true;
6915  amount = to_joule( energy_remaining( nullptr ) );
6916  max_amount = to_joule( type->battery->max_capacity );
6917  }
6918 
6919  std::string ammotext;
6920  if( !is_ammo() && ( ( is_gun() && ammo_required() ) || is_magazine() ) &&
6921  get_option<bool>( "AMMO_IN_NAMES" ) ) {
6922  if( !ammo_current().is_null() ) {
6923  // Loaded with ammo
6924  ammotext = ammo_current()->nname( 1 );
6925  } else if( !ammo_types().empty() ) {
6926  // Is not loaded but can be loaded
6927  ammotext = ammotype( *ammo_types().begin() )->name();
6928  } else if( magazine_current() ) {
6929  // Is not loaded but has magazine that can be loaded
6930  ammotext = magazine_current()->ammo_default()->ammo->type->name();
6931  } else if( !magazine_default().is_null() ) {
6932  // Is not loaded and doesn't have magazine but can use magazines that could be loaded
6933  item tmp_mag( magazine_default() );
6934  ammotext = tmp_mag.ammo_default()->ammo->type->name();
6935  }
6936  }
6937 
6938  if( ( amount || show_amt ) && !has_flag( flag_PSEUDO ) ) {
6939  if( is_money() ) {
6940  amt = " " + format_money( amount );
6941  } else {
6942  if( !ammotext.empty() ) {
6943  ammotext = " " + ammotext;
6944  }
6945 
6946  if( max_amount != 0 ) {
6947  const double ratio = static_cast<double>( amount ) / static_cast<double>( max_amount );
6948  nc_color charges_color;
6949  if( amount == 0 ) {
6950  charges_color = c_light_red;
6951  } else if( amount == max_amount ) {
6952  charges_color = c_white;
6953  } else if( ratio < 1.0 / 3.0 ) {
6954  charges_color = c_red;
6955  } else if( ratio < 2.0 / 3.0 ) {
6956  charges_color = c_yellow;
6957  } else {
6958  charges_color = c_light_green;
6959  }
6960  amt = string_format( " (%s%s)", colorize( string_format( "%i/%i", amount, max_amount ),
6961  charges_color ),
6962  ammotext );
6963  } else {
6964  amt = string_format( " (%i%s)", amount, ammotext );
6965  }
6966  }
6967  } else if( !ammotext.empty() ) {
6968  amt = " (" + ammotext + ")";
6969  }
6970 
6971  if( has_link_data() ) {
6972  std::string extensions = cables().empty() ? "" : string_format( "+%d", cables().size() );
6973  const int link_len = link_length();
6974  const int link_max_len = max_link_length();
6975  if( link_len <= -2 ) {
6976  cable = string_format( _( " (-/%1$d cable%2$s)" ), link_max_len, extensions );
6977  } else if( link_len == -1 ) {
6978  cable = string_format( _( " (%1$s cable%2$s)" ),
6979  colorize( string_format( "/%d", link_max_len ), c_light_red ), extensions );
6980  } else {
6981  nc_color cable_color;
6982  const double ratio = static_cast<double>( link_len ) / static_cast<double>( link_max_len );
6983  if( ratio < 1.0 / 3.0 ) {
6984  cable_color = c_light_green;
6985  } else if( ratio < 2.0 / 3.0 ) {
6986  cable_color = c_yellow;
6987  } else {
6988  cable_color = c_red;
6989  }
6990  cable = string_format( " (%s)", colorize( string_format( _( "%d/%d cable%s" ),
6991  link_max_len - link_len, link_max_len, extensions ), cable_color ) );
6992  }
6993  }
6994 
6995  // HACK: This is a hack to prevent possible crashing when displaying maps as items during character creation
6996  if( is_map() && calendar::turn != calendar::turn_zero ) {
6997  // TODO: fix point types
6998  tripoint map_pos_omt =
6999  get_var( "reveal_map_center_omt", player_character.global_omt_location().raw() );
7000  tripoint_abs_sm map_pos =
7001  project_to<coords::sm>( tripoint_abs_omt( map_pos_omt ) );
7002  const city *c = overmap_buffer.closest_city( map_pos ).city;
7003  if( c != nullptr ) {
7004  name = string_format( "%s %s", c->name, name );
7005  }
7006  }
7007 
7008  return string_format( "%s%s%s%s", name, sidetxt, amt, cable );
7009 }
7010 
7011 bool item::is_collapsed() const
7012 {
7013  return !contents.empty() && !contents.get_pockets( []( item_pocket const & pocket ) {
7014  return pocket.settings.is_collapsed() && pocket.is_standard_type();
7015  } ).empty();
7016 }
7017 
7018 nc_color item::color() const
7019 {
7020  if( is_null() ) {
7021  return c_black;
7022  }
7023  if( is_corpse() ) {
7024  return corpse->color;
7025  }
7026  if( has_itype_variant() && _itype_variant->alt_color ) {
7027  return *_itype_variant->alt_color;
7028  }
7029  return type->color;
7030 }
7031 
7032 int item::price( bool practical ) const
7033 {
7034  int res = 0;
7035 
7036  visit_items( [&res, practical]( const item * e, item * ) {
7037  res += e->price_no_contents( practical );
7038  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
7039  } );
7040 
7041  return res;
7042 }
7043 
7044 int item::price_no_contents( bool practical, std::optional<int> price_override ) const
7045 {
7046  if( rotten() ) {
7047  return 0;
7048  }
7049  int price = price_override ? *price_override
7050  : units::to_cent( practical ? type->price_post : type->price );
7051  if( damage() > 0 ) {
7052  // maximal damage level is 5, maximal reduction is 80% of the value.
7053  price -= price * static_cast<double>( std::max( 0, damage_level() - 1 ) ) / 5;
7054  }
7055 
7056  if( count_by_charges() || made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
7057  // price from json data is for default-sized stack
7058  price *= charges / static_cast< double >( type->stack_size );
7059 
7060  } else if( is_tool() && type->tool->max_charges != 0 ) {
7061  // if tool has no ammo (e.g. spray can) reduce price proportional to remaining charges
7062  price *= ammo_remaining() / static_cast< double >( std::max( type->charges_default(), 1 ) );
7063 
7064  }
7065 
7066  if( is_filthy() ) {
7067  // Filthy items receieve a fixed price malus. This means common clothing ends up
7068  // with no value (it's *everywhere*), but valuable items retain most of their value.
7069  // https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/issues/49469
7070  price = std::max( price - PRICE_FILTHY_MALUS, 0 );
7071  }
7072 
7073  for( fault_id fault : faults ) {
7074  price *= fault->price_mod();
7075  }
7076 
7077  return price;
7078 }
7079 
7080 // TODO: MATERIALS add a density field to materials.json
7081 units::mass item::weight( bool include_contents, bool integral ) const
7082 {
7083  if( is_null() ) {
7084  return 0_gram;
7085  }
7086 
7087  // Items that don't drop aren't really there, they're items just for ease of implementation
7088  if( has_flag( flag_NO_DROP ) ) {
7089  return 0_gram;
7090  }
7091 
7092  if( is_craft() ) {
7093  if( !craft_data_->cached_weight ) {
7094  units::mass ret = 0_gram;
7095  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
7096  for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
7097  ret += it.weight();
7098  }
7099  }
7100  craft_data_->cached_weight = ret;
7101  }
7102  return *craft_data_->cached_weight;
7103  }
7104 
7105  units::mass ret;
7106  double ret_mul = 1.0;
7107  std::string local_str_mass = integral ? get_var( "integral_weight" ) : get_var( "weight" );
7108  if( local_str_mass.empty() ) {
7109  ret = integral ? type->integral_weight : type->weight;
7110  } else {
7111  ret = units::from_milligram( std::stoll( local_str_mass ) );
7112  }
7113 
7114  if( has_flag( flag_REDUCED_WEIGHT ) ) {
7115  ret_mul *= 0.75;
7116  }
7117 
7118  // if this is a gun apply all of its gunmods' weight multipliers
7119  if( type->gun ) {
7120  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
7121  ret_mul *= mod->type->gunmod->weight_multiplier;
7122  }
7123  }
7124 
7125  if( count_by_charges() ) {
7126  ret_mul *= charges;
7127 
7128  } else if( is_corpse() ) {
7129  cata_assert( corpse ); // To appease static analysis
7130  ret = corpse->weight;
7131  ret_mul = 1.0;
7132  if( has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS ) || has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS_FAILED ) ) {
7133  ret_mul *= 0.75;
7134  }
7135  if( has_flag( flag_GIBBED ) ) {
7136  ret_mul *= 0.85;
7137  }
7138  if( has_flag( flag_SKINNED ) ) {
7139  ret_mul *= 0.85;
7140  }
7141  if( has_flag( flag_QUARTERED ) ) {
7142  ret_mul *= 0.25;
7143  }
7144 
7145  }
7146 
7147  ret *= ret_mul;
7148 
7149  // if it has additional pockets include the mass of those
7150  if( contents.has_additional_pockets() ) {
7151  ret += contents.get_additional_weight();
7152  }
7153 
7154  if( include_contents ) {
7155  ret += contents.item_weight_modifier();
7156  }
7157 
7158  // if this is an ammo belt add the weight of any implicitly contained linkages
7159  if( type->magazine && type->magazine->linkage ) {
7160  item links( *type->magazine->linkage );
7161  links.charges = ammo_remaining();
7162  ret += links.weight();
7163  }
7164 
7165  // reduce weight for sawn-off barrel capped to the apportioned weight of the barrel
7166  if( gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) ) {
7167  const units::volume b = type->gun->barrel_volume;
7168  const units::mass max_barrel_weight = units::from_gram( to_milliliter( b ) );
7169  const units::mass barrel_weight = units::from_gram( b.value() * type->weight.value() /
7170  type->volume.value() );
7171  ret -= std::min( max_barrel_weight, barrel_weight );
7172  }
7173 
7174  // reduce weight for sawn-off stock
7175  if( gunmod_find( itype_stock_none ) ) {
7176  // Length taken from item::length(), height and width are "average" values
7177  const float stock_dimensions = 0.26f * 0.11f * 0.04f; // length * height * width = 0.00114 m3.
7178  // density of 'wood' material
7179  const int density = 850;
7180  ret -= units::from_kilogram( stock_dimensions * density );
7181  }
7182 
7183  return ret;
7184 }
7185 
7186 static units::length sawn_off_reduction( const itype *type )
7187 {
7188  int barrel_percentage = type->gun->barrel_volume / ( type->volume / 100 );
7189  return ( type->longest_side / 100 ) * barrel_percentage;
7190 }
7191 
7192 units::length item::length() const
7193 {
7194  if( made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) || ( is_soft() && is_container_empty() ) ) {
7195  return 0_mm;
7196  }
7197 
7198  if( is_corpse() ) {
7199  return units::default_length_from_volume<int>( corpse->volume );
7200  }
7201 
7202  if( is_gun() ) {
7203  units::length length_adjusted = type->longest_side;
7204 
7205  //TODO: Unhardcode this now that integral_longest_side can be used
7206  if( gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) ) {
7207  length_adjusted = type->longest_side - sawn_off_reduction( type );
7208  }
7209 
7210  std::vector<const item *> mods = gunmods();
7211  // only the longest thing sticking off the gun matters for length adjustment
7212  // TODO: Differentiate from back end mods like stocks vs front end like bayonets and muzzle devices
7213  units::length max_length = 0_mm;
7214  units::length stock_length = 0_mm;
7215  units::length stock_accessory_length = 0_mm;
7216  for( const item *mod : mods ) {
7217  // stocks and accessories for stocks are added with whatever the longest thing on the front is
7218  // stock mount is added here for support for sawing off stocks
7219  if( mod->type->gunmod->location.str() == "stock mount" ) {
7220  if( has_flag( flag_REMOVED_STOCK ) ) {
7221  // stock has been removed so slightly more length removed about 26cm
7222  stock_length -= 26_cm;
7223  }
7224  } else if( mod->type->gunmod->location.str() == "stock" ) {
7225  stock_length = mod->type->integral_longest_side;
7226  if( has_flag( flag_COLLAPSED_STOCK ) || has_flag( flag_FOLDED_STOCK ) ) {
7227  // stock is folded so need to reduce length
7228 
7229  // folded stock length is estimated at about 20 cm, LOP for guns should be about
7230  // 13.5 inches and a folding stock folds past the trigger and isn't perfectly efficient
7231  stock_length -= 20_cm;
7232  }
7233  } else if( mod->type->gunmod->location.str() == "stock accessory" ) {
7234  stock_accessory_length = mod->type->integral_longest_side;
7235  } else {
7236  units::length l = mod->type->integral_longest_side;
7237  if( l > max_length ) {
7238  max_length = l;
7239  }
7240  }
7241  }
7242  return length_adjusted + max_length + stock_length + stock_accessory_length;
7243  }
7244 
7245  units::length max = is_soft() ? 0_mm : type->longest_side;
7246  max = std::max( contents.item_length_modifier(), max );
7247  return max;
7248 }
7249 
7250 units::length item::barrel_length() const
7251 {
7252  if( is_gun() ) {
7253  units::length l = type->gun->barrel_length;
7254  for( const item *mod : mods() ) {
7255  // if a gun has a barrel length specifying mod then use that length for sure
7256  if( mod->type->gunmod->barrel_length > 0_mm ) {
7257  l = mod->type->gunmod->barrel_length;
7258  // if we find an explicit barrel mod then use that and quit the loop
7259  break;
7260  }
7261  }
7262  // if we've sawn off the barrel reduce the damage
7263  if( gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) ) {
7264  l = l - sawn_off_reduction( type );
7265  }
7266 
7267  return l;
7268  } else {
7269  return 0_mm;
7270  }
7271 }
7272 
7273 units::volume item::collapsed_volume_delta() const
7274 {
7275  units::volume delta_volume = 0_ml;
7276 
7277  // COLLAPSIBLE_STOCK is the legacy version of this just here for mod support
7278  // TODO Remove at some point
7279  if( is_gun() && ( has_flag( flag_COLLAPSIBLE_STOCK ) || has_flag( flag_COLLAPSED_STOCK ) ||
7280  has_flag( flag_REMOVED_STOCK ) ) ) {
7281  // consider only the base size of the gun (without mods)
7282  int tmpvol = get_var( "volume",
7283  ( type->volume - type->gun->barrel_volume ) / units::legacy_volume_factor );
7284  if( tmpvol <= 3 ) {
7285  // intentional NOP
7286  } else if( tmpvol <= 5 ) {
7287  delta_volume = 250_ml;
7288  } else if( tmpvol <= 6 ) {
7289  delta_volume = 500_ml;
7290  } else if( tmpvol <= 9 ) {
7291  delta_volume = 750_ml;
7292  } else if( tmpvol <= 12 ) {
7293  delta_volume = 1000_ml;
7294  } else if( tmpvol <= 15 ) {
7295  delta_volume = 1250_ml;
7296  } else {
7297  delta_volume = 1500_ml;
7298  }
7299  }
7300 
7301  return delta_volume;
7302 }
7303 
7304 units::volume item::corpse_volume( const mtype *corpse ) const
7305 {
7306  units::volume corpse_volume = corpse->volume;
7307  if( has_flag( flag_QUARTERED ) ) {
7308  corpse_volume *= 0.25;
7309  }
7310  if( has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS ) || has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS_FAILED ) ) {
7311  corpse_volume *= 0.75;
7312  }
7313  if( has_flag( flag_GIBBED ) ) {
7314  corpse_volume *= 0.85;
7315  }
7316  if( has_flag( flag_SKINNED ) ) {
7317  corpse_volume *= 0.85;
7318  }
7319  if( corpse_volume > MAX_ITEM_VOLUME ) {
7320  // Silently set volume so the corpse can still spawn but a mtype can have a volume > MAX_ITEM_VOLUME
7321  corpse_volume = MAX_ITEM_VOLUME;
7322  }
7323  if( corpse_volume > 0_ml ) {
7324  return corpse_volume;
7325  }
7326  debugmsg( "invalid monster volume for corpse" );
7327  return 0_ml;
7328 }
7329 
7330 units::volume item::base_volume() const
7331 {
7332  if( is_null() ) {
7333  return 0_ml;
7334  }
7335  if( is_corpse() ) {
7336  return corpse_volume( corpse );
7337  }
7338 
7339  if( is_craft() ) {
7340  units::volume ret = 0_ml;
7341  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
7342  for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
7343  ret += it.base_volume();
7344  }
7345  }
7346  return ret;
7347  }
7348 
7349  if( count_by_charges() && type->stack_size > 0 ) {
7350  if( type->volume % type->stack_size == 0_ml ) {
7351  return type->volume / type->stack_size;
7352  } else {
7353  return type->volume / type->stack_size + 1_ml;
7354  }
7355  }
7356 
7357  return type->volume;
7358 }
7359 
7360 units::volume item::volume( bool integral, bool ignore_contents, int charges_in_vol ) const
7361 {
7362  charges_in_vol = charges_in_vol < 0 || charges_in_vol > charges ? charges : charges_in_vol;
7363  if( is_null() ) {
7364  return 0_ml;
7365  }
7366 
7367  if( is_corpse() ) {
7368  return corpse_volume( corpse );
7369  }
7370 
7371  if( is_craft() ) {
7372  if( !craft_data_->cached_volume ) {
7373  units::volume ret = 0_ml;
7374  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
7375  for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
7376  ret += it.volume();
7377  }
7378  }
7379  // 1 mL minimum craft volume to avoid 0 volume errors from practices or hammerspace
7380  craft_data_->cached_volume = std::max( ret, 1_ml );
7381  }
7382  return *craft_data_->cached_volume;
7383  }
7384 
7385  const int local_volume = get_var( "volume", -1 );
7386  units::volume ret;
7387  if( local_volume >= 0 ) {
7388  ret = local_volume * units::legacy_volume_factor;
7389  } else if( integral ) {
7390  ret = type->integral_volume;
7391  } else {
7392  ret = type->volume;
7393  }
7394 
7395  if( count_by_charges() || made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
7396  units::quantity<int64_t, units::volume_in_milliliter_tag> num = ret * static_cast<int64_t>
7397  ( charges_in_vol );
7398  if( type->stack_size <= 0 ) {
7399  if( type->charges_default() <= 0 ) {
7400  debugmsg( "Item type %s has invalid default charges %d", typeId().str(), type->charges_default() );
7401  } else {
7402  debugmsg( "Item type %s has invalid stack_size %d", typeId().str(), type->stack_size );
7403  }
7404  ret = num;
7405  } else {
7406  ret = num / type->stack_size;
7407  if( num % type->stack_size != 0_ml ) {
7408  ret += 1_ml;
7409  }
7410  }
7411  }
7412 
7413  if( !ignore_contents ) {
7414  ret += contents.item_size_modifier();
7415  }
7416 
7417  // if it has additional pockets include the volume of those
7418  if( contents.has_additional_pockets() ) {
7419  ret += contents.get_additional_volume();
7420  }
7421 
7422  // TODO: do a check if the item is collapsed or not
7423  ret -= collapsed_volume_delta();
7424 
7425  if( is_gun() ) {
7426  for( const item *elem : gunmods() ) {
7427  ret += elem->volume( true );
7428  }
7429 
7430  if( gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) ) {
7431  ret -= type->gun->barrel_volume;
7432  }
7433  }
7434 
7435  return ret;
7436 }
7437 
7438 int item::lift_strength() const
7439 {
7440  const int mass = units::to_gram( weight() );
7441  return std::max( mass / 10000, 1 );
7442 }
7443 
7444 int item::attack_time( const Character &you ) const
7445 {
7446  int ret = 65 + ( volume() / 62.5_ml + weight() / 60_gram ) / count();
7447  ret = calculate_by_enchantment_wield( you, ret, enchant_vals::mod::ITEM_ATTACK_SPEED,
7448  true );
7449  return ret;
7450 }
7451 
7452 int item::damage_melee( const damage_type_id &dt ) const
7453 {
7454  if( is_null() ) {
7455  return 0;
7456  }
7457 
7458  // effectiveness is reduced by 10% per damage level
7459  int res = 0;
7460  if( type->melee.count( dt ) > 0 ) {
7461  res = type->melee.at( dt );
7462  }
7463  res = damage_adjusted_melee_weapon_damage( res );
7464 
7465  // apply type specific flags
7466  // FIXME: Hardcoded damage types
7467  if( dt == damage_bash && has_flag( flag_REDUCED_BASHING ) ) {
7468  res *= 0.5;
7469  }
7470  if( dt->edged && has_flag( flag_DIAMOND ) ) {
7471  res *= 1.3;
7472  }
7473 
7474  // consider any attached bayonets
7475  if( is_gun() ) {
7476  std::vector<int> opts = { res };
7477  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
7478  if( mod->type->gunmod->is_bayonet ) {
7479  opts.push_back( mod->damage_melee( dt ) );
7480  }
7481  }
7482  return *std::max_element( opts.begin(), opts.end() );
7483 
7484  }
7485 
7486  return std::max( res, 0 );
7487 }
7488 
7489 damage_instance item::base_damage_melee() const
7490 {
7491  // TODO: Caching
7492  damage_instance ret;
7493  for( const damage_type &dt : damage_type::get_all() ) {
7494  int dam = damage_melee( dt.id );
7495  if( dam > 0 ) {
7496  ret.add_damage( dt.id, dam );
7497  }
7498  }
7499 
7500  return ret;
7501 }
7502 
7503 damage_instance item::base_damage_thrown() const
7504 {
7505  // TODO: Create a separate cache for individual items (for modifiers like diamond etc.)
7506  return type->thrown_damage;
7507 }
7508 
7509 int item::reach_range( const Character &guy ) const
7510 {
7511  int res = 1;
7512 
7513  if( has_flag( flag_REACH_ATTACK ) ) {
7514  res = has_flag( flag_REACH3 ) ? 3 : 2;
7515  }
7516 
7517  // for guns consider any attached gunmods
7518  if( is_gun() && !is_gunmod() ) {
7519  for( const std::pair<const gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &m : gun_all_modes() ) {
7520  if( guy.is_npc() && m.second.flags.count( "NPC_AVOID" ) ) {
7521  continue;
7522  }
7523  if( m.second.melee() ) {
7524  res = std::max( res, m.second.qty );
7525  }
7526  }
7527  }
7528 
7529  return res;
7530 }
7531 
7532 int item::current_reach_range( const Character &guy ) const
7533 {
7534  int res = 1;
7535 
7536  if( has_flag( flag_REACH_ATTACK ) ) {
7537  res = has_flag( flag_REACH3 ) ? 3 : 2;
7538  } else if( is_gun() && !is_gunmod() && gun_current_mode().melee() ) {
7539  res = gun_current_mode().target->gun_range();
7540  }
7541 
7542  if( is_gun() && !is_gunmod() ) {
7543  gun_mode gun = gun_current_mode();
7544  if( !( guy.is_npc() && gun.flags.count( "NPC_AVOID" ) ) && gun.melee() ) {
7545  res = std::max( res, gun.qty );
7546  }
7547  }
7548 
7549  return res;
7550 }
7551 
7552 void item::unset_flags()
7553 {
7554  item_tags.clear();
7555  requires_tags_processing = true;
7556 }
7557 
7558 bool item::has_fault( const fault_id &fault ) const
7559 {
7560  return faults.count( fault );
7561 }
7562 
7563 bool item::has_fault_flag( const std::string &searched_flag ) const
7564 {
7565  for( const fault_id &fault : faults ) {
7566  if( fault->has_flag( searched_flag ) ) {
7567  return true;
7568  }
7569  }
7570  return false;
7571 }
7572 
7573 bool item::has_own_flag( const flag_id &f ) const
7574 {
7575  return item_tags.find( f ) != item_tags.end();
7576 }
7577 
7578 bool item::has_flag( const flag_id &f ) const
7579 {
7580  bool ret = false;
7581  if( !f.is_valid() ) {
7582  debugmsg( "Attempted to check invalid flag_id %s", f.str() );
7583  return false;
7584  }
7585 
7586  ret = inherited_tags_cache.find( f ) != inherited_tags_cache.end();
7587  if( ret ) {
7588  return ret;
7589  }
7590 
7591  // other item type flags
7592  ret = type->has_flag( f );
7593  if( ret ) {
7594  return ret;
7595  }
7596 
7597  // now check for item specific flags
7598  ret = has_own_flag( f );
7599  return ret;
7600 }
7601 
7602 item &item::set_flag( const flag_id &flag )
7603 {
7604  if( flag.is_valid() ) {
7605  item_tags.insert( flag );
7606  update_prefix_suffix_flags( flag );
7607  requires_tags_processing = true;
7608  } else {
7609  debugmsg( "Attempted to set invalid flag_id %s", flag.str() );
7610  }
7611  return *this;
7612 }
7613 
7614 bool item::has_vitamin( const vitamin_id &v ) const
7615 {
7616  if( !this->is_comestible() ) {
7617  return false;
7618  }
7619  // We need this function to get all vitamins including from inheritance.
7620  // But we don't care about calories, so we can just pass a dummy.
7621  npc dummy;
7622  const nutrients food_item = dummy.compute_effective_nutrients( *this );
7623  for( auto const& [vit_id, amount] : food_item.vitamins() ) {
7624  if( vit_id == v ) {
7625  if( amount > 0 ) {
7626  return true;
7627  } else {
7628  break;
7629  }
7630  }
7631  }
7632  return false;
7633 }
7634 
7635 item &item::set_fault( const fault_id &fault_id )
7636 {
7637  faults.insert( fault_id );
7638  return *this;
7639 }
7640 
7641 item &item::unset_flag( const flag_id &flag )
7642 {
7643  item_tags.erase( flag );
7644  update_prefix_suffix_flags();
7645  requires_tags_processing = true;
7646  return *this;
7647 }
7648 
7649 item &item::set_flag_recursive( const flag_id &flag )
7650 {
7651  set_flag( flag );
7652  for( item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
7653  for( item &it : tvp.second ) {
7654  it.set_flag_recursive( flag );
7655  }
7656  }
7657  return *this;
7658 }
7659 
7660 const item::FlagsSetType &item::get_flags() const
7661 {
7662  return item_tags;
7663 }
7664 
7665 const item::FlagsSetType &item::get_prefix_flags() const
7666 {
7667  return prefix_tags_cache;
7668 }
7669 
7670 const item::FlagsSetType &item::get_suffix_flags() const
7671 {
7672  return suffix_tags_cache;
7673 }
7674 
7675 bool item::has_property( const std::string &prop ) const
7676 {
7677  return type->properties.find( prop ) != type->properties.end();
7678 }
7679 
7680 std::string item::get_property_string( const std::string &prop, const std::string &def ) const
7681 {
7682  const auto it = type->properties.find( prop );
7683  return it != type->properties.end() ? it->second : def;
7684 }
7685 
7686 int64_t item::get_property_int64_t( const std::string &prop, int64_t def ) const
7687 {
7688  const auto it = type->properties.find( prop );
7689  if( it != type->properties.end() ) {
7690  char *e = nullptr;
7691  int64_t r = std::strtoll( it->second.c_str(), &e, 10 );
7692  if( !it->second.empty() && *e == '\0' ) {
7693  return r;
7694  }
7695  debugmsg( "invalid property '%s' for item '%s'", prop.c_str(), tname() );
7696  }
7697  return def;
7698 }
7699 
7700 bool item::has_quality_nonrecursive( const quality_id &qual, int level ) const
7701 {
7702  return get_quality_nonrecursive( qual ) >= level;
7703 }
7704 
7705 int item::get_quality_nonrecursive( const quality_id &id, const bool strict_boiling ) const
7706 {
7707  /**
7708  * EXCEPTION: Items with quality BOIL only count as such if they are empty.
7709  */
7710  if( strict_boiling && id == qual_BOIL && !contents.empty_container() ) {
7711  return INT_MIN;
7712  }
7713 
7714  int return_quality = INT_MIN;
7715 
7716  // Check for inherent item quality
7717  for( const std::pair<const quality_id, int> &quality : type->qualities ) {
7718  if( quality.first == id ) {
7719  return_quality = quality.second;
7720  }
7721  }
7722 
7723  // If tool has charged qualities and enough charge to use at least once
7724  // (using ammo_remaining() with player character to include bionic/UPS power)
7725  if( !type->charged_qualities.empty() && ammo_sufficient( &get_player_character() ) ) {
7726  // see if any charged qualities are better than the current one
7727  for( const std::pair<const quality_id, int> &quality : type->charged_qualities ) {
7728  if( quality.first == id ) {
7729  return_quality = std::max( return_quality, quality.second );
7730  }
7731  }
7732  }
7733 
7734  return return_quality;
7735 }
7736 
7737 int item::get_quality( const quality_id &id, const bool strict_boiling ) const
7738 {
7739  /**
7740  * EXCEPTION: Items with quality BOIL only count as such if they are empty.
7741  */
7742  if( strict_boiling && id == qual_BOIL && !contents.empty_container() ) {
7743  return INT_MIN;
7744  }
7745 
7746  // First check the item itself
7747  int return_quality = get_quality_nonrecursive( id, false );
7748 
7749  // If any contained item has a better quality, use that instead
7750  return_quality = std::max( return_quality, contents.best_quality( id ) );
7751 
7752  return return_quality;
7753 }
7754 
7755 bool item::has_technique( const matec_id &tech ) const
7756 {
7757  return type->techniques.count( tech ) > 0 || techniques.count( tech ) > 0;
7758 }
7759 
7760 void item::add_technique( const matec_id &tech )
7761 {
7762  techniques.insert( tech );
7763 }
7764 
7765 std::vector<item *> item::toolmods()
7766 {
7767  std::vector<item *> res;
7768  if( is_tool() ) {
7769  for( item *e : contents.all_items_top( pocket_type::MOD ) ) {
7770  if( e->is_toolmod() ) {
7771  res.push_back( e );
7772  }
7773  }
7774  }
7775  return res;
7776 }
7777 
7778 std::vector<const item *> item::toolmods() const
7779 {
7780  std::vector<const item *> res;
7781  if( is_tool() ) {
7782  for( const item *e : contents.all_items_top( pocket_type::MOD ) ) {
7783  if( e->is_toolmod() ) {
7784  res.push_back( e );
7785  }
7786  }
7787  }
7788  return res;
7789 }
7790 
7791 std::set<matec_id> item::get_techniques() const
7792 {
7793  std::set<matec_id> result = type->techniques;
7794  result.insert( techniques.begin(), techniques.end() );
7795  return result;
7796 }
7797 
7798 int item::get_comestible_fun() const
7799 {
7800  if( !is_comestible() ) {
7801  return 0;
7802  }
7803  int fun = get_comestible()->fun;
7804  for( const flag_id &flag : item_tags ) {
7805  fun += flag->taste_mod();
7806  }
7807  for( const flag_id &flag : type->get_flags() ) {
7808  fun += flag->taste_mod();
7809  }
7810 
7811  if( has_flag( flag_MUSHY ) ) {
7812  return std::min( -5, fun ); // defrosted MUSHY food is practically tasteless or tastes off
7813  }
7814 
7815  return fun;
7816 }
7817 
7818 bool item::goes_bad() const
7819 {
7820  if( item_internal::goes_bad_cache_is_for( this ) ) {
7821  return item_internal::goes_bad_cache_fetch();
7822  }
7823  if( has_flag( flag_PROCESSING ) ) {
7824  return false;
7825  }
7826  if( is_corpse() ) {
7827  // Corpses rot only if they are made of rotting materials
7828  // They also only rot if they are not dormant
7829  if( corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_DORMANT ) ) {
7830  return false;
7831  }
7832  return made_of_any( materials::get_rotting() );
7833  }
7834  return is_comestible() && get_comestible()->spoils != 0_turns;
7835 }
7836 
7837 time_duration item::get_shelf_life() const
7838 {
7839  if( goes_bad() ) {
7840  if( is_comestible() ) {
7841  return get_comestible()->spoils;
7842  } else if( is_corpse() ) {
7843  return 24_hours;
7844  }
7845  }
7846  return 0_turns;
7847 }
7848 
7849 double item::get_relative_rot() const
7850 {
7851  if( goes_bad() ) {
7852  return rot / get_shelf_life();
7853  }
7854  return 0;
7855 }
7856 
7857 void item::set_relative_rot( double val )
7858 {
7859  if( goes_bad() ) {
7860  rot = get_shelf_life() * val;
7861  // calc_rot uses last_temp_check (when it's not turn_zero) instead of bday.
7862  // this makes sure the rotting starts from now, not from bday.
7863  // if this item is the result of smoking or milling don't do this, we want to start from bday.
7864  if( !has_flag( flag_PROCESSING_RESULT ) ) {
7865  last_temp_check = calendar::turn;
7866  }
7867  }
7868 }
7869 
7870 void item::set_rot( time_duration val )
7871 {
7872  rot = val;
7873 }
7874 
7875 void item::randomize_rot()
7876 {
7877  if( is_comestible() && get_comestible()->spoils > 0_turns ) {
7878  const double x_input = rng_float( 0.0, 1.0 );
7879  const double k_rot = ( 1.0 - x_input ) / ( 1.0 + 2.0 * x_input );
7880  set_rot( get_shelf_life() * k_rot );
7881  }
7882 
7883  for( item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_contained_pockets() ) {
7884  if( pocket->spoil_multiplier() > 0.0f ) {
7885  for( item *subitem : pocket->all_items_top() ) {
7886  subitem->randomize_rot();
7887  }
7888  }
7889  }
7890 }
7891 
7892 int item::spoilage_sort_order() const
7893 {
7894  int bottom = std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
7895 
7896  bool any_goes_bad = false;
7897  time_duration min_spoil_time = calendar::INDEFINITELY_LONG_DURATION;
7898  visit_items( [&]( item * const node, item * const parent ) {
7899  if( node && node->goes_bad() ) {
7900  float spoil_multiplier = 1.0f;
7901  if( parent ) {
7902  const item_pocket *const parent_pocket = parent->contained_where( *node );
7903  if( parent_pocket ) {
7904  spoil_multiplier = parent_pocket->spoil_multiplier();
7905  }
7906  }
7907  if( spoil_multiplier > 0.0f ) {
7908  time_duration remaining_shelf_life = node->get_shelf_life() - node->rot;
7909  if( !any_goes_bad || min_spoil_time * spoil_multiplier > remaining_shelf_life ) {
7910  any_goes_bad = true;
7911  min_spoil_time = remaining_shelf_life / spoil_multiplier;
7912  }
7913  }
7914  }
7915  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
7916  } );
7917  if( any_goes_bad ) {
7918  return to_turns<int>( min_spoil_time );
7919  }
7920 
7921  if( get_comestible() ) {
7922  if( get_category_shallow().get_id() == item_category_food ) {
7923  return bottom - 3;
7924  } else if( get_category_shallow().get_id() == item_category_drugs ) {
7925  return bottom - 2;
7926  } else {
7927  return bottom - 1;
7928  }
7929  }
7930  return bottom;
7931 }
7932 
7933 /**
7934  * Food decay calculation.
7935  * Calculate how much food rots per hour, based on 3600 rot/hour at 65 F (18.3 C).
7936  * Rate of rot doubles every 16 F (~8.8888 C) increase in temperature
7937  * Rate of rot halves every 16 F decrease in temperature
7938  * Rot maxes out at 105 F
7939  * Rot stops below 32 F (0C) and above 145 F (63 C)
7940  */
7941 float item::calc_hourly_rotpoints_at_temp( const units::temperature &temp ) const
7942 {
7943  const units::temperature dropoff = units::from_fahrenheit( 38 ); // F, ~3 C
7944  const float max_rot_temp = 105; // F, ~41 C, Maximum rotting rate is at this temperature
7945  const float safe_temp = 145; // F, ~63 C, safe temperature above which food stops rotting
7946 
7947  if( temp <= temperatures::freezing ||
7948  temp > units::from_fahrenheit( safe_temp ) ) {
7949  return 0.f;
7950  } else if( temp < dropoff ) {
7951  // ditch our fancy equation and do a linear approach to 0 rot from 38 F (3 C) -> 32 F (0 C)
7952  return 600.f * std::exp2( -27.f / 16.f ) * ( units::to_fahrenheit( temp ) - units::to_fahrenheit(
7953  temperatures::freezing ) );
7954  } else if( temp < units::from_fahrenheit( max_rot_temp ) ) {
7955  // Exponential progress from 38 F (3 C) to 105 F (41 C)
7956  return 3600.f * std::exp2( ( units::to_fahrenheit( temp ) - 65.f ) / 16.f );
7957  } else {
7958  // Constant rot from 105 F (41 C) to 145 F (63 C)
7959  // This is approximately 20364.67 rot/hour
7960  return 3600.f * std::exp2( ( max_rot_temp - 65.f ) / 16.f );
7961  }
7962 }
7963 
7964 void item::calc_rot( units::temperature temp, const float spoil_modifier,
7965  const time_duration &time_delta )
7966 {
7967  // Avoid needlessly calculating already rotten things. Corpses should
7968  // always rot away and food rots away at twice the shelf life. If the food
7969  // is in a sealed container they won't rot away, this avoids needlessly
7970  // calculating their rot in that case.
7971  if( !is_corpse() && get_relative_rot() > 2.0 ) {
7972  return;
7973  }
7974 
7975  if( has_own_flag( flag_FROZEN ) ) {
7976  return;
7977  }
7978 
7979  // rot modifier
7980  float factor = spoil_modifier;
7981  if( is_corpse() && has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS ) ) {
7982  factor *= 0.75;
7983  }
7984  if( has_own_flag( flag_MUSHY ) ) {
7985  factor *= 3.0;
7986  }
7987  // Food irradiation can quadruple the shelf life.
7988  // "Shelf life of ground beef patties treated by gamma radiation":
7989  // > Beef patties treated at 1.0 and 3.0 kGy [spoiled] by day 14 and 21, ...
7990  // > patties treated at 5.0 kGy did not spoil until 42 days.
7991  // > The nonirradiated control samples for both batches of ground beef spoiled within 7 days
7992  // We get 0.5, 0.33, and 0.167. 0.25 seems reasonable for irradiation
7993  if( has_own_flag( flag_IRRADIATED ) ) {
7994  factor *= 0.25;
7995  }
7996 
7997  if( has_own_flag( flag_COLD ) ) {
7998  temp = std::min( temperatures::fridge, temp );
7999  }
8000 
8001  rot += factor * time_delta / 1_hours * calc_hourly_rotpoints_at_temp( temp ) * 1_turns;
8002 }
8003 
8004 void item::calc_rot_while_processing( time_duration processing_duration )
8005 {
8006  if( !has_own_flag( flag_PROCESSING ) ) {
8007  debugmsg( "calc_rot_while_processing called on non smoking item: %s", tname() );
8008  return;
8009  }
8010 
8011  // Apply no rot or temperature while smoking
8012  last_temp_check += processing_duration;
8013 }
8014 
8015 int item::get_env_resist( int override_base_resist ) const
8016 {
8017  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8018  if( t == nullptr ) {
8019  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->env_resist : 0;
8020  }
8021  // modify if item is a gas mask and has filter
8022  int resist_base = t->avg_env_resist();
8023  int resist_filter = get_var( "overwrite_env_resist", 0 );
8024  int resist = std::max( { resist_base, resist_filter, override_base_resist } );
8025 
8026  return std::lround( resist * get_relative_health() );
8027 }
8028 
8029 int item::get_base_env_resist_w_filter() const
8030 {
8031  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8032  if( t == nullptr ) {
8033  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->env_resist_w_filter : 0;
8034  }
8035  return t->avg_env_resist_w_filter();
8036 }
8037 
8038 bool item::is_power_armor() const
8039 {
8040  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8041  if( t == nullptr ) {
8042  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->power_armor : false;
8043  }
8044  return t->power_armor;
8045 }
8046 
8047 int item::get_avg_encumber( const Character &p, encumber_flags flags ) const
8048 {
8049  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8050  if( !t ) {
8051  return 0;
8052  }
8053 
8054  int avg_encumber = 0;
8055  int avg_ctr = 0;
8056 
8057  for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->data ) {
8058  if( entry.covers.has_value() ) {
8059  for( const bodypart_str_id &limb : entry.covers.value() ) {
8060  int encumber = get_encumber( p, bodypart_id( limb ), flags );
8061  if( encumber ) {
8062  avg_encumber += encumber;
8063  ++avg_ctr;
8064  }
8065  }
8066  }
8067  }
8068  if( avg_encumber == 0 ) {
8069  return 0;
8070  } else {
8071  avg_encumber /= avg_ctr;
8072  return avg_encumber;
8073  }
8074 }
8075 
8076 int item::get_encumber( const Character &p, const bodypart_id &bodypart,
8077  encumber_flags flags ) const
8078 {
8079  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8080  int encumber = 0;
8081  if( !t ) {
8082  return 0;
8083  }
8084 
8085  float relative_encumbrance;
8086 
8087  if( flags & encumber_flags::assume_full ) {
8088  relative_encumbrance = 1.0f;
8089  } else if( flags & encumber_flags::assume_empty ) {
8090  relative_encumbrance = 0.0f;
8091  } else {
8092  // Additional encumbrance from non-rigid pockets
8093 
8094  // p.get_check_encumbrance() may be set when it's not possible
8095  // to reset `cached_relative_encumbrance` for individual items
8096  // (e.g. when dropping via AIM, see #42983)
8097  if( !cached_relative_encumbrance || p.get_check_encumbrance() ) {
8098  cached_relative_encumbrance = contents.relative_encumbrance();
8099  }
8100  relative_encumbrance = *cached_relative_encumbrance;
8101  }
8102 
8103  if( const armor_portion_data *portion_data = portion_for_bodypart( bodypart ) ) {
8104  encumber = portion_data->encumber;
8105  if( is_gun() ) {
8106  encumber += volume() * portion_data->volume_encumber_modifier /
8107  armor_portion_data::volume_per_encumbrance;
8108  }
8109 
8110  // encumbrance from added or modified pockets
8111  int additional_encumbrance = get_contents().get_additional_pocket_encumbrance(
8112  portion_data->volume_encumber_modifier );
8113  encumber += std::ceil( relative_encumbrance * ( portion_data->max_encumber +
8114  additional_encumbrance - portion_data->encumber ) );
8115 
8116  // add the encumbrance values of any ablative plates and additional encumbrance pockets
8117  if( has_additional_encumbrance() ) {
8118  for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_contained_pockets() ) {
8119  if( pocket->get_pocket_data()->extra_encumbrance > 0 && !pocket->empty() ) {
8120  encumber += pocket->get_pocket_data()->extra_encumbrance;
8121  }
8122  }
8123  }
8124  }
8125 
8126  // even if we don't have data we might have ablative armor draped over it
8127  if( is_ablative() ) {
8128  for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
8129  if( !pocket->empty() ) {
8130  // get the contained plate
8131  const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
8132  encumber += ablative_armor.get_encumber( p, bodypart, flags );
8133  }
8134  }
8135  }
8136 
8137  // Fit checked before changes, fitting shouldn't reduce penalties from patching.
8138  if( has_flag( flag_FIT ) && has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) ) {
8139  encumber = std::max( encumber / 2, encumber - 10 );
8140  }
8141 
8142  // TODO: Should probably have sizing affect coverage
8143  const sizing sizing_level = get_sizing( p );
8144  switch( sizing_level ) {
8145  case sizing::small_sized_human_char:
8146  case sizing::small_sized_big_char:
8147  // non small characters have a HARD time wearing undersized clothing
8148  encumber *= 3;
8149  break;
8150  case sizing::human_sized_small_char:
8151  case sizing::big_sized_small_char:
8152  // clothes bag up around smol characters and encumber them more
8153  encumber *= 2;
8154  break;
8155  default:
8156  break;
8157  }
8158 
8159  encumber += static_cast<int>( std::ceil( get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_encumbrance ) ) );
8160 
8161  return encumber;
8162 }
8163 
8164 std::vector<layer_level> item::get_layer() const
8165 {
8166  const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
8167  if( armor == nullptr ) {
8168  return std::vector<layer_level>();
8169  }
8170  return armor->all_layers;
8171 }
8172 
8173 static void get_layer_helper( const item *i, bodypart_id bp, std::set<layer_level> &layers )
8174 {
8175  const islot_armor *t = i->find_armor_data();
8176  if( t == nullptr ) {
8177  return;
8178  }
8179 
8180  for( const armor_portion_data &data : t->data ) {
8181  if( !data.covers.has_value() ) {
8182  continue;
8183  }
8184  for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
8185  if( bp == bpid ) {
8186  layers.insert( data.layers.begin(), data.layers.end() );
8187  }
8188  }
8189  }
8190 }
8191 
8192 std::vector<layer_level> item::get_layer( bodypart_id bp ) const
8193 {
8194 
8195  std::set<layer_level> layers;
8196 
8197  get_layer_helper( this, bp, layers );
8198 
8199  //get layers for ablative armor too
8200  if( is_ablative() ) {
8201  for( const item_pocket *pocket : get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
8202  if( !pocket->empty() ) {
8203  // get the contained plate
8204  const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
8205  get_layer_helper( &ablative_armor, bp, layers );
8206  }
8207  }
8208  }
8209 
8210  // if the item has additional pockets and is on the torso it should also be strapped
8211  if( bp == body_part_torso && contents.has_additional_pockets() ) {
8212  layers.insert( layer_level::BELTED );
8213  }
8214 
8215  return std::vector<layer_level>( layers.begin(), layers.end() );
8216 }
8217 
8218 std::vector<layer_level> item::get_layer( sub_bodypart_id sbp ) const
8219 {
8220  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8221  if( t == nullptr ) {
8222  return std::vector<layer_level>();
8223  }
8224 
8225  for( const armor_portion_data &data : t->sub_data ) {
8226  for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.sub_coverage ) {
8227  if( sbp == bpid ) {
8228  // if the item has additional pockets and is on the torso it should also be strapped
8229  if( ( sbp == sub_body_part_torso_upper || sbp == sub_body_part_torso_lower ) &&
8230  contents.has_additional_pockets() ) {
8231  std::set<layer_level> with_belted = data.layers;
8232  with_belted.insert( layer_level::BELTED );
8233  return std::vector<layer_level>( with_belted.begin(), with_belted.end() );
8234  } else {
8235  return std::vector<layer_level>( data.layers.begin(), data.layers.end() );
8236  }
8237  }
8238  }
8239  }
8240  // body part not covered by this armour
8241  return std::vector<layer_level>();
8242 }
8243 
8244 bool item::has_layer( const std::vector<layer_level> &ll ) const
8245 {
8246  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8247  if( t == nullptr ) {
8248  return false;
8249  }
8250  for( const layer_level &test_level : ll ) {
8251  if( std::find( t->all_layers.begin(), t->all_layers.end(), test_level ) != t->all_layers.end() ) {
8252  return true;
8253  }
8254  }
8255  return false;
8256 }
8257 
8258 bool item::has_layer( const std::vector<layer_level> &ll, const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8259 {
8260  const std::vector<layer_level> layers = get_layer( bp );
8261  for( const layer_level &test_level : ll ) {
8262  if( std::find( layers.begin(), layers.end(), test_level ) != layers.end() ) {
8263  return true;
8264  }
8265  }
8266  return false;
8267 }
8268 
8269 bool item::has_layer( const std::vector<layer_level> &ll, const sub_bodypart_id &sbp ) const
8270 {
8271  const std::vector<layer_level> layers = get_layer( sbp );
8272  for( const layer_level &test_level : ll ) {
8273  if( std::find( layers.begin(), layers.end(), test_level ) != layers.end() ) {
8274  return true;
8275  }
8276  }
8277  return false;
8278 }
8279 
8280 layer_level item::get_highest_layer( const sub_bodypart_id &sbp ) const
8281 {
8282  layer_level highest_layer = layer_level::PERSONAL;
8283 
8284  // find highest layer from this item
8285  for( layer_level our_layer : get_layer( sbp ) ) {
8286  if( our_layer > highest_layer ) {
8287  highest_layer = our_layer;
8288  }
8289  }
8290 
8291  return highest_layer;
8292 }
8293 
8294 item::cover_type item::get_cover_type( const damage_type_id &type )
8295 {
8296  item::cover_type ctype = item::cover_type::COVER_DEFAULT;
8297  if( type->physical ) {
8298  if( type->melee_only ) {
8299  ctype = item::cover_type::COVER_MELEE;
8300  } else {
8301  ctype = item::cover_type::COVER_RANGED;
8302  }
8303  }
8304  return ctype;
8305 }
8306 
8307 int item::get_avg_coverage( const cover_type &type ) const
8308 {
8309  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8310  if( !t ) {
8311  return 0;
8312  }
8313  int avg_coverage = 0;
8314  int avg_ctr = 0;
8315  for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->data ) {
8316  if( entry.covers.has_value() ) {
8317  for( const bodypart_str_id &limb : entry.covers.value() ) {
8318  int coverage = get_coverage( limb, type );
8319  if( coverage ) {
8320  avg_coverage += coverage;
8321  ++avg_ctr;
8322  }
8323  }
8324  }
8325  }
8326  if( avg_coverage == 0 ) {
8327  return 0;
8328  } else {
8329  avg_coverage /= avg_ctr;
8330  return avg_coverage;
8331  }
8332 }
8333 
8334 int item::get_coverage( const bodypart_id &bodypart, const cover_type &type ) const
8335 {
8336  if( const armor_portion_data *portion_data = portion_for_bodypart( bodypart ) ) {
8337  switch( type ) {
8338  case cover_type::COVER_DEFAULT:
8339  return portion_data->coverage;
8340  case cover_type::COVER_MELEE:
8341  return portion_data->cover_melee;
8342  case cover_type::COVER_RANGED:
8343  return portion_data->cover_ranged;
8344  case cover_type::COVER_VITALS:
8345  return portion_data->cover_vitals;
8346  }
8347  }
8348  return 0;
8349 }
8350 
8351 int item::get_coverage( const sub_bodypart_id &bodypart, const cover_type &type ) const
8352 {
8353  if( const armor_portion_data *portion_data = portion_for_bodypart( bodypart ) ) {
8354  switch( type ) {
8355  case cover_type::COVER_DEFAULT:
8356  return portion_data->coverage;
8357  case cover_type::COVER_MELEE:
8358  return portion_data->cover_melee;
8359  case cover_type::COVER_RANGED:
8360  return portion_data->cover_ranged;
8361  case cover_type::COVER_VITALS:
8362  return portion_data->cover_vitals;
8363  }
8364  }
8365  return 0;
8366 }
8367 
8368 bool item::has_sublocations() const
8369 {
8370  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8371  if( !t ) {
8372  return false;
8373  }
8374  return t->has_sub_coverage;
8375 }
8376 
8377 const armor_portion_data *item::portion_for_bodypart( const bodypart_id &bodypart ) const
8378 {
8379  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8380  if( !t ) {
8381  return nullptr;
8382  }
8383  for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->data ) {
8384  if( entry.covers.has_value() && entry.covers->test( bodypart.id() ) ) {
8385  return &entry;
8386  }
8387  }
8388  return nullptr;
8389 }
8390 
8391 const armor_portion_data *item::portion_for_bodypart( const sub_bodypart_id &bodypart ) const
8392 {
8393  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8394  if( !t ) {
8395  return nullptr;
8396  }
8397  for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->sub_data ) {
8398  for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &tmp : entry.sub_coverage ) {
8399  const sub_bodypart_id &subpart = tmp;
8400  if( subpart == bodypart ) {
8401  return &entry;
8402  }
8403  }
8404  }
8405  return nullptr;
8406 }
8407 
8408 float item::get_thickness() const
8409 {
8410  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8411  // if an item isn't armor we assume it is 1mm thick
8412  // TODO: Estimate normal items thickness or protection based on weight and density
8413  if( t == nullptr ) {
8414  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->thickness : 1.0f;
8415  }
8416  return t->avg_thickness();
8417 }
8418 
8419 float item::get_thickness( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8420 {
8421  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8422  // don't return a fixed value for this one since an item is never going to be covering a body part
8423  if( t == nullptr ) {
8424  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->thickness : 0.0f;
8425  }
8426 
8427  for( const armor_portion_data &data : t->data ) {
8428  if( !data.covers.has_value() ) {
8429  continue;
8430  }
8431  for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
8432  if( bp == bpid ) {
8433  return data.avg_thickness;
8434  }
8435  }
8436  }
8437  // body part not covered by this armour
8438  return 0.0f;
8439 }
8440 
8441 float item::get_thickness( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const
8442 {
8443  return get_thickness( bp->parent );
8444 }
8445 
8446 int item::get_warmth() const
8447 {
8448  const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8449  if( t == nullptr ) {
8450  return 0;
8451  }
8452  int result = t->warmth;
8453 
8454  result += get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_warmth );
8455 
8456  return result;
8457 }
8458 
8459 int item::get_warmth( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8460 {
8461  double warmth_val = 0.0;
8462  float limb_coverage = 0.0f;
8463  if( !covers( bp ) ) {
8464  return 0;
8465  }
8466  warmth_val = get_warmth();
8467  // calculate how much of the limb the armor ideally covers
8468  // idea being that an item that covers the shoulders and torso shouldn't
8469  // heat the whole arm like it covers it
8470  // TODO: fully configure this per armor entry
8471  if( !has_sublocations() ) {
8472  // if it doesn't have sublocations it has 100% covered
8473  limb_coverage = 100;
8474  } else {
8475  for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &sbp : bp->sub_parts ) {
8476  if( !covers( sbp ) ) {
8477  continue;
8478  }
8479 
8480  // TODO: handle non 100% sub body part coverages
8481  limb_coverage += sbp->max_coverage;
8482  }
8483  }
8484  return std::round( warmth_val * limb_coverage / 100.0f );
8485 }
8486 
8487 units::volume item::get_pet_armor_max_vol() const
8488 {
8489  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->max_vol : 0_ml;
8490 }
8491 
8492 units::volume item::get_pet_armor_min_vol() const
8493 {
8494  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->min_vol : 0_ml;
8495 }
8496 
8497 std::string item::get_pet_armor_bodytype() const
8498 {
8499  return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->bodytype : "";
8500 }
8501 
8502 time_duration item::brewing_time() const
8503 {
8504  return is_brewable() ? type->brewable->time * calendar::season_from_default_ratio() : 0_turns;
8505 }
8506 
8507 const std::map<itype_id, int> &item::brewing_results() const
8508 {
8509  static const std::map<itype_id, int> nulresult{};
8510  return is_brewable() ? type->brewable->results : nulresult;
8511 }
8512 
8513 time_duration item::composting_time() const
8514 {
8515  return is_compostable() ? type->compostable->time * calendar::season_from_default_ratio() : 0_turns;
8516 }
8517 
8518 const std::map<itype_id, int> &item::composting_results() const
8519 {
8520  static const std::map<itype_id, int> nulresult{};
8521  return is_compostable() ? type->compostable->results : nulresult;
8522 }
8523 
8524 bool item::can_revive() const
8525 {
8526  return is_corpse() && ( corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_REVIVES ) || has_var( "zombie_form" ) ) &&
8527  damage() < max_damage() &&
8528  !( has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS ) || has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS_FAILED ) ||
8529  has_flag( flag_QUARTERED ) ||
8530  has_flag( flag_SKINNED ) || has_flag( flag_PULPED ) );
8531 }
8532 
8533 bool item::ready_to_revive( map &here, const tripoint &pos ) const
8534 {
8535  if( !can_revive() ) {
8536  return false;
8537  }
8538  if( here.veh_at( pos ) ) {
8539  return false;
8540  }
8541  if( !calendar::once_every( 1_seconds ) ) {
8542  return false;
8543  }
8544  int age_in_hours = to_hours<int>( age() );
8545  age_in_hours -= static_cast<int>( static_cast<float>( burnt ) / ( volume() / 250_ml ) );
8546  if( damage_level() > 0 ) {
8547  age_in_hours /= ( damage_level() + 1 );
8548  }
8549  int rez_factor = 48 - age_in_hours;
8550  if( age_in_hours > 6 && ( rez_factor <= 0 || one_in( rez_factor ) ) ) {
8551  // If we're a special revival zombie, wait to get up until the player is nearby.
8552  const bool isReviveSpecial = has_flag( flag_REVIVE_SPECIAL );
8553  if( isReviveSpecial ) {
8554  const int distance = rl_dist( pos, get_player_character().pos() );
8555  if( distance > 3 ) {
8556  return false;
8557  }
8558  if( !one_in( distance + 1 ) ) {
8559  return false;
8560  }
8561  }
8562 
8563  return true;
8564  }
8565  return false;
8566 }
8567 
8568 bool item::is_money() const
8569 {
8570  return is_money( ammo_types() );
8571 }
8572 
8573 bool item::is_money( const std::set<ammotype> &ammo ) const
8574 {
8575  return ammo.count( ammo_money );
8576 }
8577 
8578 bool item::is_cash_card() const
8579 {
8580  return typeId() == itype_cash_card;
8581 }
8582 
8583 bool item::is_software() const
8584 {
8585  if( const std::optional<itype_id> &cont = type->default_container ) {
8586  return item( *cont ).is_software_storage();
8587  }
8588  return false;
8589 }
8590 
8591 bool item::is_software_storage() const
8592 {
8593  return contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::SOFTWARE );
8594 }
8595 
8596 bool item::is_ebook_storage() const
8597 {
8598  return contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::EBOOK );
8599 }
8600 
8601 bool item::is_maybe_melee_weapon() const
8602 {
8603  item_category_id my_cat_id = get_category_shallow().id;
8604  return my_cat_id == item_category_weapons || my_cat_id == item_category_spare_parts ||
8605  my_cat_id == item_category_tools;
8606 }
8607 
8608 bool item::has_edged_damage() const
8609 {
8610  for( const damage_type &dt : damage_type::get_all() ) {
8611  if( dt.edged && is_melee( dt.id ) ) {
8612  return true;
8613  }
8614  }
8615  return false;
8616 }
8617 
8618 bool item::count_by_charges() const
8619 {
8620  return type->count_by_charges();
8621 }
8622 
8623 int item::count() const
8624 {
8625  return count_by_charges() ? charges : 1;
8626 }
8627 
8628 bool item::craft_has_charges() const
8629 {
8630  return count_by_charges() || ammo_types().empty();
8631 }
8632 
8633 float item::get_clothing_mod_val_for_damage_type( const damage_type_id &dmg_type ) const
8634 {
8635  // FIXME: Hardcoded damage types
8636  if( dmg_type == damage_bash ) {
8637  return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_bash );
8638  } else if( dmg_type == damage_cut ) {
8639  return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_cut );
8640  } else if( dmg_type == damage_bullet ) {
8641  return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_bullet );
8642  } else if( dmg_type == damage_heat ) {
8643  return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_fire );
8644  } else if( dmg_type == damage_acid ) {
8645  return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_acid );
8646  }
8647  return 0.0f; // No mods for other damage types
8648 }
8649 
8650 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
8651 // Deal with MSVC compiler bug (#17791, #17958)
8652 #pragma optimize( "", off )
8653 #endif
8654 
8655 bool item::damage_type_can_damage_items( const damage_type_id &dmg_type ) const
8656 {
8657  return dmg_type->physical;
8658 }
8659 
8660 template<typename bodypart_target>
8661 float item::resist( const damage_type_id &dmg_type, const bool to_self,
8662  const bodypart_target &bp,
8663  const int resist_value ) const
8664 {
8665  if( is_null() ) {
8666  return 0.0f;
8667  }
8668 
8669  if( dmg_type.is_null() ) {
8670  return 0.0f;
8671  }
8672 
8673  if( !dmg_type.is_valid() ) {
8674  debugmsg( "Invalid damage type: %d", dmg_type.c_str() );
8675  return 0.0f;
8676  }
8677 
8678  // Implicit item damage immunity for damage types listed prior to bash
8679  // Acid/fire immunity would be handled in _environmental_resist, but there are more
8680  // dmg types that do not affect items such as PURE/COLD etc..
8681  if( to_self && !damage_type_can_damage_items( dmg_type ) ) {
8682  return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
8683  }
8684 
8685  const bool bp_null = bp == bodypart_target();
8686  const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats = armor_made_of( bp );
8687  const float avg_thickness = bp_null ? get_thickness() : get_thickness( bp );
8688  return _resist( dmg_type, to_self, resist_value, bp_null, armor_mats, avg_thickness );
8689 }
8690 template float item::resist<bodypart_id>( const damage_type_id &dmg_type,
8691  const bool to_self, const bodypart_id &bp, const int resist_value ) const;
8692 template float item::resist<sub_bodypart_id>( const damage_type_id &dmg_type,
8693  const bool to_self, const sub_bodypart_id &bp, const int resist_value ) const;
8694 
8695 float item::_resist( const damage_type_id &dmg_type, bool to_self, int resist_value,
8696  const bool bp_null,
8697  const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats,
8698  const float avg_thickness ) const
8699 {
8700  if( dmg_type->env ) {
8701  return _environmental_resist( dmg_type, to_self, resist_value, bp_null, armor_mats );
8702  }
8703 
8704  std::optional<std::pair<damage_type_id, float>> derived;
8705  if( !dmg_type->derived_from.first.is_null() ) {
8706  derived = dmg_type->derived_from;
8707  }
8708 
8709  float resist = 0.0f;
8710  float mod = get_clothing_mod_val_for_damage_type( dmg_type );
8711 
8712  const float damage_scale = damage_adjusted_armor_resist( 1.0f );
8713 
8714  if( !bp_null ) {
8715  // If we have armour portion materials for this body part, use that instead
8716  if( !armor_mats.empty() ) {
8717  for( const part_material *m : armor_mats ) {
8718  // only count the material if it's hit
8719 
8720  // if roll is -1 each material is rolled at this point individually
8721  int internal_roll;
8722  resist_value < 0 ? internal_roll = rng( 0, 99 ) : internal_roll = resist_value;
8723  if( internal_roll < m->cover ) {
8724  float tmp_add = 0.f;
8725  if( derived.has_value() && !m->id->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8726  tmp_add = m->id->resist( derived->first ) * m->thickness * derived->second;
8727  } else {
8728  tmp_add = m->id->resist( dmg_type ) * m->thickness;
8729  }
8730  resist += tmp_add;
8731  }
8732  }
8733  return ( resist + mod ) * damage_scale;
8734  }
8735  }
8736 
8737  // base resistance
8738  const std::map<material_id, int> mats = made_of();
8739  if( !mats.empty() ) {
8740  const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8741  for( const auto &m : mats ) {
8742  float tmp_add = 0.f;
8743  if( derived.has_value() && !m.first->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8744  tmp_add = m.first->resist( derived->first ) * m.second * derived->second;
8745  } else {
8746  tmp_add = m.first->resist( dmg_type ) * m.second;
8747  }
8748  resist += tmp_add;
8749  }
8750  // Average based portion of materials
8751  resist /= total;
8752  }
8753 
8754  return ( resist * avg_thickness + mod ) * damage_scale;
8755 }
8756 
8757 float item::_environmental_resist( const damage_type_id &dmg_type, const bool to_self,
8758  int base_env_resist,
8759  const bool bp_null,
8760  const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats ) const
8761 {
8762  if( to_self ) {
8763  // Currently no items are damaged by acid, and fire is handled elsewhere
8764  return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
8765  }
8766 
8767  std::optional<std::pair<damage_type_id, float>> derived;
8768  if( !dmg_type->derived_from.first.is_null() ) {
8769  derived = dmg_type->derived_from;
8770  }
8771 
8772  float resist = 0.0f;
8773  float mod = get_clothing_mod_val_for_damage_type( dmg_type );
8774 
8775  if( !bp_null ) {
8776  // If we have armour portion materials for this body part, use that instead
8777  if( !armor_mats.empty() ) {
8778  for( const part_material *m : armor_mats ) {
8779  float tmp_add = 0.f;
8780  if( derived.has_value() && !m->id->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8781  tmp_add = m->id->resist( derived->first ) * m->cover * 0.01f * derived->second;
8782  } else {
8783  tmp_add = m->id->resist( dmg_type ) * m->cover * 0.01f;
8784  }
8785  resist += tmp_add;
8786  }
8787  const int env = get_env_resist( base_env_resist );
8788  if( env < 10 ) {
8789  resist *= env / 10.0f;
8790  }
8791  }
8792  return resist + mod;
8793  }
8794 
8795  const std::map<material_id, int> mats = made_of();
8796  if( !mats.empty() ) {
8797  const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8798  // Not sure why cut and bash get an armor thickness bonus but acid/fire doesn't,
8799  // but such is the way of the code.
8800  for( const auto &m : mats ) {
8801  float tmp_add = 0.f;
8802  if( derived.has_value() && !m.first->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8803  tmp_add = m.first->resist( derived->first ) * m.second * derived->second;
8804  } else {
8805  tmp_add = m.first->resist( dmg_type ) * m.second;
8806  }
8807  resist += tmp_add;
8808  }
8809  // Average based portion of materials
8810  resist /= total;
8811  }
8812
