8813  const int env = get_env_resist( base_env_resist );
8814  if( env < 10 ) {
8815  // Low env protection means it doesn't prevent acid seeping in.
8816  resist *= env / 10.0f;
8817  }
8818 
8819  return resist + mod;
8820 }
8821 
8822 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
8823 #pragma optimize( "", on )
8824 #endif
8825 
8826 int item::breathability( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8827 {
8828  const bool bp_null = bp == bodypart_id();
8829  // if the armor doesn't have armor data
8830  // or its not on a specific limb
8831  if( bp_null || armor_made_of( bp ).empty() ) {
8832  return breathability();
8833  }
8834  const armor_portion_data *a = portion_for_bodypart( bp );
8835  if( a == nullptr ) {
8836  // if it doesn't cover it breathes great
8837  return 100;
8838  }
8839 
8840  return a->breathability;
8841 }
8842 
8843 int item::breathability() const
8844 {
8845  // very rudimentary average for simple armor and non limb based situations
8846  int breathability = 0;
8847 
8848  const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8849  const std::map<material_id, int> mats = made_of();
8850  if( !mats.empty() ) {
8851  for( const auto &m : mats ) {
8852  breathability += m.first->breathability() * m.second;
8853  }
8854  // Average based portion of materials
8855  breathability /= total;
8856  }
8857 
8858  return breathability;
8859 }
8860 
8861 int item::chip_resistance( bool worst, const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8862 {
8863  int res = worst ? INT_MAX : INT_MIN;
8864  if( bp != bodypart_id() ) {
8865  const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats = armor_made_of( bp );
8866  // If we have armour portion materials for this body part, use that instead
8867  if( !armor_mats.empty() ) {
8868  for( const part_material *m : armor_mats ) {
8869  const int val = m->id->chip_resist() * m->cover;
8870  res = worst ? std::min( res, val ) : std::max( res, val );
8871  }
8872  if( res == INT_MAX || res == INT_MIN ) {
8873  return 2;
8874  }
8875  res /= 100;
8876  if( res <= 0 ) {
8877  return 0;
8878  }
8879  return res;
8880  }
8881  }
8882 
8883  const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8884  for( const std::pair<material_id, int> mat : made_of() ) {
8885  const int val = ( mat.first->chip_resist() * mat.second ) / total;
8886  res = worst ? std::min( res, val ) : std::max( res, val );
8887  }
8888 
8889  if( res == INT_MAX || res == INT_MIN ) {
8890  return 2;
8891  }
8892 
8893  if( res <= 0 ) {
8894  return 0;
8895  }
8896 
8897  return res;
8898 }
8899 
8900 int item::max_damage() const
8901 {
8902  return type->damage_max();
8903 }
8904 
8905 float item::get_relative_health() const
8906 {
8907  const int max_dmg = max_damage();
8908  if( max_dmg == 0 ) { // count_by_charges items
8909  return 1.0f;
8910  }
8911  return 1.0f - static_cast<float>( damage() ) / max_dmg;
8912 }
8913 
8914 static int get_degrade_amount( const item &it, int dmgNow_, int dmgPrev )
8915 {
8916  const int max_dmg = it.max_damage();
8917  const int degrade_increments = it.type->degrade_increments();
8918  if( max_dmg == 0 || degrade_increments == 0 ) {
8919  return 0; // count by charges
8920  }
8921  const int facNow_ = dmgNow_ == 0 ? -1 : ( dmgNow_ - 1 ) * 5 / max_dmg;
8922  const int facPrev = dmgPrev == 0 ? -1 : ( dmgPrev - 1 ) * 5 / max_dmg;
8923 
8924  return std::max( facNow_ - facPrev, 0 ) * max_dmg / degrade_increments;
8925 }
8926 
8927 bool item::mod_damage( int qty )
8928 {
8929  if( has_flag( flag_UNBREAKABLE ) ) {
8930  return false;
8931  }
8932  if( count_by_charges() ) {
8933  charges -= std::min( type->stack_size * qty / itype::damage_scale, charges );
8934  return charges == 0; // return destroy = true if no charges
8935  } else {
8936  const int dmg_before = damage_;
8937  const bool destroy = ( damage_ + qty ) > max_damage();
8938  set_damage( damage_ + qty );
8939 
8940  if( qty > 0 && !destroy ) { // apply automatic degradation
8941  set_degradation( degradation_ + get_degrade_amount( *this, damage_, dmg_before ) );
8942  }
8943  return destroy;
8944  }
8945 }
8946 
8947 bool item::inc_damage()
8948 {
8949  return mod_damage( itype::damage_scale );
8950 }
8951 
8952 int item::repairable_levels() const
8953 {
8954  const int levels = type->damage_level( damage_ ) - type->damage_level( degradation_ );
8955 
8956  return levels > 0
8957  ? levels // full integer levels of damage
8958  : damage() > degradation(); // partial level of damage can still be repaired
8959 }
8960 
8961 item::armor_status item::damage_armor_durability( damage_unit &du, const bodypart_id &bp )
8962 {
8963  if( has_flag( flag_UNBREAKABLE ) ) {
8964  return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8965  }
8966 
8967  // We want armor's own resistance to this type, not the resistance it grants
8968  const float armors_own_resist = resist( du.type, true, bp );
8969  if( armors_own_resist > 1000.0f ) {
8970  // This is some weird type that doesn't damage armors
8971  return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8972  }
8973  // Fragile items take damage if the block more than 15% of their armor value
8974  if( has_flag( flag_FRAGILE ) && du.amount / armors_own_resist > 0.15f ) {
8975  return mod_damage( itype::damage_scale ) ? armor_status::DESTROYED : armor_status::DAMAGED;
8976  }
8977 
8978  // Scale chance of article taking damage based on the number of parts it covers.
8979  // This represents large articles being able to take more punishment
8980  // before becoming ineffective or being destroyed.
8981  const int num_parts_covered = get_covered_body_parts().count();
8982  if( !one_in( num_parts_covered ) ) {
8983  return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8984  }
8985 
8986  // Don't damage armor as much when bypassed by armor piercing
8987  // Most armor piercing damage comes from bypassing armor, not forcing through
8988  const float post_mitigated_dmg = du.amount;
8989  // more gradual damage chance calc
8990  const float damaged_chance = 0.11 * ( post_mitigated_dmg / ( armors_own_resist + 2 ) ) + 0.1;
8991  if( post_mitigated_dmg > armors_own_resist ) {
8992  // handle overflow, if you take a lot of damage your armor should be damaged
8993  if( damaged_chance >= 1 ) {
8994  return armor_status::DAMAGED;
8995  }
8996  if( one_in( 1 / ( 1 - damaged_chance ) ) ) {
8997  return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8998  }
8999  } else {
9000  // Sturdy items and power armors never take chip damage.
9001  // Other armors have 0.5% of getting damaged from hits below their armor value.
9002  if( has_flag( flag_STURDY ) || is_power_armor() || !one_in( 200 ) ) {
9003  return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
9004  }
9005  }
9006 
9007  return mod_damage( itype::damage_scale ) ? armor_status::DESTROYED : armor_status::DAMAGED;
9008 }
9009 
9010 item::armor_status item::damage_armor_transforms( damage_unit &du ) const
9011 {
9012  // We want armor's own resistance to this type, not the resistance it grants
9013  const float armors_own_resist = resist( du.type, true );
9014 
9015  // to avoid dumb chip damage plates shouldn't ever transform if they take less than
9016  // 20% of their protection in damage
9017  if( du.amount / armors_own_resist < 0.2f ) {
9018  return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
9019  }
9020 
9021  // plates are rated to survive 3 shots at the caliber they protect
9022  // linearly scale off the scale value to find the chance it breaks
9023  float break_chance = 33.3f * ( du.amount / armors_own_resist );
9024 
9025  float roll_to_break = rng_float( 0.0, 100.0 );
9026 
9027  if( roll_to_break < break_chance ) {
9028  //the plate is broken
9029  return armor_status::TRANSFORMED;
9030  }
9031  return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
9032 }
9033 
9034 std::string item::damage_indicator() const
9035 {
9036  return cata::options::damage_indicators[damage_level()];
9037 }
9038 
9039 std::string item::durability_indicator( bool include_intact ) const
9040 {
9041  const std::string item_health_option = get_option<std::string>( "ITEM_HEALTH" );
9042  const bool show_bars_only = item_health_option == "bars";
9043  const bool show_description_only = item_health_option == "descriptions";
9044  const bool show_both = item_health_option == "both";
9045  const bool show_bars = show_both || show_bars_only;
9046  const bool show_description = show_both || show_description_only;
9047  std::string bars;
9048  std::string description;
9049  if( show_bars ) {
9050  bars = damage_indicator() + degradation_symbol() + "\u00A0";
9051  }
9052  if( damage() < 0 ) {
9053  if( show_description ) {
9054  if( is_gun() ) {
9055  description = pgettext( "damage adjective", "accurized " );
9056  } else {
9057  description = pgettext( "damage adjective", "reinforced " );
9058  }
9059  }
9060  if( show_bars_only ) {
9061  return bars;
9062  }
9063  if( show_description_only ) {
9064  return description;
9065  }
9066  return bars + description;
9067  }
9068  if( has_flag( flag_CORPSE ) ) {
9069  if( damage() > 0 ) {
9070  switch( damage_level() ) {
9071  case 1:
9072  return pgettext( "damage adjective", "bruised " );
9073  case 2:
9074  return pgettext( "damage adjective", "damaged " );
9075  case 3:
9076  return pgettext( "damage adjective", "mangled " );
9077  default:
9078  return pgettext( "damage adjective", "pulped " );
9079  }
9080  }
9081  }
9082  if( show_bars_only ) {
9083  return bars;
9084  }
9085  description = string_format( "%s ", get_base_material().dmg_adj( damage_level() ) );
9086  if( description == " " ) {
9087  if( include_intact ) {
9088  description = _( "fully intact " );
9089  } else {
9090  description = "";
9091  }
9092  }
9093  if( show_description_only ) {
9094  return description;
9095  }
9096  return bars + description;
9097 }
9098 
9099 const std::set<itype_id> &item::repaired_with() const
9100 {
9101  static std::set<itype_id> no_repair;
9102  static std::set<itype_id> tools;
9103  tools.clear();
9104 
9105  std::copy_if( type->repair.begin(), type->repair.end(), std::inserter( tools, tools.begin() ),
9106  []( const itype_id & i ) {
9107  return !item_is_blacklisted( i );
9108  } );
9109 
9110  return has_flag( flag_NO_REPAIR ) ? no_repair : tools;
9111 }
9112 
9113 void item::mitigate_damage( damage_unit &du, const bodypart_id &bp, int roll ) const
9114 {
9115  const resistances res = resistances( *this, false, roll, bp );
9116  const float mitigation = res.get_effective_resist( du );
9117  // get_effective_resist subtracts the flat penetration value before multiplying the remaining armor.
9118  // therefore, res_pen is reduced by the full value of the item's armor value even though mitigation might be smaller (such as an attack with a 0.5 armor multiplier)
9119  du.res_pen -= res.type_resist( du.type );
9120  du.res_pen = std::max( 0.0f, du.res_pen );
9121  du.amount -= mitigation;
9122  du.amount = std::max( 0.0f, du.amount );
9123 }
9124 
9125 void item::mitigate_damage( damage_unit &du, const sub_bodypart_id &bp, int roll ) const
9126 {
9127  const resistances res = resistances( *this, false, roll, bp );
9128  const float mitigation = res.get_effective_resist( du );
9129  // get_effective_resist subtracts the flat penetration value before multiplying the remaining armor.
9130  // therefore, res_pen is reduced by the full value of the item's armor value even though mitigation might be smaller (such as an attack with a 0.5 armor multiplier)
9131  du.res_pen -= res.type_resist( du.type );
9132  du.res_pen = std::max( 0.0f, du.res_pen );
9133  du.amount -= mitigation;
9134  du.amount = std::max( 0.0f, du.amount );
9135 }
9136 
9137 bool item::is_two_handed( const Character &guy ) const
9138 {
9139  if( has_flag( flag_ALWAYS_TWOHAND ) ) {
9140  return true;
9141  }
9142  ///\EFFECT_STR determines which weapons can be wielded with one hand
9143  return ( ( weight() / 113_gram ) > guy.get_arm_str() * 4 );
9144 }
9145 
9146 const std::map<material_id, int> &item::made_of() const
9147 {
9148  if( is_corpse() ) {
9149  return corpse->mat;
9150  }
9151  return type->materials;
9152 }
9153 
9154 std::vector<const part_material *> item::armor_made_of( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
9155 {
9156  std::vector<const part_material *> matlist;
9157  const islot_armor *a = find_armor_data();
9158  if( a == nullptr || a->data.empty() || !covers( bp ) ) {
9159  return matlist;
9160  }
9161  for( const armor_portion_data &d : a->data ) {
9162  if( !d.covers.has_value() ) {
9163  continue;
9164  }
9165  for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : d.covers.value() ) {
9166  if( bp != bpid ) {
9167  continue;
9168  }
9169  matlist.reserve( matlist.size() + d.materials.size() );
9170  for( const part_material &m : d.materials ) {
9171  matlist.emplace_back( &m );
9172  }
9173  return matlist;
9174  }
9175  }
9176  return matlist;
9177 }
9178 
9179 std::vector<const part_material *> item::armor_made_of( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const
9180 {
9181  std::vector<const part_material *> matlist;
9182  const islot_armor *a = find_armor_data();
9183  if( a == nullptr || a->data.empty() || !covers( bp ) ) {
9184  return matlist;
9185  }
9186  for( const armor_portion_data &d : a->sub_data ) {
9187  if( d.sub_coverage.empty() ) {
9188  continue;
9189  }
9190  for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : d.sub_coverage ) {
9191  if( bp != bpid ) {
9192  continue;
9193  }
9194  for( const part_material &m : d.materials ) {
9195  matlist.emplace_back( &m );
9196  }
9197  return matlist;
9198  }
9199  }
9200  return matlist;
9201 }
9202 
9203 std::vector<const material_type *> item::made_of_types() const
9204 {
9205  std::vector<const material_type *> material_types_composed_of;
9206  if( is_corpse() ) {
9207  for( const auto &mat_id : made_of() ) {
9208  material_types_composed_of.push_back( &mat_id.first.obj() );
9209  }
9210  } else {
9211  for( const auto &mat_id : type->materials ) {
9212  material_types_composed_of.push_back( &mat_id.first.obj() );
9213  }
9214  }
9215  return material_types_composed_of;
9216 }
9217 
9218 bool item::made_of_any( const std::set<material_id> &mat_idents ) const
9219 {
9220  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
9221  if( mats.empty() ) {
9222  return false;
9223  }
9224 
9225  return std::any_of( mats.begin(),
9226  mats.end(), [&mat_idents]( const std::pair<material_id, int> &e ) {
9227  return mat_idents.count( e.first );
9228  } );
9229 }
9230 
9231 bool item::only_made_of( const std::set<material_id> &mat_idents ) const
9232 {
9233  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
9234  if( mats.empty() ) {
9235  return false;
9236  }
9237 
9238  return std::all_of( mats.begin(),
9239  mats.end(), [&mat_idents]( const std::pair<material_id, int> &e ) {
9240  return mat_idents.count( e.first );
9241  } );
9242 }
9243 
9244 int item::made_of( const material_id &mat_ident ) const
9245 {
9246  const std::map<material_id, int> &materials = made_of();
9247  auto mat = materials.find( mat_ident );
9248  if( mat == materials.end() ) {
9249  return 0;
9250  }
9251  return mat->second;
9252 }
9253 
9254 bool item::can_repair_with( const material_id &mat_ident ) const
9255 {
9256  auto mat = type->repairs_with.find( mat_ident );
9257  return mat != type->repairs_with.end();
9258 }
9259 
9260 bool item::made_of( phase_id phase ) const
9261 {
9262  if( is_null() ) {
9263  return false;
9264  }
9265  return current_phase == phase;
9266 }
9267 
9268 bool item::made_of_from_type( phase_id phase ) const
9269 {
9270  if( is_null() ) {
9271  return false;
9272  }
9273  return type->phase == phase;
9274 }
9275 
9276 bool item::conductive() const
9277 {
9278  if( is_null() ) {
9279  return false;
9280  }
9281 
9282  if( has_flag( flag_CONDUCTIVE ) ) {
9283  return true;
9284  }
9285 
9286  if( has_flag( flag_NONCONDUCTIVE ) ) {
9287  return false;
9288  }
9289 
9290  // If any material has electricity resistance equal to or lower than flesh (1) we are conductive.
9291  const std::vector<const material_type *> &mats = made_of_types();
9292  return std::any_of( mats.begin(), mats.end(), []( const material_type * mt ) {
9293  return mt->is_conductive();
9294  } );
9295 }
9296 
9297 bool item::is_gun() const
9298 {
9299  return !!type->gun;
9300 }
9301 
9302 void item::select_itype_variant()
9303 {
9304  weighted_int_list<std::string> variants;
9305  for( const itype_variant_data &iv : type->variants ) {
9306  variants.add( iv.id, iv.weight );
9307  }
9308 
9309  const std::string *selected = variants.pick();
9310  if( !selected ) {
9311  // No variants exist
9312  return;
9313  }
9314 
9315  set_itype_variant( *selected );
9316 }
9317 
9318 bool item::can_have_itype_variant() const
9319 {
9320  return !type->variants.empty();
9321 }
9322 
9323 bool item::possible_itype_variant( const std::string &test ) const
9324 {
9325  if( !can_have_itype_variant() ) {
9326  return false;
9327  }
9328 
9329  const auto variant_looking_for = [&test]( const itype_variant_data & variant ) {
9330  return variant.id == test;
9331  };
9332 
9333  return std::find_if( type->variants.begin(), type->variants.end(),
9334  variant_looking_for ) != type->variants.end();
9335 }
9336 
9337 bool item::has_itype_variant( bool check_option ) const
9338 {
9339  if( _itype_variant == nullptr ) {
9340  return false;
9341  } else if( !check_option ) {
9342  return true;
9343  }
9344 
9345  switch( type->variant_kind ) {
9346  case itype_variant_kind::gun:
9347  return get_option<bool>( "SHOW_GUN_VARIANTS" );
9348  case itype_variant_kind::drug:
9349  return get_option<bool>( "SHOW_DRUG_VARIANTS" );
9350  default:
9351  return true;
9352  }
9353  return false;
9354 }
9355 
9356 const itype_variant_data &item::itype_variant() const
9357 {
9358  return *_itype_variant;
9359 }
9360 
9361 void item::set_itype_variant( const std::string &variant )
9362 {
9363  if( variant.empty() || type->variants.empty() ) {
9364  return;
9365  }
9366 
9367  if( variant == "<any>" ) {
9368  select_itype_variant();
9369  return;
9370  }
9371 
9372  for( const itype_variant_data &option : type->variants ) {
9373  if( option.id == variant ) {
9374  _itype_variant = &option;
9375  if( option.expand_snippets ) {
9376  set_var( "description", SNIPPET.expand( variant_description() ) );
9377  }
9378  return;
9379  }
9380  }
9381 
9382  debugmsg( "item '%s' has no variant '%s'!", typeId().str(), variant );
9383 }
9384 
9385 std::string item::variant_description() const
9386 {
9387  if( !has_itype_variant() ) {
9388  return "";
9389  }
9390 
9391  // append the description instead of fully overwriting it
9392  if( itype_variant().append ) {
9393  return string_format( pgettext( "variant description", "%s %s" ), type->description.translated(),
9394  itype_variant().alt_description.translated() );
9395  } else {
9396  return itype_variant().alt_description.translated();
9397  }
9398 }
9399 
9400 void item::clear_itype_variant()
9401 {
9402  _itype_variant = nullptr;
9403 }
9404 
9405 bool item::is_firearm() const
9406 {
9407  return is_gun() && !has_flag( flag_PRIMITIVE_RANGED_WEAPON );
9408 }
9409 
9410 int item::get_reload_time() const
9411 {
9412  if( !is_gun() && !is_magazine() ) {
9413  return 0;
9414  }
9415  int reload_time = 0;
9416  if( is_gun() ) {
9417  reload_time = type->gun->reload_time;
9418  } else if( type->magazine ) {
9419  reload_time = type->magazine->reload_time;
9420  } else {
9421  reload_time = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY;
9422  }
9423  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
9424  reload_time = static_cast<int>( reload_time * ( 100 + mod->type->gunmod->reload_modifier ) / 100 );
9425  }
9426 
9427  return reload_time;
9428 }
9429 
9430 bool item::is_silent() const
9431 {
9432  return gun_noise().volume < 5;
9433 }
9434 
9435 bool item::is_gunmod() const
9436 {
9437  return !!type->gunmod;
9438 }
9439 
9440 bool item::is_bionic() const
9441 {
9442  return !!type->bionic;
9443 }
9444 
9445 bool item::is_magazine() const
9446 {
9447  return !!type->magazine || contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
9448 }
9449 
9450 bool item::is_battery() const
9451 {
9452  return is_magazine() && ammo_capacity( ammo_battery );
9453 }
9454 
9455 bool item::is_vehicle_battery() const
9456 {
9457  return !!type->battery;
9458 }
9459 
9460 bool item::is_ammo_belt() const
9461 {
9462  return is_magazine() && has_flag( flag_MAG_BELT );
9463 }

9466 {
9467  return type->can_use( "holster" );
9468 }

9473 }

9476 {
9477  return !!get_comestible();
9478 }
9479 
9480 bool item::is_food() const
9481 {
9482  if( !is_comestible() ) {
9483  return false;
9484  }
9485  const std::string &comest_type = get_comestible()->comesttype;
9486  return comest_type == "FOOD" || comest_type == "DRINK";
9487 }
9488

9492  return false;
9493  }
9494  return get_comestible()->comesttype == "MED";
9495 }

9498 {

9512 bool item::is_food_container() const
9513 {
9514  return ( !is_food() && has_item_with( []( const item & food ) {
9515  return food.is_food();
9516  } ) ) ||
9517  ( is_craft() && !craft_data_->disassembly &&
9518  craft_data_->making->create_results().front().is_food_container() );
9519 }
9520 
9521 bool item::has_temperature() const
9522 {
9523  return is_comestible() || is_corpse();
9524 }

9526 bool item::is_corpse() const
9527 {
9528  return corpse != nullptr && has_flag( flag_CORPSE );

9539  return get_comestible()->specific_heat_liquid;
9540  }
9541  return made_of_types()[0]->specific_heat_liquid();
9542 }

9561 {

9564  }

9566 }
9567 
9568 void item::set_mtype( const mtype *const m )
9569 {
9570  // This is potentially dangerous, e.g. for corpse items, which *must* have a valid mtype pointer.
9571  if( m == nullptr ) {
9572  debugmsg( "setting item::corpse of %s to NULL", tname() );
9573  return;
9574  }
9575  corpse = m;
9576 }
9577 
9578 bool item::is_ammo_container() const
9579 {
9580  return contents.has_any_with(
9581  []( const item & it ) {
9582  return it.is_ammo();
9583  }, pocket_type::CONTAINER );
9584 }
9585 
9586 bool item::is_melee() const
9587 {
9588  for( const damage_type &dt : damage_type::get_all() ) {
9589  if( is_melee( dt.id ) ) {
9590  return true;
9591  }
9592  }
9593  return false;
9594 }
9595 
9596 bool item::is_melee( const damage_type_id &dt ) const
9597 {
9598  return damage_melee( dt ) > MELEE_STAT;
9599 }
9600 
9601 const islot_armor *item::find_armor_data() const
9602 {
9603  if( type->armor ) {
9604  return &*type->armor;
9605  }
9606  // Currently the only way to make a non-armor item into armor is to install a gun mod.
9607  // The gunmods are stored in the items contents, as are the contents of a container, and the
9608  // tools in a tool belt (a container actually), or the ammo in a quiver (container again).
9609  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
9610  if( mod->type->armor ) {
9611  return &*mod->type->armor;
9612  }
9613  }
9614  return nullptr;
9615 }
9616 
9617 bool item::is_pet_armor( bool on_pet ) const
9618 {
9619  bool is_worn = on_pet && !get_var( "pet_armor", "" ).empty();
9620  return has_flag( flag_IS_PET_ARMOR ) && ( is_worn || !on_pet );
9621 }
9622 
9623 bool item::is_armor() const
9624 {
9625  return find_armor_data() != nullptr || has_flag( flag_IS_ARMOR );
9626 }
9627 
9628 bool item::is_book() const
9629 {
9630  return !!type->book;
9631 }
9632 
9633 std::string item::get_book_skill() const
9634 {
9635  if( is_book() ) {
9636  if( type->book->skill->ident() != skill_id::NULL_ID() ) {
9637  return type->book->skill->name();
9638  }
9639  }
9640  return "";
9641 }
9642 
9643 bool item::is_map() const
9644 {
9645  return get_category_shallow().get_id() == item_category_maps;
9646 }
9647 
9648 bool item::seal()
9649 {
9650  if( is_container_full() ) {
9651  return contents.seal_all_pockets();
9652  } else {
9653  return false;
9654  }
9655 }

9676  }
