9759 }
9760 
9761 bool item::is_fuel() const
9762 {
9763  // A fuel is made of only one material
9764  if( type->materials.size() != 1 ) {
9765  return false;
9766  }
9767  // and this material has to produce energy
9768  if( get_base_material().get_fuel_data().energy <= 0_J ) {
9769  return false;
9770  }
9771  // and it needs to be have consumable charges
9772  return count_by_charges();
9773 }
9774 
9775 bool item::is_toolmod() const
9776 {
9777  return !is_gunmod() && type->mod;
9778 }
9779 
9780 bool item::is_irremovable() const
9781 {
9782  return has_flag( flag_IRREMOVABLE );
9783 }
9784 
9785 bool item::is_broken() const
9786 {
9787  return has_flag( flag_ITEM_BROKEN ) || has_fault_flag( std::string( "ITEM_BROKEN" ) );
9788 }
9789 
9790 bool item::is_broken_on_active() const
9791 {
9792  return has_flag( flag_ITEM_BROKEN ) ||
9793  has_fault_flag( std::string( "ITEM_BROKEN" ) ) ||
9794  ( wetness && has_flag( flag_WATER_BREAK_ACTIVE ) );
9795 }
9796 
9797 int item::wind_resist() const
9798 {
9799  std::vector<const material_type *> materials = made_of_types();
9800  if( materials.empty() ) {
9801  debugmsg( "Called item::wind_resist on an item (%s) made of nothing!", tname() );
9802  return 99;
9803  }
9804 
9805  int best = -1;
9806  for( const material_type *mat : materials ) {
9807  std::optional<int> resistance = mat->wind_resist();
9808  if( resistance && *resistance > best ) {
9809  best = *resistance;
9810  }
9811  }
9812 
9813  // Default to 99% effective
9814  if( best == -1 ) {
9815  return 99;
9816  }
9817 
9818  return best;
9819 }
9820 
9821 std::set<fault_id> item::faults_potential() const
9822 {
9823  std::set<fault_id> res;
9824  res.insert( type->faults.begin(), type->faults.end() );
9825  return res;
9826 }
9827 
9828 int item::wheel_area() const
9829 {
9830  return is_wheel() ? type->wheel->diameter * type->wheel->width : 0;
9831 }
9832 
9833 units::energy item::fuel_energy() const
9834 {
9835  // The odd units and division are to avoid integer rounding errors.
9836  return get_base_material().get_fuel_data().energy * units::to_milliliter( base_volume() ) / 1000;
9837 }
9838 
9839 std::string item::fuel_pump_terrain() const
9840 {
9841  return get_base_material().get_fuel_data().pump_terrain;
9842 }
9843 
9844 bool item::has_explosion_data() const
9845 {
9846  return !get_base_material().get_fuel_data().explosion_data.is_empty();
9847 }
9848 
9849 struct fuel_explosion_data item::get_explosion_data() const {
9850  return get_base_material().get_fuel_data().explosion_data;
9851 }
9852 
9853 bool item::is_container_empty() const
9854 {
9855  return contents.empty();
9856 }
9857 
9858 bool item::is_container_full( bool allow_bucket ) const
9859 {
9860  return contents.full( allow_bucket );
9861 }
9862 
9863 bool item::is_magazine_full() const
9864 {
9865  return contents.is_magazine_full();
9866 }
9867 
9868 bool item::can_unload_liquid() const
9869 {
9870  if( has_flag( flag_NO_UNLOAD ) ) {
9871  return false;
9872  }
9873 
9874  return contents.can_unload_liquid();
9875 }
9876 
9877 bool item::contains_no_solids() const
9878 {
9879  return contents.contains_no_solids();
9880 }
9881 
9882 bool item::allows_speedloader( const itype_id &speedloader_id ) const
9883 {
9884  return contents.allows_speedloader( speedloader_id );
9885 }
9886 
9887 bool item::can_reload_with( const item &ammo, bool now ) const
9888 {
9889  if( has_flag( flag_NO_RELOAD ) && !has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) ) {
9890  return false; // turrets ignore NO_RELOAD flag
9891  }
9892 
9893  if( now && ammo.is_magazine() && !ammo.empty() ) {
9894  if( is_tool() ) {
9895  // Dirty hack because "ammo" on tools is actually completely separate thing from "ammo" on guns and "ammo_types()" works only for guns
9896  if( !type->tool->ammo_id.count( ammo.contents.first_ammo().ammo_type() ) ) {
9897  return false;
9898  }
9899  } else {
9900  if( !ammo_types().count( ammo.contents.first_ammo().ammo_type() ) ) {
9901  return false;
9902  }
9903  }
9904  }
9905 
9906  // Check if the item is in general compatible with any reloadable pocket.
9907  return contents.can_reload_with( ammo, now );
9908 }
9909 
9910 bool item::is_salvageable() const
9911 {
9912  if( is_null() ) {
9913  return false;
9914  }
9915  // None of the materials are salvageable or they turn into the original item
9916  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
9917  if( std::none_of( mats.begin(), mats.end(), [this]( const std::pair<material_id, int> &m ) {
9918  return m.first->salvaged_into().has_value() && m.first->salvaged_into().value() != type->get_id();
9919  } ) ) {
9920  return false;
9921  }
9922  return !has_flag( flag_NO_SALVAGE );
9923 }
9924 
9925 bool item::is_disassemblable() const
9926 {
9927  return !ethereal && ( recipe_dictionary::get_uncraft( typeId() ) || typeId() == itype_disassembly );
9928 }
9929 
9930 bool item::is_craft() const
9931 {
9932  return craft_data_ != nullptr;
9933 }
9934 
9935 bool item::is_funnel_container( units::volume &bigger_than ) const
9936 {
9937  if( get_total_capacity() <= bigger_than ) {
9938  return false; // skip contents check, performance
9939  }
9940  return contents.is_funnel_container( bigger_than );
9941 }
9942 
9943 bool item::is_emissive() const
9944 {
9945  return light.luminance > 0 || type->light_emission > 0;
9946 }
9947 
9948 bool item::is_deployable() const
9949 {
9950  return type->can_use( "deploy_furn" ) || type->can_use( "deploy_appliance" );
9951 }
9952 
9953 bool item::is_tool() const
9954 {
9955  return !!type->tool;
9956 }
9957 
9958 bool item::is_transformable() const
9959 {
9960  return type->use_methods.find( "transform" ) != type->use_methods.end();
9961 }
9962 
9963 bool item::is_relic() const
9964 {
9965  return !!relic_data;
9966 }
9967 
9968 bool item::is_same_relic( item const &rhs ) const
9969 {
9970  return ( !is_relic() && !rhs.is_relic() ) ||
9971  ( is_relic() && rhs.is_relic() && *relic_data == *rhs.relic_data );
9972 }
9973 
9974 bool item::is_same_temperature( item const &rhs ) const
9975 {
9976  return ( !has_temperature() && !rhs.has_temperature() ) ||
9977  ( has_temperature() && rhs.has_temperature() &&
9978  has_flag( flag_HOT ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_HOT ) &&
9979  has_flag( flag_COLD ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_COLD ) &&
9980  has_flag( flag_FROZEN ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_FROZEN ) &&
9981  has_flag( flag_MELTS ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_MELTS ) );
9982 }
9983 
9984 bool item::has_relic_recharge() const
9985 {
9986  return is_relic() && relic_data->has_recharge();
9987 }
9988 
9989 bool item::has_relic_activation() const
9990 {
9991  return is_relic() && relic_data->has_activation();
9992 }
9993 
9994 std::vector<enchant_cache> item::get_proc_enchantments() const
9995 {
9996  if( !is_relic() ) {
9997  return std::vector<enchant_cache> {};
9998  }
9999  return relic_data->get_proc_enchantments();
10000 }
10001 
10002 std::vector<enchantment> item::get_defined_enchantments() const
10003 {
10004  if( !is_relic() || !type->relic_data ) {
10005  return std::vector<enchantment> {};
10006  }
10007 
10008  return type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments();
10009 }
10010 
10011 double item::calculate_by_enchantment( const Character &owner, double modify,
10012  enchant_vals::mod value, bool round_value ) const
10013 {
10014  double add_value = 0.0;
10015  double mult_value = 1.0;
10016  for( const enchant_cache &ench : get_proc_enchantments() ) {
10017  if( ench.is_active( owner, *this ) ) {
10018  add_value += ench.get_value_add( value );
10019  mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value );
10020  }
10021  }
10022  if( type->relic_data ) {
10023  for( const enchantment &ench : type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments() ) {
10024  if( ench.is_active( owner, *this ) ) {
10025  add_value += ench.get_value_add( value, owner );
10026  mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value, owner );
10027  }
10028  }
10029  }
10030  modify += add_value;
10031  modify *= mult_value;
10032  if( round_value ) {
10033  modify = std::round( modify );
10034  }
10035  return modify;
10036 }
10037 
10038 double item::calculate_by_enchantment_wield( const Character &owner, double modify,
10039  enchant_vals::mod value,
10040  bool round_value ) const
10041 {
10042  double add_value = 0.0;
10043  double mult_value = 1.0;
10044  for( const enchant_cache &ench : get_proc_enchantments() ) {
10045  if( ench.active_wield() ) {
10046  add_value += ench.get_value_add( value );
10047  mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value );
10048  }
10049  }
10050  if( type->relic_data ) {
10051  for( const enchantment &ench : type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments() ) {
10052  if( ench.active_wield() ) {
10053  add_value += ench.get_value_add( value, owner );
10054  mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value, owner );
10055  }
10056  }
10057  }
10058  modify += add_value;
10059  modify *= mult_value;
10060  if( round_value ) {
10061  modify = std::round( modify );
10062  }
10063  return modify;
10064 }
10065 
10066 units::length item::max_containable_length( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
10067 {
10068  return contents.max_containable_length( unrestricted_pockets_only );
10069 }
10070 
10071 units::length item::min_containable_length() const
10072 {
10073  return contents.min_containable_length();
10074 }
10075 
10076 units::volume item::max_containable_volume() const
10077 {
10078  return contents.max_containable_volume();
10079 }
10080 
10081 ret_val<void> item::is_compatible( const item &it ) const
10082 {
10083  if( this == &it ) {
10084  // does the set of all sets contain itself?
10085  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10086  }
10087  // disallow putting portable holes into bags of holding
10088  if( contents.bigger_on_the_inside( volume() ) &&
10089  it.contents.bigger_on_the_inside( it.volume() ) ) {
10090  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10091  }
10092 
10093  return contents.is_compatible( it );
10094 }
10095 
10096 ret_val<void> item::can_contain_directly( const item &it ) const
10097 {
10098  return can_contain( it, false, false, true, false, item_location(), 10000000_ml, false );
10099 }
10100 
10101 ret_val<void> item::can_contain( const item &it, const bool nested, const bool ignore_rigidity,
10102  const bool ignore_pkt_settings, const bool is_pick_up_inv,
10103  const item_location &parent_it,
10104  units::volume remaining_parent_volume, const bool allow_nested ) const
10105 {
10106  int copies = 1;
10107  return can_contain( it, copies, nested, ignore_rigidity,
10108  ignore_pkt_settings, is_pick_up_inv, parent_it,
10109  remaining_parent_volume, allow_nested );
10110 }
10111 
10112 ret_val<void> item::can_contain( const item &it, int &copies_remaining, const bool nested,
10113  const bool ignore_rigidity, const bool ignore_pkt_settings,
10114  const bool is_pick_up_inv, const item_location &parent_it,
10115  units::volume remaining_parent_volume,
10116  const bool allow_nested ) const
10117 {
10118  if( copies_remaining <= 0 ) {
10119  return ret_val<void>::make_success();
10120  }
10121  if( this == &it || ( parent_it.where() != item_location::type::invalid &&
10122  this == parent_it.get_item() ) ) {
10123  // does the set of all sets contain itself?
10124  // or does this already contain it?
10125  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( "can't put a container into itself" );
10126  }
10127  if( nested && !this->is_container() ) {
10128  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10129  }
10130  // disallow putting portable holes into bags of holding
10131  if( contents.bigger_on_the_inside( volume() ) &&
10132  it.contents.bigger_on_the_inside( it.volume() ) ) {
10133  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10134  }
10135 
10136  if( allow_nested ) {
10137  for( const item_pocket *pkt : contents.get_all_contained_pockets() ) {
10138  if( pkt->empty() ) {
10139  continue;
10140  }
10141 
10142  // early exit for max length no nested item is gonna fix this
10143  if( pkt->max_containable_length() < it.length() ) {
10144  continue;
10145  }
10146 
10147  // If the current pocket has restrictions or blacklists the item or is a holster,
10148  // try the nested pocket regardless of whether it's soft or rigid.
10149  const bool ignore_nested_rigidity =
10150  !pkt->settings.accepts_item( it ) ||
10151  !pkt->get_pocket_data()->get_flag_restrictions().empty() || pkt->is_holster();
10152  for( const item *internal_it : pkt->all_items_top() ) {
10153  if( parent_it.where() != item_location::type::invalid && internal_it == parent_it.get_item() ) {
10154  continue;
10155  }
10156  if( !internal_it->is_container() ) {
10157  continue;
10158  }
10159  auto ret = internal_it->can_contain( it, copies_remaining, true, ignore_nested_rigidity,
10160  ignore_pkt_settings, is_pick_up_inv, parent_it,
10161  pkt->remaining_volume() );
10162  if( copies_remaining <= 0 ) {
10163  return ret;
10164  }
10165  }
10166  }
10167  }
10168 
10169  return nested && !ignore_rigidity ?
10170  contents.can_contain_rigid( it, copies_remaining, ignore_pkt_settings, is_pick_up_inv ) :
10171  contents.can_contain( it, copies_remaining, ignore_pkt_settings, is_pick_up_inv,
10172  remaining_parent_volume );
10173 }
10174 
10175 ret_val<void> item::can_contain( const itype &tp ) const
10176 {
10177  return can_contain( item( &tp ) );
10178 }
10179 
10180 ret_val<void> item::can_contain_partial( const item &it ) const
10181 {
10182  item i_copy = it;
10183  if( i_copy.count_by_charges() ) {
10184  i_copy.charges = 1;
10185  }
10186  return can_contain( i_copy );
10187 }
10188 
10189 ret_val<void> item::can_contain_partial_directly( const item &it ) const
10190 {
10191  item i_copy = it;
10192  if( i_copy.count_by_charges() ) {
10193  i_copy.charges = 1;
10194  }
10195  return can_contain( i_copy, false, false, true, false, item_location(), 10000000_ml, false );
10196 }
10197 
10198 std::pair<item_location, item_pocket *> item::best_pocket( const item &it, item_location &this_loc,
10199  const item *avoid, const bool allow_sealed, const bool ignore_settings,
10200  const bool nested, bool ignore_rigidity )
10201 {
10202  return contents.best_pocket( it, this_loc, avoid, allow_sealed, ignore_settings,
10203  nested, ignore_rigidity );
10204 }
10205 
10206 bool item::spill_contents( Character &c )
10207 {
10208  if( !is_container() || is_container_empty() ) {
10209  return true;
10210  }
10211 
10212  if( c.is_npc() ) {
10213  return spill_contents( c.pos() );
10214  }
10215 
10216  contents.handle_liquid_or_spill( c, /*avoid=*/this );
10217  on_contents_changed();
10218 
10219  return is_container_empty();
10220 }
10221 
10222 bool item::spill_contents( const tripoint &pos )
10223 {
10224  if( !is_container() || is_container_empty() ) {
10225  return true;
10226  }
10227  return contents.spill_contents( pos );
10228 }
10229 
10230 bool item::spill_open_pockets( Character &guy, const item *avoid )
10231 {
10232  return contents.spill_open_pockets( guy, avoid );
10233 }
10234 
10235 void item::overflow( const tripoint &pos, const item_location &loc )
10236 {
10237  contents.overflow( pos, loc );
10238 }
10239 
10240 book_proficiency_bonuses item::get_book_proficiency_bonuses() const
10241 {
10242  book_proficiency_bonuses ret;
10243 
10244  if( is_ebook_storage() ) {
10245  for( const item *book : ebooks() ) {
10246  ret += book->get_book_proficiency_bonuses();
10247  }
10248  }
10249 
10250  if( !type->book ) {
10251  return ret;
10252  }
10253  for( const book_proficiency_bonus &bonus : type->book->proficiencies ) {
10254  ret.add( bonus );
10255  }
10256  return ret;
10257 }
10258 
10259 int item::get_chapters() const
10260 {
10261  if( !type->book ) {
10262  return 0;
10263  }
10264  return type->book->chapters;
10265 }
10266 
10267 int item::get_remaining_chapters( const Character &u ) const
10268 {
10269  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
10270  const std::string var = string_format( "remaining-chapters-%d", u.getID().get_value() );
10271  return get_var( var, get_chapters() );
10272 }
10273 
10274 void item::mark_chapter_as_read( const Character &u )
10275 {
10276  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
10277  const std::string var = string_format( "remaining-chapters-%d", u.getID().get_value() );
10278  if( type->book && type->book->chapters == 0 ) {
10279  // books without chapters will always have remaining chapters == 0, so we don't need to store them
10280  erase_var( var );
10281  return;
10282  }
10283  const int remain = std::max( 0, get_remaining_chapters( u ) - 1 );
10284  set_var( var, remain );
10285 }
10286 
10287 std::set<recipe_id> item::get_saved_recipes() const
10288 {
10289  if( is_broken_on_active() ) {
10290  return {};
10291  }
10292  std::set<recipe_id> result;
10293  for( const std::string &rid_str : string_split( get_var( "EIPC_RECIPES" ), ',' ) ) {
10294  const recipe_id rid( rid_str );
10295  if( rid.is_empty() ) {
10296  continue;
10297  }
10298  if( !rid.is_valid() ) {
10299  DebugLog( D_WARNING, D_GAME ) << type->get_id().str() <<
10300  " contained invalid recipe id '" << rid.str() << "'";
10301  continue;
10302  }
10303  result.emplace( rid );
10304  }
10305  return result;
10306 }
10307 
10308 void item::set_saved_recipes( const std::set<recipe_id> &recipes )
10309 {
10310  set_var( "EIPC_RECIPES", string_join( recipes, "," ) );
10311 }
10312 
10313 std::vector<std::pair<const recipe *, int>> item::get_available_recipes(
10314  const Character &u ) const
10315 {
10316  std::vector<std::pair<const recipe *, int>> recipe_entries;
10317  if( is_book() ) {
10318  if( !u.has_identified( typeId() ) ) {
10319  return {};
10320  }
10321 
10322  for( const islot_book::recipe_with_description_t &elem : type->book->recipes ) {
10323  if( u.get_knowledge_level( elem.recipe->skill_used ) >= elem.skill_level ) {
10324  recipe_entries.emplace_back( elem.recipe, elem.skill_level );
10325  }
10326  }
10327  } else {
10328  for( const recipe_id &rid : get_saved_recipes() ) {
10329  const recipe *r = &rid.obj();
10330  if( u.get_knowledge_level( r->skill_used ) >= r->difficulty ) {
10331  recipe_entries.emplace_back( r, r->difficulty );
10332  }
10333  }
10334  }
10335  return recipe_entries;
10336 }
10337 
10338 const material_type &item::get_random_material() const
10339 {
10340  std::vector<material_id> matlist;
10341  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
10342  matlist.reserve( mats.size() );
10343  for( auto mat : mats ) {
10344  matlist.emplace_back( mat.first );
10345  }
10346  return *random_entry( matlist, material_id::NULL_ID() );
10347 }
10348 
10349 const material_type &item::get_base_material() const
10350 {
10351  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
10352  const material_type *m = &material_id::NULL_ID().obj();
10353  int portion = 0;
10354  for( const std::pair<material_id, int> mat : mats ) {
10355  if( mat.second > portion ) {
10356  portion = mat.second;
10357  m = &mat.first.obj();
10358  }
10359  }
10360  // Material portions all equal / not specified. Select first material.
10361  if( portion == 1 ) {
10362  if( is_corpse() ) {
10363  return corpse->mat.begin()->first.obj();
10364  }
10365  return *type->default_mat;
10366  }
10367  return *m;
10368 }
10369 
10370 bool item::operator<( const item &other ) const
10371 {
10372  const item_category &cat_a = get_category_of_contents();
10373  const item_category &cat_b = other.get_category_of_contents();
10374  if( cat_a != cat_b ) {
10375  return cat_a < cat_b;
10376  } else {
10377 
10378  if( this->typeId() == other.typeId() ) {
10379  if( this->is_money() ) {
10380  return this->charges > other.charges;
10381  }
10382  return this->charges < other.charges;
10383  } else {
10384  std::string n1 = this->type->nname( 1 );
10385  std::string n2 = other.type->nname( 1 );
10386  return localized_compare( n1, n2 );
10387  }
10388  }
10389 }
10390 
10391 skill_id item::gun_skill() const
10392 {
10393  if( !is_gun() ) {
10394  return skill_id::NULL_ID();
10395  }
10396  return type->gun->skill_used;
10397 }
10398 
10399 gun_type_type item::gun_type() const
10400 {
10401  static skill_id skill_archery( "archery" );
10402 
10403  if( !is_gun() ) {
10404  return gun_type_type( std::string() );
10405  }
10406  // TODO: move to JSON and remove extraction of this from "GUN" (via skill id)
10407  //and from "GUNMOD" (via "mod_targets") in lang/extract_json_strings.py
10408  if( gun_skill() == skill_archery ) {
10409  if( ammo_types().count( ammo_bolt ) || typeId() == itype_bullet_crossbow ) {
10410  return gun_type_type( translate_marker_context( "gun_type_type", "crossbow" ) );
10411  } else {
10412  return gun_type_type( translate_marker_context( "gun_type_type", "bow" ) );
10413  }
10414  }
10415  return gun_type_type( gun_skill().str() );
10416 }
10417 
10418 skill_id item::melee_skill() const
10419 {
10420  if( !is_melee() ) {
10421  return skill_id::NULL_ID();
10422  }
10423 
10424  int hi = 0;
10425  skill_id res = skill_id::NULL_ID();
10426 
10427  for( const damage_type &dt : damage_type::get_all() ) {
10428  const int val = damage_melee( dt.id );
10429  if( val > hi && !dt.skill.is_null() ) {
10430  hi = val;
10431  res = dt.skill;
10432  }
10433  }
10434 
10435  return res;
10436 }
10437 
10438 int item::min_cycle_recoil() const
10439 {
10440  if( !is_gun() ) {
10441  return 0;
10442  }
10443  int to_cycle = type->gun->min_cycle_recoil;
10444  // This should only be used for one mod or it'll mess things up
10445  // TODO: maybe generalize this so you can have mods for hot loads or whatever
10446  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10447  // this value defaults to -1
10448  if( mod->type->gunmod->overwrite_min_cycle_recoil > 0 ) {
10449  to_cycle = mod->type->gunmod->overwrite_min_cycle_recoil;
10450  }
10451  }
10452  return to_cycle;
10453 }
10454 
10455 int item::gun_dispersion( bool with_ammo, bool with_scaling ) const
10456 {
10457  if( !is_gun() ) {
10458  return 0;
10459  }
10460  int dispersion_sum = type->gun->dispersion;
10461  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10462  dispersion_sum += mod->type->gunmod->dispersion;
10463  }
10464  int dispPerDamage = get_option< int >( "DISPERSION_PER_GUN_DAMAGE" );
10465  dispersion_sum += damage_level() * dispPerDamage;
10466  dispersion_sum = std::max( dispersion_sum, 0 );
10467  if( with_ammo && ammo_data() ) {
10468  dispersion_sum += ammo_data()->ammo->dispersion_considering_length( barrel_length() );
10469  }
10470  if( !with_scaling ) {
10471  return dispersion_sum;
10472  }
10473 
10474  // Dividing dispersion by 15 temporarily as a gross adjustment,
10475  // will bake that adjustment into individual gun definitions in the future.
10476  // Absolute minimum gun dispersion is 1.
10477  double divider = get_option< float >( "GUN_DISPERSION_DIVIDER" );
10478  dispersion_sum = std::max( static_cast<int>( std::round( dispersion_sum / divider ) ), 1 );
10479 
10480  return dispersion_sum;
10481 }
10482 
10483 std::pair<int, int> item::sight_dispersion( const Character &character ) const
10484 {
10485  if( !is_gun() ) {
10486  return std::make_pair( 0, 0 );
10487  }
10488  int act_disp = has_flag( flag_DISABLE_SIGHTS ) ? 300 : type->gun->sight_dispersion;
10489  int eff_disp = character.effective_dispersion( act_disp );
10490 
10491  for( const item *e : gunmods() ) {
10492  const islot_gunmod &mod = *e->type->gunmod;
10493  int e_act_disp = mod.sight_dispersion;
10494  if( mod.sight_dispersion < 0 || mod.field_of_view <= 0 ) {
10495  continue;
10496  }
10497  int e_eff_disp = character.effective_dispersion( e_act_disp, e->has_flag( flag_ZOOM ) );
10498  if( eff_disp > e_eff_disp ) {
10499  eff_disp = e_eff_disp;
10500  act_disp = e_act_disp;
10501 
10502  }
10503  }
10504  return std::make_pair( act_disp, eff_disp );
10505 }
10506 
10507 damage_instance item::gun_damage( bool with_ammo, bool shot ) const
10508 {
10509  if( !is_gun() ) {
10510  return damage_instance();
10511  }
10512 
10513  units::length bl = barrel_length();
10514  damage_instance ret = type->gun->damage.di_considering_length( bl );
10515 
10516  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10517  ret.add( mod->type->gunmod->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10518  }
10519 
10520  if( with_ammo && ammo_data() ) {
10521  if( shot ) {
10522  ret.add( ammo_data()->ammo->shot_damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10523  } else {
10524  ret.add( ammo_data()->ammo->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10525  }
10526  }
10527 
10528  if( damage() > 0 ) {
10529  // TODO: This isn't a good solution for multi-damage guns/ammos
10530  for( damage_unit &du : ret ) {
10531  if( du.amount <= 1.0 ) {
10532  continue;
10533  }
10534  du.amount = std::max<float>( 1.0f, damage_adjusted_gun_damage( du.amount ) );
10535  }
10536  }
10537 
10538  return ret;
10539 }
10540 
10541 damage_instance item::gun_damage( itype_id ammo ) const
10542 {
10543  if( !is_gun() ) {
10544  return damage_instance();
10545  }
10546 
10547  units::length bl = barrel_length();
10548  damage_instance ret = type->gun->damage.di_considering_length( bl );
10549 
10550  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10551  ret.add( mod->type->gunmod->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10552  }
10553 
10554  ret.add( ammo->ammo->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10555 
10556  if( damage() > 0 ) {
10557  // TODO: This isn't a good solution for multi-damage guns/ammos
10558  for( damage_unit &du : ret ) {
10559  if( du.amount <= 1.0 ) {
10560  continue;
10561  }
10562  du.amount = std::max<float>( 1.0f, damage_adjusted_gun_damage( du.amount ) );
10563  }
10564  }
10565 
10566  return ret;
10567 }
10568 units::mass item::gun_base_weight() const
10569 {
10570  units::mass base_weight = type->weight;
10571  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10572  if( !mod->type->mod->ammo_modifier.empty() ) {
10573  base_weight += mod->type->integral_weight;
10574  }
10575  }
10576  return base_weight;
10577 
10578 }
10579 int item::gun_recoil( const Character &p, bool bipod, bool ideal_strength ) const
10580 {
10581  if( !is_gun() || ( ammo_required() && !ammo_remaining() ) ) {
10582  return 0;
10583  }
10584 
10585  ///\ARM_STR improves the handling of heavier weapons
10586  // we consider only base weight to avoid exploits
10587  // now we need to add weight of receiver
10588  double wt = ideal_strength ? gun_base_weight() / 333.0_gram : std::min( gun_base_weight(),
10589  p.get_arm_str() * 333_gram ) / 333.0_gram;
10590 
10591  double handling = type->gun->handling;
10592  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10593  if( bipod || !mod->has_flag( flag_BIPOD ) ) {
10594  handling += mod->type->gunmod->handling;
10595  }
10596  }
10597 
10598  // rescale from JSON units which are intentionally specified as integral values
10599  handling /= 10;
10600 
10601  // algorithm is biased so heavier weapons benefit more from improved handling
10602  handling = std::pow( wt, 0.8 ) * std::pow( handling, 1.2 );
10603 
10604  int qty = type->gun->recoil;
10605  if( ammo_data() ) {
10606  qty += ammo_data()->ammo->recoil;
10607  }
10608 
10609  // handling could be either a bonus or penalty dependent upon installed mods
10610  if( handling > 1.0 ) {
10611  return qty / handling;
10612  } else {
10613  return qty * ( 1.0 + std::abs( handling ) );
10614  }
10615 }
10616 
10617 float item::gun_shot_spread_multiplier() const
10618 {
10619  if( !is_gun() ) {
10620  return 0;
10621  }
10622  float ret = 1.0f;
10623  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10624  ret += mod->type->gunmod->shot_spread_multiplier_modifier;
10625  }
10626  return std::max( ret, 0.0f );
10627 }
10628 
10629 int item::gun_range( bool with_ammo ) const
10630 {
10631  if( !is_gun() ) {
10632  return 0;
10633  }
10634  int ret = type->gun->range;
10635  float range_multiplier = 1.0;
10636  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10637  ret += mod->type->gunmod->range;
10638  range_multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->range_multiplier;
10639  }
10640  if( with_ammo && ammo_data() ) {
10641  ret += ammo_data()->ammo->range;
10642  range_multiplier *= ammo_data()->ammo->range_multiplier;
10643  }
10644  ret *= range_multiplier;
10645  return std::min( std::max( 0, ret ), RANGE_HARD_CAP );
10646 }
10647 
10648 int item::gun_range( const Character *p ) const
10649 {
10650  int ret = gun_range( true );
10651  if( p == nullptr ) {
10652  return ret;
10653  }
10654  if( !p->meets_requirements( *this ) ) {
10655  return 0;
10656  }
10657 
10658  // Reduce bow range until player has twice minimum required strength
10659  if( has_flag( flag_STR_DRAW ) ) {
10660  ret += std::max( 0.0, ( p->get_str() - get_min_str() ) * 0.5 );
10661  }
10662 
10663  ret = p->enchantment_cache->modify_value( enchant_vals::mod::RANGE, ret );
10664 
10665  return std::max( 0, ret );
10666 }
10667 
10668 int item::shots_remaining( const Character *carrier ) const
10669 {
10670  int ret = 1000; // Arbitrary large number for things that do not require ammo.
10671  if( ammo_required() ) {
10672  ret = std::min( ammo_remaining( carrier, true ) / ammo_required(), ret );
10673  }
10674  if( get_gun_energy_drain() > 0_kJ ) {
10675  ret = std::min( static_cast<int>( energy_remaining( carrier ) / get_gun_energy_drain() ), ret );
10676  }
10677  return ret;
10678 }
10679 
10680 int item::ammo_remaining( const std::set<ammotype> &ammo, const Character *carrier,
10681  const bool include_linked ) const
10682 {
10683  int ret = 0;
10684 
10685  // Magazine in the item
10686  const item *mag = magazine_current();
10687  if( mag ) {
10688  ret += mag->ammo_remaining();
10689  }
10690 
10691  // Cable connections
10692  if( include_linked && link_length() >= 0 && link().efficiency >= MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ) {
10693  if( link().t_veh ) {
10694  ret += link().t_veh->connected_battery_power_level().first;
10695  } else {
10696  const optional_vpart_position vp = get_map().veh_at( link().t_abs_pos );
10697  if( vp ) {
10698  ret += vp->vehicle().connected_battery_power_level().first;
10699  }
10700  }
10701  }
10702 
10703  // Non ammo using item that uses charges
10704  if( ammo.empty() ) {
10705  ret += charges;
10706  }
10707 
10708  // Magazines and integral magazines on their own
10709  if( is_magazine() ) {
10710  for( const item *e : contents.all_items_top( pocket_type::MAGAZINE ) ) {
10711  if( e->is_ammo() ) {
10712  ret += e->charges;
10713  }
10714  }
10715  }
10716 
10717  // Handle non-magazines with ammo_restriction in a CONTAINER type pocket (like quivers)
10718  if( !( mag || is_magazine() || ammo.empty() ) ) {
10719  for( const item *e : contents.all_items_top( pocket_type::CONTAINER ) ) {
10720  if( e->is_ammo() && ammo.find( e->ammo_type() ) != ammo.end() ) {
10721  ret += e->charges;
10722  }
10723  }
10724  }
10725 
10726  // UPS/bionic power can replace ammo requirement.
10727  // Only for tools. Guns should always use energy_drain for electricity use.
10728  if( carrier != nullptr && type->tool ) {
10729  if( has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
10730  ret += units::to_kilojoule( carrier->get_power_level() );
10731  }
10732  if( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
10733  ret += units::to_kilojoule( carrier->available_ups() );
10734  }
10735  }
10736 
10737  return ret;
10738 }
10739 int item::ammo_remaining( const Character *carrier, const bool include_linked ) const
10740 {
10741  std::set<ammotype> ammo = ammo_types();
10742  return ammo_remaining( ammo, carrier, include_linked );
10743 }
10744 
10745 int item::ammo_remaining( const bool include_linked ) const
10746 {
10747  return ammo_remaining( nullptr, include_linked );
10748 }
10749 
10750 units::energy item::energy_remaining( const Character *carrier ) const
10751 {
10752  units::energy ret = 0_kJ;
10753 
10754  // Future energy based batteries
10755  if( is_vehicle_battery() ) {
10756  ret += energy;
10757  }
10758 
10759  // Magazine in the item
10760  const item *mag = magazine_current();
10761  if( mag ) {
10762  ret += mag->energy_remaining( carrier );
10763  }
10764 
10765  // Power from bionic
10766  if( carrier != nullptr && has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
10767  ret += carrier->get_power_level();
10768  }
10769 
10770  // Extra power from UPS
10771  if( carrier != nullptr && has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
10772  ret += carrier->available_ups();
10773  }
10774 
10775  // Battery(ammo) contained within
10776  if( is_magazine() ) {
10777  for( const item *e : contents.all_items_top( pocket_type::MAGAZINE ) ) {
10778  if( e->typeId() == itype_battery ) {
10779  ret += units::from_kilojoule( static_cast<std::int64_t>( e->charges ) );
10780  }
10781  }
10782  }
10783 
10784  return ret;
10785 }
10786 
10787 int item::remaining_ammo_capacity() const
10788 {
10789  if( ammo_types().empty() ) {
10790  return 0;
10791  }
10792 
10793  const itype *loaded_ammo = ammo_data();
10794  if( loaded_ammo == nullptr ) {
10795  return ammo_capacity( item::find_type( ammo_default() )->ammo->type ) - ammo_remaining();
10796  } else {
10797  return ammo_capacity( loaded_ammo->ammo->type ) - ammo_remaining();
10798  }
10799 }
10800 
10801 int item::ammo_capacity( const ammotype &ammo, bool include_linked ) const
10802 {
10803  const item *mag = magazine_current();
10804  if( include_linked && has_link_data() ) {
10805  return link().t_veh ? link().t_veh->connected_battery_power_level().second : 0;
10806  } else if( mag ) {
10807  return mag->ammo_capacity( ammo );
10808  } else if( has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
10809  return units::to_kilojoule( get_player_character().get_max_power_level() );
10810  }
10811 
10812  if( contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE ) ) {
10813  return contents.ammo_capacity( ammo );
10814  }
10815  if( is_magazine() ) {
10816  return type->magazine->capacity;
10817  }
10818  return 0;
10819 }
10820 
10821 int item::ammo_required() const
10822 {
10823  if( is_gun() ) {
10824  if( type->gun->ammo.empty() ) {
10825  return 0;
10826  } else {
10827  int modifier = 0;
10828  float multiplier = 1.0f;
10829  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10830  modifier += mod->type->gunmod->ammo_to_fire_modifier;
10831  multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->ammo_to_fire_multiplier;
10832  }
10833  return ( type->gun->ammo_to_fire * multiplier ) + modifier;
10834  }
10835  }
10836 
10837  return type->charges_to_use();
10838 }
10839 
10840 item &item::first_ammo()
10841 {
10842  return contents.first_ammo();
10843 }
10844 
10845 const item &item::first_ammo() const
10846 {
10847  return contents.first_ammo();
10848 }
10849 
10850 void item::handle_liquid_or_spill( Character &guy, const item *avoid )
10851 {
10852  contents.handle_liquid_or_spill( guy, avoid );
10853 }
10854 
10855 bool item::ammo_sufficient( const Character *carrier, int qty ) const
10856 {
10857  if( count_by_charges() ) {
10858  return ammo_remaining( carrier, true ) >= qty;
10859  }
10860 
10861  if( is_comestible() ) {
10862  return true;
10863  }
10864 
10865  return shots_remaining( carrier ) >= qty;
10866 }
10867 
10868 bool item::ammo_sufficient( const Character *carrier, const std::string &method, int qty ) const
10869 {
10870  auto iter = type->ammo_scale.find( method );
10871  if( iter != type->ammo_scale.end() ) {
10872  qty *= iter->second;
10873  }
10874 
10875  return ammo_sufficient( carrier, qty );
10876 }
10877 
10878 int item::ammo_consume( int qty, const tripoint &pos, Character *carrier )
10879 {
10880  if( qty < 0 ) {
10881  debugmsg( "Cannot consume negative quantity of ammo for %s", tname() );
10882  return 0;
10883  }
10884  const int wanted_qty = qty;
10885 
10886  // Consume power from appliances/vehicles connected with cables
10887  if( has_link_data() ) {
10888  if( link().t_veh && link().efficiency >= MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ) {
10889  qty = link().t_veh->discharge_battery( qty, true );
10890  } else {
10891  const optional_vpart_position vp = get_map().veh_at( link().t_abs_pos );
10892  if( vp ) {
10893  qty = vp->vehicle().discharge_battery( qty, true );
10894  }
10895  }
10896  }
10897 
10898  // Consume charges loaded in the item or its magazines
10899  if( is_magazine() || uses_magazine() ) {
10900  qty -= contents.ammo_consume( qty, pos );
10901  if( ammo_capacity( ammo_battery ) == 0 && carrier != nullptr ) {
10902  carrier->invalidate_weight_carried_cache();
10903  }
10904  }
10905 
10906  // Dirty fix: activating a container of meds leads here, and used to use up all of the charges.
10907  if( is_medication() && charges > 1 ) {
10908  int charg_used = std::min( charges, qty );
10909  charges -= charg_used;
10910  qty -= charg_used;
10911  }
10912 
10913  // Some weird internal non-item charges (used by grenades)
10914  if( is_tool() && type->tool->ammo_id.empty() ) {
10915  int charg_used = std::min( charges, qty );
10916  charges -= charg_used;
10917  qty -= charg_used;
10918  }
10919 
10920  // Modded tools can consume UPS/bionic energy instead of ammo.
10921  // Guns handle energy in energy_consume()
10922  if( carrier != nullptr && type->tool &&
10923  ( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) || has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) ) {
10924  units::energy wanted_energy = units::from_kilojoule( static_cast<std::int64_t>( qty ) );
10925 
10926  if( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
10927  wanted_energy -= carrier->consume_ups( wanted_energy );
10928  }
10929 
10930  if( has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
10931  units::energy bio_used = std::min( carrier->get_power_level(), wanted_energy );
10932  carrier->mod_power_level( -bio_used );
10933  wanted_energy -= bio_used;
10934  }
10935 
10936  // It is possible for this to cause rounding error due to different precision of energy
10937  // But that can happen only if there was not enough ammo and you shouldn't be able to use without sufficient ammo
10938  qty = units::to_kilojoule( wanted_energy );
10939  }
10940  return wanted_qty - qty;
10941 }
10942 
10943 units::energy item::energy_consume( units::energy qty, const tripoint &pos, Character *carrier,
10944  float fuel_efficiency )
10945 {
10946  if( qty < 0_kJ ) {
10947  debugmsg( "Cannot consume negative quantity of energy for %s", tname() );
10948  return 0_kJ;
10949  }
10950 
10951  const units::energy wanted_energy = qty;
10952 
10953  // Consume battery(ammo) and other fuel (if allowed)
10954  if( is_battery() || fuel_efficiency >= 0 ) {
10955  int consumed_kj = contents.ammo_consume( units::to_kilojoule( qty ), pos, fuel_efficiency );
10956  qty -= units::from_kilojoule( static_cast<std::int64_t>( consumed_kj ) );
10957  // fix negative quantity
10958  if( qty < 0_J ) {
10959  qty = 0_J;
10960  }
10961  }
10962 
10963  // Consume energy from contained magazine
10964  if( magazine_current() ) {
10965  qty -= magazine_current()->energy_consume( qty, pos, carrier );
10966  }
10967 
10968  // Consume UPS energy from various sources
10969  if( carrier != nullptr && has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
10970  qty -= carrier->consume_ups( qty );
10971  }
10972 
10973  // Consume bio energy
10974  if( carrier != nullptr && has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
10975  units::energy bio_used = std::min( carrier->get_power_level(), qty );
10976  carrier->mod_power_level( -bio_used );
10977  qty -= bio_used;
10978  }
10979 
10980  // If consumption is not integer kJ we need to consume one extra battery charge to "round up".
10981  // Should happen only if battery powered and energy per shot is not integer kJ.
10982  if( qty > 0_kJ && is_battery() ) {
10983  int consumed_kj = contents.ammo_consume( 1, pos );
10984  qty -= units::from_kilojoule( static_cast<std::int64_t>( consumed_kj ) );
10985  }
10986 
10987  return wanted_energy - qty;
10988 }
10989 
10990 int item::activation_consume( int qty, const tripoint &pos, Character *carrier )
10991 {
10992  return ammo_consume( qty * ammo_required(), pos, carrier );
10993 }
10994 
10995 const itype *item::ammo_data() const
10996 {
10997  const item *mag = magazine_current();
10998  if( mag ) {
10999  return mag->ammo_data();
11000  }
11001 
11002  if( is_ammo() ) {
11003  return type;
11004  }
11005 
11006  if( is_magazine() ) {
11007  return !contents.empty() ? contents.first_ammo().ammo_data() : nullptr;
11008  }
11009 
11010  auto mods = is_gun() ? gunmods() : toolmods();
11011  for( const item *e : mods ) {
11012  if( !e->type->mod->ammo_modifier.empty() && !e->ammo_current().is_null() &&
11013  item_controller->has_template( e->ammo_current() ) ) {
11014  return item_controller->find_template( e->ammo_current() );
11015  }
11016  }
11017 
11018  return nullptr;
11019 }
11020 
11021 itype_id item::ammo_current() const
11022 {
11023  const itype *ammo = ammo_data();
11024  if( ammo ) {
11025  return ammo->get_id();
11026  }
11027 
11028  return itype_id::NULL_ID();
11029 }
11030 
11031 const item &item::loaded_ammo() const
11032 {
11033  const item *mag = magazine_current();
11034  if( mag ) {
11035  return mag->loaded_ammo();
11036  }
11037 
11038  if( is_magazine() ) {
11039  return !contents.empty() ? contents.first_ammo() : null_item_reference();
11040  }
11041 
11042  auto mods = is_gun() ? gunmods() : toolmods();
11043  for( const item *e : mods ) {
11044  const item &mod_ammo = e->loaded_ammo();
11045  if( !mod_ammo.is_null() ) {
11046  return mod_ammo;
11047  }
11048  }
11049 
11050  if( is_gun() && ammo_remaining() != 0 ) {
11051  return contents.first_ammo();
11052  }
11053  return null_item_reference();
11054 }
11055 
11056 std::set<ammotype> item::ammo_types( bool conversion ) const
11057 {
11058  if( conversion ) {
11059  const std::vector<const item *> &mods = is_gun() ? gunmods() : toolmods();
11060  for( const item *e : mods ) {
11061  if( !e->type->mod->ammo_modifier.empty() ) {
11062  return e->type->mod->ammo_modifier;
11063  }
11064  }
11065  }
11066 
11067  if( is_gun() ) {
11068  return type->gun->ammo;
11069  }
11070  return contents.ammo_types();
11071 }
11072 
11073 ammotype item::ammo_type() const
11074 {
11075  if( is_ammo() ) {
11076  return type->ammo->type;
11077  }
11078  return ammotype::NULL_ID();
11079 }
11080 
11081 itype_id item::ammo_default( bool conversion ) const
11082 {
11083  if( !ammo_types( conversion ).empty() ) {
11084  itype_id res = ammotype( *ammo_types( conversion ).begin() )->default_ammotype();
11085  if( !res.is_empty() ) {
11086  return res;
11087  }
11088  }
11089 
11090  return itype_id::NULL_ID();
11091 }
11092 
11093 std::string item::print_ammo( ammotype at, const item *gun ) const
11094 {
11095  const item *mag = magazine_current();
11096  if( mag ) {
11097  return mag->print_ammo( at, this );
11098  } else if( has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
11099  return _( "energy" );
11100  }
11101 
11102  // for magazines if we have a gun in mind display damage as well
11103  if( type->magazine ) {
11104  if( gun ) {
11105  return enumerate_as_string( type->magazine->cached_ammos[at],
11106  [gun]( const itype_id & id ) {
11107  return string_format( "<info>%s</info>(%d)", id->nname( 1 ),
11108  static_cast<int>( gun->gun_damage( id ).total_damage() ) );
11109  } );
11110  } else {
11111  return enumerate_as_string( type->magazine->cached_ammos[at],
11112  []( const itype_id & id ) {
11113  return string_format( "<info>%s</info>", id->nname( 1 ) );
11114  } );
11115  }
11116  }
11117 
11118  if( type->gun ) {
11119  return enumerate_as_string( type->gun->cached_ammos[at],
11120  [this]( const itype_id & id ) {
11121  return string_format( "<info>%s(%d)</info>", id->nname( 1 ),
11122  static_cast<int>( gun_damage( id ).total_damage() ) );
11123  } );
11124  }
11125 
11126  return "";
11127 }
11128 
11129 itype_id item::common_ammo_default( bool conversion ) const
11130 {
11131  for( const ammotype &at : ammo_types( conversion ) ) {
11132  const item *mag = magazine_current();
11133  if( mag && mag->type->magazine->type.count( at ) ) {
11134  itype_id res = at->default_ammotype();
11135  if( !res.is_empty() ) {
11136  return res;
11137  }
11138  }
11139  }
11140  return itype_id::NULL_ID();
11141 }
11142 
11143 std::set<std::string> item::ammo_effects( bool with_ammo ) const
11144 {
11145  if( !is_gun() ) {
11146  return std::set<std::string>();
11147  }
11148 
11149  std::set<std::string> res = type->gun->ammo_effects;
11150  if( with_ammo && ammo_data() ) {
11151  res.insert( ammo_data()->ammo->ammo_effects.begin(), ammo_data()->ammo->ammo_effects.end() );
11152  }
11153 
11154  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
11155  res.insert( mod->type->gunmod->ammo_effects.begin(), mod->type->gunmod->ammo_effects.end() );
11156  }
11157 
11158  return res;
11159 }
11160 
11161 std::string item::ammo_sort_name() const
11162 {
11163  if( is_magazine() || is_gun() || is_tool() ) {
11164  const std::set<ammotype> &types = ammo_types();
11165  if( !types.empty() ) {
11166  return ammotype( *types.begin() )->name();
11167  }
11168  }
11169  if( is_ammo() ) {
11170  return ammo_type()->name();
11171  }
11172  return "";
11173 }
11174 
11175 bool item::magazine_integral() const
11176 {
11177  return contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
11178 }
11179 
11180 bool item::uses_magazine() const
11181 {
11182  return contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL );
11183 }
11184 
11185 itype_id item::magazine_default( bool conversion ) const
11186 {
11187  // consider modded ammo types
11188  itype_id ammo;
11189  if( conversion && ( ammo = ammo_default(), !ammo.is_null() ) ) {
11190  for( const itype_id &mag : contents.magazine_compatible() ) {
11191  auto mag_types = mag->magazine->type;
11192  if( mag_types.find( ammo->ammo->type ) != mag_types.end() ) {
11193  return mag;
11194  }
11195  }
11196  }
11197 
11198  // otherwise return the default
11199  return contents.magazine_default();
11200 }
11201 
11202 std::set<itype_id> item::magazine_compatible() const
11203 {
11204  return contents.magazine_compatible();
11205 }
11206 
11207 item *item::magazine_current()
11208 {
11209  return contents.magazine_current();
11210 }
11211 
11212 const item *item::magazine_current() const
11213 {
11214  return const_cast<item *>( this )->magazine_current();
11215 }
11216 
11217 std::vector<item *> item::gunmods()
11218 {
11219  return contents.gunmods();
11220 }
11221 
11222 std::vector<const item *> item::gunmods() const
11223 {
11224  return contents.gunmods();
11225 }
11226 
11227 std::vector<const item *> item::mods() const
11228 {
11229  return contents.mods();
11230 }
11231 
11232 std::vector<const item *> item::softwares() const
11233 {
11234  return contents.softwares();
11235 }
11236 
11237 std::vector<const item *> item::ebooks() const
11238 {
11239  return contents.ebooks();
11240 }
11241 
11242 std::vector<const item *> item::cables() const
11243 {
11244  return contents.cables();
11245 }
11246 
11247 item *item::gunmod_find( const itype_id &mod )
11248 {
11249  std::vector<item *> mods = gunmods();
11250  auto it = std::find_if( mods.begin(), mods.end(), [&mod]( item * e ) {
11251  return e->typeId() == mod;
11252  } );
11253  return it != mods.end() ? *it : nullptr;
11254 }
11255 
11256 const item *item::gunmod_find( const itype_id &mod ) const
11257 {
11258  return const_cast<item *>( this )->gunmod_find( mod );
11259 }
11260 
11261 item *item::gunmod_find_by_flag( const flag_id &flag )
11262 {
11263  std::vector<item *> mods = gunmods();
11264  auto it = std::find_if( mods.begin(), mods.end(), [&flag]( item * e ) {
11265  return e->has_flag( flag );
11266  } );
11267  return it != mods.end() ? *it : nullptr;
11268 }
11269 
11270 ret_val<void> item::is_gunmod_compatible( const item &mod ) const
11271 {
11272  if( !mod.is_gunmod() ) {
11273  debugmsg( "Tried checking compatibility of non-gunmod" );
11274  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
11275  }
11276  static const gun_type_type pistol_gun_type( translate_marker_context( "gun_type_type", "pistol" ) );
11277 
11278  if( !is_gun() ) {
11279  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "isn't a weapon" ) );
11280 
11281  } else if( is_gunmod() ) {
11282  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "is a gunmod and cannot be modded" ) );
11283 
11284  } else if( gunmod_find( mod.typeId() ) ) {
11285  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "already has a %s" ), mod.tname( 1 ) );
11286 
11287  } else if( !get_mod_locations().count( mod.type->gunmod->location ) ) {
11288  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "doesn't have a slot for this mod" ) );
11289 
11290  } else if( get_free_mod_locations( mod.type->gunmod->location ) <= 0 ) {
11291  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "doesn't have enough room for another %s mod" ),
11292  mod.type->gunmod->location.name() );
11293 
11294  } else if( !mod.type->gunmod->usable.count( gun_type() ) &&
11295  !mod.type->gunmod->usable.count( gun_type_type( typeId().str() ) ) ) {
11296  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "cannot have a %s" ), mod.tname() );
11297 
11298  } else if( typeId() == itype_hand_crossbow &&
11299  !mod.type->gunmod->usable.count( pistol_gun_type ) ) {
11300  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "isn't big enough to use that mod" ) );
11301 
11302  } else if( mod.type->gunmod->location.str() == "underbarrel" &&
11303  !mod.has_flag( flag_PUMP_RAIL_COMPATIBLE ) && has_flag( flag_PUMP_ACTION ) ) {
11304  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "can only accept small mods on that slot" ) );
11305 
11306  } else if( mod.typeId() == itype_waterproof_gunmod && has_flag( flag_WATERPROOF_GUN ) ) {
11307  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "is already waterproof" ) );
11308 
11309  } else if( mod.typeId() == itype_tuned_mechanism && has_flag( flag_NEVER_JAMS ) ) {
11310  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "is already eminently reliable" ) );
11311 
11312  } else if( mod.typeId() == itype_brass_catcher && has_flag( flag_RELOAD_EJECT ) ) {
11313  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "cannot have a brass catcher" ) );
11314 
11315  } else if( ( mod.type->gunmod->location.name() == "magazine" ||
11316  mod.type->gunmod->location.name() == "mechanism" ||
11317  mod.type->gunmod->location.name() == "loading port" ||
11318  mod.type->gunmod->location.name() == "bore" ) &&
11319  ( ammo_remaining() > 0 || magazine_current() ) ) {
11320  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "must be unloaded before installing this mod" ) );
11321 
11322  } else if( gunmod_find( itype_stock_none ) &&
11323  mod.type->gunmod->location.name() == "stock accessory" ) {
11324  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "doesn't have a stock to attach this mod" ) );
11325 
11326  } else if( mod.typeId() == itype_arredondo_chute ) {
11327  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "chute needs modification before attaching" ) );
11328 
11329  // Acceptable_ammo check is kinda weird now, if it is passed, checks after it will be ignored.
11330  // Moved it here as a workaround.
11331  } else if( !mod.type->mod->acceptable_ammo.empty() ) {
11332  bool compat_ammo = false;
11333  for( const ammotype &at : mod.type->mod->acceptable_ammo ) {
11334  if( ammo_types( false ).count( at ) ) {
11335  compat_ammo = true;
11336  }
11337  }
11338  if( !compat_ammo ) {
11339  return ret_val<void>::make_failure(
11340  _( "%1$s cannot be used on item with no compatible ammo types" ), mod.tname( 1 ) );
11341  }
11342  }
11343 
11344  for( const gunmod_location &slot : mod.type->gunmod->blacklist_slot ) {
11345  if( get_mod_locations().count( slot ) ) {
11346  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "cannot be installed on a weapon with \"%s\"" ),
11347  slot.name() );
11348  }
11349  }
11350 
11351  for( const itype_id &testmod : mod.type->gunmod->blacklist_mod ) {
11352  if( gunmod_find( testmod ) ) {
11353  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "cannot be installed on a weapon with a \"%s\"" ),
11354  ( testmod->nname( 1 ) ) );
11355  }
11356  }
11357 
11358  return ret_val<void>::make_success();
11359 }
11360 
11361 std::map<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> item::gun_all_modes() const
11362 {
11363  std::map<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> res;
11364 
11365  if( !is_gun() && !is_gunmod() ) {
11366  return res;
11367  }
11368 
11369  std::vector<const item *> opts = gunmods();
11370  opts.push_back( this );
11371 
11372  for( const item *e : opts ) {
11373 
11374  // handle base item plus any auxiliary gunmods
11375  if( e->is_gun() ) {
11376  for( const std::pair<const gun_mode_id, gun_modifier_data> &m : e->type->gun->modes ) {
11377  // prefix attached gunmods, e.g. M203_DEFAULT to avoid index key collisions
11378  std::string prefix = e->is_gunmod() ? ( std::string( e->typeId() ) += "_" ) : "";
11379  std::transform( prefix.begin(), prefix.end(), prefix.begin(),
11380  static_cast<int( * )( int )>( toupper ) );
11381 
11382  const int qty = m.second.qty();
11383 
11384  res.emplace( gun_mode_id( prefix + m.first.str() ), gun_mode( m.second.name(),
11385  const_cast<item *>( e ),
11386  qty, m.second.flags() ) );
11387  }
11388 
11389  // non-auxiliary gunmods may provide additional modes for the base item
11390  } else if( e->is_gunmod() ) {
11391  for( const std::pair<const gun_mode_id, gun_modifier_data> &m : e->type->gunmod->mode_modifier ) {
11392  //checks for melee gunmod, points to gunmod
11393  if( m.first == gun_mode_REACH ) {
11394  res.emplace( m.first, gun_mode { m.second.name(), const_cast<item *>( e ),
11395  m.second.qty(), m.second.flags() } );
11396  //otherwise points to the parent gun, not the gunmod
11397  } else {
11398  res.emplace( m.first, gun_mode { m.second.name(), const_cast<item *>( this ),
11399  m.second.qty(), m.second.flags() } );
11400  }
11401  }
11402  }
11403  }
11404 
11405  return res;
11406 }
11407 
11408 gun_mode item::gun_get_mode( const gun_mode_id &mode ) const
11409 {
11410  if( is_gun() ) {
11411  for( const std::pair<const gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &e : gun_all_modes() ) {
11412  if( e.first == mode ) {
11413  return e.second;
11414  }
11415  }
11416  }
11417  return gun_mode();
11418 }
11419 
11420 gun_mode item::gun_current_mode() const
11421 {
11422  return gun_get_mode( gun_get_mode_id() );
11423 }
11424 
11425 gun_mode_id item::gun_get_mode_id() const
11426 {
11427  if( !is_gun() || is_gunmod() ) {
11428  return gun_mode_id();
11429  }
11430  return gun_mode_id( get_var( GUN_MODE_VAR_NAME, "DEFAULT" ) );
11431 }
11432 
11433 bool item::gun_set_mode( const gun_mode_id &mode )
11434 {
11435  if( !is_gun() || is_gunmod() || !gun_all_modes().count( mode ) ) {
11436  return false;
11437  }
11438  set_var( GUN_MODE_VAR_NAME, mode.str() );
11439  return true;
11440 }
11441 
11442 void item::gun_cycle_mode()
11443 {
11444  if( !is_gun() || is_gunmod() ) {
11445  return;
11446  }
11447 
11448  const gun_mode_id cur = gun_get_mode_id();
11449  const std::map<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> modes = gun_all_modes();
11450 
11451  for( auto iter = modes.begin(); iter != modes.end(); ++iter ) {
11452  if( iter->first == cur ) {
11453  if( std::next( iter ) == modes.end() ) {
11454  break;
11455  }
11456  gun_set_mode( std::next( iter )->first );
11457  return;
11458  }
11459  }
11460  gun_set_mode( modes.begin()->first );
11461 }
11462 
11463 const use_function *item::get_use( const std::string &use_name ) const
11464 {
11465  const use_function *fun = nullptr;
11466  visit_items(
11467  [&fun, &use_name]( const item * it, auto ) {
11468  if( it == nullptr ) {
11469  return VisitResponse::SKIP;
11470  }
11471  fun = it->get_use_internal( use_name );
11472  if( fun != nullptr ) {
11473  return VisitResponse::ABORT;
11474  }
11475  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
11476  } );
11477 
11478  return fun;
11479 }
11480 
11481 const use_function *item::get_use_internal( const std::string &use_name ) const
11482 {
11483  if( type != nullptr ) {
11484  return type->get_use( use_name );
11485  }
11486  return nullptr;
11487 }
11488 
11489 template<typename Item>
11490 Item *item::get_usable_item_helper( Item &self, const std::string &use_name )
11491 {
11492  Item *ret = nullptr;
11493  self.visit_items(
11494  [&ret, &use_name]( item * it, auto ) {
11495  if( it == nullptr ) {
11496  return VisitResponse::SKIP;
11497  }
11498  if( it->get_use_internal( use_name ) ) {
11499  ret = it;
11500  return VisitResponse::ABORT;
11501  }
11502  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
11503  } );
11504 
11505  return ret;
11506 }
11507 
11508 const item *item::get_usable_item( const std::string &use_name ) const
11509 {
11510  return get_usable_item_helper( *this, use_name );
11511 }
11512 
11513 item *item::get_usable_item( const std::string &use_name )
11514 {
11515  return get_usable_item_helper( *this, use_name );
11516 }
11517 
11518 item::reload_option::reload_option( const reload_option & ) = default;
11519 
11520 item::reload_option &item::reload_option::operator=( const reload_option & ) = default;
11521 
11522 item::reload_option::reload_option( const Character *who, const item_location &target,
11523  const item_location &ammo ) :
11524  who( who ), target( target ), ammo( ammo )
11525 {
11526  if( this->target->is_ammo_belt() && this->target->type->magazine->linkage ) {
11527  max_qty = this->who->charges_of( * this->target->type->magazine->linkage );
11528  }
11529  qty( max_qty );
11530 }
11531 
11532 int item::reload_option::moves() const
11533 {
11534  int mv = ammo.obtain_cost( *who, qty() ) + who->item_reload_cost( *target, *ammo, qty() );
11535  if( target.has_parent() ) {
11536  item_location parent = target.parent_item();
11537  if( parent->is_gun() && !target->is_gunmod() ) {
11538  mv += parent->get_reload_time() * 1.5;
11539  } else if( parent->is_tool() ) {
11540  mv += 100;
11541  }
11542  }
11543  return mv;
11544 }
11545 
11546 void item::reload_option::qty( int val )
11547 {
11548  bool ammo_in_container = ammo->is_ammo_container();
11549  bool ammo_in_liquid_container = ammo->is_watertight_container();
11550  item &ammo_obj = ( ammo_in_container || ammo_in_liquid_container ) ?
11551  // this is probably not the right way to do this. there is no guarantee whatsoever that ammo_obj will be an ammo
11552  *ammo->contents.all_items_top( pocket_type::CONTAINER ).front() : *ammo;
11553 
11554  if( ( ammo_in_container && !ammo_obj.is_ammo() ) ||
11555  ( ammo_in_liquid_container && !ammo_obj.made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) ) {
11556  debugmsg( "Invalid reload option: %s", ammo_obj.tname() );
11557  return;
11558  }
11559 
11560  // Checking ammo capacity implicitly limits guns with removable magazines to capacity 0.
11561  // This gets rounded up to 1 later.
11562  int remaining_capacity = target->is_watertight_container() ?
11563  target->get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( ammo_obj, true ) :
11564  target->remaining_ammo_capacity();
11565  if( target->has_flag( flag_RELOAD_ONE ) &&
11566  !( ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER ) || ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER_CLIP ) ) ) {
11567  remaining_capacity = 1;
11568  }
11569  if( ammo_obj.type->ammo ) {
11570  if( ammo_obj.ammo_type() == ammo_plutonium ) {
11571  remaining_capacity = remaining_capacity / PLUTONIUM_CHARGES +
11572  ( remaining_capacity % PLUTONIUM_CHARGES != 0 );
11573  }
11574  }
11575 
11576  bool ammo_by_charges = ammo_obj.is_ammo() || ammo_in_liquid_container;
11577  int available_ammo;
11578  if( ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER ) || ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER_CLIP ) ) {
11579  available_ammo = ammo_obj.ammo_remaining();
11580  } else {
11581  available_ammo = ammo_by_charges ? ammo_obj.charges : ammo_obj.count();
11582  }
11583  // constrain by available ammo, target capacity and other external factors (max_qty)
11584  // @ref max_qty is currently set when reloading ammo belts and limits to available linkages
11585  qty_ = std::min( { val, available_ammo, remaining_capacity, max_qty } );
11586 
11587  // always expect to reload at least one charge
11588  qty_ = std::max( qty_, 1 );
11589 
11590 }
11591 
11592 int item::casings_count() const
11593 {
11594  int res = 0;
11595 
11596  const_cast<item *>( this )->casings_handle( [&res]( item & ) {
11597  ++res;
11598  return false;
11599  } );
11600 
11601  return res;
11602 }
11603 
11604 void item::casings_handle( const std::function<bool( item & )> &func )
11605 {
11606  if( !is_gun() && !is_tool() ) {
11607  return;
11608  }
11609  contents.casings_handle( func );
11610 }
11611 
11612 bool item::reload( Character &u, item_location ammo, int qty )
11613 {
11614  if( qty <= 0 ) {
11615  debugmsg( "Tried to reload zero or less charges" );
11616  return false;
11617  }
11618 
11619  if( !ammo ) {
11620  debugmsg( "Tried to reload using non-existent ammo" );
11621  return false;
11622  }
11623 
11624  if( !can_reload_with( *ammo.get_item(), true ) ) {
11625  return false;
11626  }
11627 
11628  bool ammo_from_map = !ammo.held_by( u );
11629  if( ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER ) || ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER_CLIP ) ) {
11630  // if the thing passed in is a speed loader, we want the ammo
11631  ammo = item_location( ammo, &ammo->first_ammo() );
11632  }
11633 
11634  // limit quantity of ammo loaded to remaining capacity
11635  int limit = 0;
11636  if( is_watertight_container() && ammo->made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
11637  limit = get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( *ammo );
11638  } else if( ammo->is_ammo() ) {
11639  limit = ammo_capacity( ammo->ammo_type() ) - ammo_remaining();
11640  }
11641 
11642  if( ammo->ammo_type() == ammo_plutonium ) {
11643  limit = limit / PLUTONIUM_CHARGES + ( limit % PLUTONIUM_CHARGES != 0 );
11644  }
11645 
11646  qty = std::min( qty, limit );
11647 
11648  casings_handle( [&u]( item & e ) {
11649  return u.i_add_or_drop( e );
11650  } );
11651 
11652  if( is_magazine() ) {
11653  qty = std::min( qty, ammo->charges );
11654 
11655  if( is_ammo_belt() && type->magazine->linkage ) {
11656  if( !u.use_charges_if_avail( *type->magazine->linkage, qty ) ) {
11657  debugmsg( "insufficient linkages available when reloading ammo belt" );
11658  }
11659  }
11660 
11661  item item_copy( *ammo );
11662  ammo->charges -= qty;
11663 
11664  if( ammo->ammo_type() == ammo_plutonium ) {
11665  // any excess is wasted rather than overfilling the item
11666  item_copy.charges = std::min( qty * PLUTONIUM_CHARGES, ammo_capacity( ammo_plutonium ) );
11667  } else {
11668  item_copy.charges = qty;
11669  }
11670 
11671  put_in( item_copy, pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
11672 
11673  } else if( is_watertight_container() && ammo->made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
11674  item contents( *ammo );
11675  fill_with( contents, qty );
11676  if( ammo.has_parent() ) {
11677  ammo.parent_item()->contained_where( *ammo.get_item() )->on_contents_changed();
11678  }
11679  ammo->charges -= qty;
11680  } else {
11681  item magazine_removed;
11682  bool allow_wield = false;
11683  // if we already have a magazine loaded prompt to eject it
11684  if( magazine_current() ) {
11685  // we don't want to replace wielded `ammo` with ejected magazine
11686  // as it will invalidate `ammo`. Also keep wielding the item being reloaded.
11687  allow_wield = ( !u.is_wielding( *ammo ) && !u.is_wielding( *this ) );
11688  // Defer placing the magazine into inventory until new magazine is installed.
11689  magazine_removed = *magazine_current();
11690  remove_item( *magazine_current() );
11691  }
11692 
11693  put_in( *ammo, pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL );
11694  ammo.remove_item();
11695  if( ammo_from_map ) {
11696  u.invalidate_weight_carried_cache();
11697  }
11698  if( magazine_removed.type != nullitem() ) {
11699  u.i_add( magazine_removed, true, nullptr, nullptr, true, allow_wield );
11700  }
11701  return true;
11702  }
11703 
11704  if( ammo->charges == 0 ) {
11705  ammo.remove_item();
11706  }
11707  if( ammo_from_map ) {
11708  u.invalidate_weight_carried_cache();
11709  }
11710  return true;
11711 }
11712 
11713 float item::simulate_burn( fire_data &frd ) const
11714 {
11715  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
11716  float smoke_added = 0.0f;
11717  float time_added = 0.0f;
11718  float burn_added = 0.0f;
11719  const units::volume vol = base_volume();
11720  const int effective_intensity = frd.contained ? 3 : frd.fire_intensity;
11721  for( const auto &m : mats ) {
11722  const mat_burn_data &bd = m.first->burn_data( effective_intensity );
11723  if( bd.immune ) {
11724  // Made to protect from fire
11725  return 0.0f;
11726  }
11727 
11728  // If fire is contained, burn rate is independent of volume
11729  if( frd.contained || bd.volume_per_turn == 0_ml ) {
11730  time_added += bd.fuel * m.second;
11731  smoke_added += bd.smoke * m.second;
11732  burn_added += bd.burn * m.second;
11733  } else {
11734  double volume_burn_rate = to_liter( bd.volume_per_turn ) / to_liter( vol );
11735  time_added += bd.fuel * volume_burn_rate * m.second;
11736  smoke_added += bd.smoke * volume_burn_rate * m.second;
11737  burn_added += bd.burn * volume_burn_rate * m.second;
11738  }
11739  }
11740  const int mat_total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
11741 
11742  // Liquids that don't burn well smother fire well instead
11743  if( made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) && time_added < 200 ) {
11744  time_added -= rng( 400.0 * to_liter( vol ), 1200.0 * to_liter( vol ) );
11745  } else if( mats.size() > 1 ) {
11746  // Average the materials
11747  time_added /= mat_total;
11748  smoke_added /= mat_total;
11749  burn_added /= mat_total;
11750  } else if( mats.empty() ) {
11751  // Non-liquid items with no specified materials will burn at moderate speed
11752  burn_added = 1;
11753  }
11754 
11755  if( count_by_charges() ) {
11756  int stack_burnt = rng( type->stack_size / 2, type->stack_size );
11757  time_added *= stack_burnt;
11758  smoke_added *= stack_burnt;
11759  burn_added *= stack_burnt;
11760  }
11761 
11762  frd.fuel_produced += time_added;
11763  frd.smoke_produced += smoke_added;
11764  return burn_added;
11765 }
11766 
11767 bool item::burn( fire_data &frd )
11768 {
11769  if( has_flag( flag_UNBREAKABLE ) ) {
11770  return false;
11771  }
11772  float burn_added = simulate_burn( frd );
11773 
11774  if( burn_added <= 0 ) {
11775  return false;
11776  }
11777 
11778  if( count_by_charges() ) {
11779  if( type->volume == 0_ml ) {
11780  charges = 0;
11781  } else {
11782  charges -= roll_remainder( burn_added * units::legacy_volume_factor * type->stack_size /
11783  ( 3.0 * type->volume ) );
11784  }
11785 
11786  return charges <= 0;
11787  }
11788 
11789  if( is_corpse() ) {
11790  const mtype *mt = get_mtype();
11791  if( active && mt != nullptr && burnt + burn_added > mt->hp &&
11792  !mt->burn_into.is_null() && mt->burn_into.is_valid() ) {
11793  corpse = &get_mtype()->burn_into.obj();
11794  // Delay rezing
11795  set_age( 0_turns );
11796  burnt = 0;
11797  return false;
11798  }
11799  } else if( has_temperature() ) {
11800  heat_up();
11801  }
11802 
11803  contents.heat_up();
11804 
11805  burnt += roll_remainder( burn_added );
11806 
11807  const int vol = base_volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor;
11808  return burnt >= vol * 3;
11809 }
11810 
11811 bool item::flammable( int threshold ) const
11812 {
11813  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
11814  if( mats.empty() ) {
11815  // Don't know how to burn down something made of nothing.
11816  return false;
11817  }
11818 
11819  int flammability = 0;
11820  units::volume volume_per_turn = 0_ml;
11821  for( const std::pair<material_id, int> m : mats ) {
11822  const mat_burn_data &bd = m.first->burn_data( 1 );
11823  if( bd.immune ) {
11824  // Made to protect from fire
11825  return false;
11826  }
11827 
11828  flammability += bd.fuel * m.second;
11829  volume_per_turn += bd.volume_per_turn * m.second;
11830  }
11831  const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
11832  flammability /= total;
11833  volume_per_turn /= total;
11834 
11835  if( threshold == 0 || flammability <= 0 ) {
11836  return flammability > 0;
11837  }
11838 
11839  units::volume vol = base_volume();
11840  if( volume_per_turn > 0_ml && volume_per_turn < vol ) {
11841  flammability = flammability * volume_per_turn / vol;
11842  } else {
11843  // If it burns well, it provides a bonus here
11844  flammability = flammability * vol / units::legacy_volume_factor;
11845  }
11846 
11847  return flammability > threshold;
11848 }
11849 
11850 itype_id item::typeId() const
11851 {
11852  return type ? type->get_id() : itype_id::NULL_ID();
11853 }
11854 
11855 bool item::getlight( float &luminance, units::angle &width, units::angle &direction ) const
11856 {
11857  luminance = 0;
11858  width = 0_degrees;
11859  direction = 0_degrees;
11860  if( light.luminance > 0 ) {
11861  luminance = static_cast<float>( light.luminance );
11862  if( light.width > 0 ) { // width > 0 is a light arc
11863  width = units::from_degrees( light.width );
11864  direction = units::from_degrees( light.direction );
11865  }
11866  return true;
11867  } else {
11868  const int lumint = getlight_emit();
11869  if( lumint > 0 ) {
11870  luminance = static_cast<float>( lumint );
11871  return true;
11872  }
11873  }
11874  return false;
11875 }
11876 
11877 int item::getlight_emit() const
11878 {
11879  float lumint = type->light_emission;
11880 
11881  if( lumint == 0 ) {
11882  return 0;
11883  }
11884 
11885  if( ammo_required() == 0 || ( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) && ammo_capacity( ammo_battery ) == 0 ) ||
11886  has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
11887  return lumint;
11888  }
11889  if( ammo_remaining( true ) == 0 ) {
11890  return 0;
11891  }
11892  if( has_flag( flag_CHARGEDIM ) && is_tool() && !has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
11893  // Falloff starts at 1/5 total charge and scales linearly from there to 0.
11894  const ammotype &loaded_ammo = ammo_data()->ammo->type;
11895  if( ammo_capacity( loaded_ammo ) &&
11896  ammo_remaining( true ) < ( ammo_capacity( loaded_ammo ) / 5 ) ) {
11897  lumint *= ammo_remaining( true ) * 5.0 / ammo_capacity( loaded_ammo );
11898  }
11899  }
11900  return lumint;
11901 }
11902 
11903 units::volume item::get_total_capacity( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
11904 {
11905  return contents.total_container_capacity( unrestricted_pockets_only );
11906 }
11907 
11908 units::mass item::get_total_weight_capacity( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
11909 {
11910  return contents.total_container_weight_capacity( unrestricted_pockets_only );
11911 }
11912 
11913 units::volume item::get_remaining_capacity( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
11914 {
11915  return contents.remaining_container_capacity( unrestricted_pockets_only );
11916 }
11917 units::mass item::get_remaining_weight_capacity( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
11918 {
11919  return contents.remaining_container_capacity_weight( unrestricted_pockets_only );
11920 }
11921 
11922 units::volume item::get_total_contained_volume( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
11923 {
11924  return contents.total_contained_volume( unrestricted_pockets_only );
11925 }
11926 units::mass item::get_total_contained_weight( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
11927 {
11928  return contents.total_contained_weight( unrestricted_pockets_only );
11929 }

11931 int item::get_used_holsters() const
11932 {
11933  return contents.get_used_holsters();
11934 }
11935 int item::get_total_holsters() const
11936 {
11937  return contents.get_total_holsters();
11938 }
11939 units::volume item::get_total_holster_volume() const
11940 {
11941  return contents.get_total_holster_volume();
11942 }
11943 units::volume item::get_used_holster_volume() const
11944 {
11945  return contents.get_used_holster_volume();
11946 }
11947 units::mass item::get_total_holster_weight() const
11948 {
11949  return contents.get_total_holster_weight();
11950 }
11951 units::mass item::get_used_holster_weight() const
11952 {
11953  return contents.get_used_holster_weight();
11954 }
11955 
11956 int item::get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( const item &liquid, bool allow_bucket,
11957  std::string *err ) const
11958 {
11959  const auto error = [ &err ]( const std::string & message ) {
11960  if( err != nullptr ) {
11961  *err = message;
11962  }
11963  return 0;
11964  };
11965 
11966  int remaining_capacity = 0;
11967 
11968  if( can_contain_partial( liquid ).success() ) {
11969  if( !contents.can_contain_liquid( allow_bucket ) ) {
11970  return error( string_format( _( "That %s must be on the ground or held to hold contents!" ),
11971  tname() ) );
11972  }
11973  remaining_capacity = contents.remaining_capacity_for_liquid( liquid );
11974  } else {
11975  return error( string_format( _( "That %1$s won't hold %2$s." ), tname(),
11976  liquid.tname() ) );
11977  }
11978 
11979  if( remaining_capacity <= 0 ) {
11980  return error( string_format( _( "Your %1$s can't hold any more %2$s." ), tname(),
11981  liquid.tname() ) );
11982  }
11983 
11984  return remaining_capacity;
11985 }
11986 
11987 int item::get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( const item &liquid, const Character &p,
11988  std::string *err ) const
11989 {
11990  const bool allow_bucket = ( p.get_wielded_item() && this == &*p.get_wielded_item() ) ||
11991  !p.has_item( *this );
11992  int res = get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( liquid, allow_bucket, err );
11993 
11994  if( res > 0 ) {
11995  res = std::min( contents.remaining_capacity_for_liquid( liquid ), res );
11996 
11997  if( res == 0 && err != nullptr ) {
11998  *err = string_format( _( "That %s doesn't have room to expand." ), tname() );
11999  }
12000  }
12001 
12002  return res;
12003 }
12004 
12005 units::volume item::total_contained_volume() const
12006 {
12007  return contents.total_contained_volume();
12008 }
12009 
12010 bool item::use_amount( const itype_id &it, int &quantity, std::list<item> &used,
12011  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &filter )
12012 {
12013  if( is_null() ) {
12014  return false;
12015  }
12016  // Remember quantity so that we can unseal self
12017  int old_quantity = quantity;
12018  std::vector<item *> removed_items;
12019  for( item *contained : all_items_ptr( pocket_type::CONTAINER ) ) {
12020  if( contained->use_amount_internal( it, quantity, used, filter ) ) {
12021  removed_items.push_back( contained );
12022  }
12023  }
12024 
12025  for( item *removed : removed_items ) {
12026  // Handle cases where items are removed but the pocket isn't emptied
12027  item *parent = this->find_parent( *removed );
12028  for( item_pocket *pocket : parent->get_all_standard_pockets() ) {
12029  if( pocket->has_item( *removed ) ) {
12030  pocket->unseal();
12031  }
12032  }
12033  this->remove_item( *removed );
12034  }
12035 
12036  if( quantity != old_quantity ) {
12037  on_contents_changed();
12038  }
12039  return use_amount_internal( it, quantity, used, filter );
12040 }
12041 
12042 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-make-member-function-const)
12043 bool item::use_amount_internal( const itype_id &it, int &quantity, std::list<item> &used,
12044  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &filter )
12045 {
12046  if( typeId().is_null() ) {
12047  return false;
12048  }
12049  if( typeId() == it && quantity > 0 && filter( *this ) ) {
12050  used.push_back( *this );
12051  quantity--;
12052  return true;
12053  } else {
12054  return false;
12055  }
12056 }
12057 
12058 bool item::allow_crafting_component() const
12059 {
12060  if( ( is_toolmod() && is_irremovable() ) || has_flag( flag_PSEUDO ) ) {
12061  return false;
12062  }
12063 
12064  // vehicle batteries are implemented as magazines of charge
12065  if( is_magazine() && ammo_types().count( ammo_battery ) ) {
12066  return true;
12067  }
12068 
12069  // fixes #18886 - turret installation may require items with irremovable mods
12070  if( is_gun() ) {
12071  bool valid = true;
12072  visit_items( [&]( const item * it, item * ) {
12073  if( this == it ) {
12074  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
12075  }
12076  if( !( it->is_magazine() || ( it->is_gunmod() && it->is_irremovable() ) ) ) {
12077  valid = false;
12078  return VisitResponse::ABORT;
12079  }
12080  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
12081  } );
12082  return valid;
12083  }
12084 
12085  return true;
12086 }
12087 
12088 void item::set_item_specific_energy( const units::specific_energy &new_specific_energy )
12089 {
12090  const float float_new_specific_energy = units::to_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy );
12091  const float specific_heat_liquid = get_specific_heat_liquid(); // J/g K
12092  const float specific_heat_solid = get_specific_heat_solid(); // J/g K
12093  const float latent_heat = get_latent_heat(); // J/g
12094  const float freezing_temperature = units::to_kelvin( get_freeze_point() );
12095  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely solid at freezing temperature
12096  const float completely_frozen_specific_energy = specific_heat_solid * freezing_temperature; // J/g
12097  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely liquid at freezing temperature
12098  const float completely_liquid_specific_energy = completely_frozen_specific_energy + latent_heat;
12099  float new_item_temperature = 0.0f; // K
12100  float freeze_percentage = 1.0f;
12101 
12102  if( float_new_specific_energy > completely_liquid_specific_energy ) {
12103  // Item is liquid
12104  new_item_temperature = freezing_temperature + ( float_new_specific_energy -
12105  completely_liquid_specific_energy ) /
12106  specific_heat_liquid;
12107  freeze_percentage = 0.0f;
12108  } else if( float_new_specific_energy < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12109  // Item is solid
12110  new_item_temperature = float_new_specific_energy / specific_heat_solid;
12111  } else {
12112  // Item is partially solid
12113  new_item_temperature = freezing_temperature;
12114  freeze_percentage = ( completely_liquid_specific_energy - float_new_specific_energy ) /
12115  ( completely_liquid_specific_energy - completely_frozen_specific_energy );
12116  }
12117 
12118  temperature = units::from_kelvin( new_item_temperature );
12119  specific_energy = new_specific_energy;
12120  set_temp_flags( temperature, freeze_percentage );
12121  reset_temp_check();
12122 }
12123 
12124 units::specific_energy item::get_specific_energy_from_temperature( const units::temperature
12125  &new_temperature ) const
12126 {
12127  const float specific_heat_liquid = get_specific_heat_liquid(); // J/g K
12128  const float specific_heat_solid = get_specific_heat_solid(); // J/g K
12129  const float latent_heat = get_latent_heat(); // J/g
12130  const float freezing_temperature = units::to_kelvin( get_freeze_point() );
12131  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely solid at freezing temperature
12132  const float completely_frozen_energy = specific_heat_solid * freezing_temperature;
12133  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely liquid at freezing temperature
12134  const float completely_liquid_energy = completely_frozen_energy + latent_heat;
12135  float new_specific_energy;
12136 
12137  if( units::to_kelvin( new_temperature ) <= freezing_temperature ) {
12138  new_specific_energy = specific_heat_solid * units::to_kelvin( new_temperature );
12139  } else {
12140  new_specific_energy = completely_liquid_energy + specific_heat_liquid *
12141  ( units::to_kelvin( new_temperature ) - freezing_temperature );
12142  }
12143  return units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy );
12144 }
12145 
12146 void item::set_item_temperature( units::temperature new_temperature )
12147 {
12148  const float freezing_temperature = units::to_kelvin( get_freeze_point() );
12149  const float specific_heat_solid = get_specific_heat_solid(); // J/g K
12150  const float latent_heat = get_latent_heat(); // J/g
12151 
12152  units::specific_energy new_specific_energy = get_specific_energy_from_temperature(
12153  new_temperature );
12154  float freeze_percentage = 0.0f;
12155 
12156  temperature = new_temperature;
12157  specific_energy = new_specific_energy ;
12158 
12159  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely solid at freezing temperature
12160  const float completely_frozen_specific_energy = specific_heat_solid * freezing_temperature;
12161  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely liquid at freezing temperature
