12162  const float completely_liquid_specific_energy = completely_frozen_specific_energy + latent_heat;
12163 
12164  if( units::to_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12165  // Item is solid
12166  freeze_percentage = 1;
12167  } else {
12168  // Item is partially solid
12169  freeze_percentage = ( completely_liquid_specific_energy - units::to_joule_per_gram(
12170  new_specific_energy ) ) /
12171  ( completely_liquid_specific_energy - completely_frozen_specific_energy );
12172  }
12173  set_temp_flags( new_temperature, freeze_percentage );
12174  reset_temp_check();
12175 }
12176 
12177 int item::fill_with( const item &contained, const int amount,
12178  const bool unseal_pockets,
12179  const bool allow_sealed,
12180  const bool ignore_settings,
12181  const bool into_bottom,
12182  Character *carrier )
12183 {
12184  if( amount <= 0 ) {
12185  return 0;
12186  }
12187 
12188  item contained_item( contained );
12189  const bool count_by_charges = contained.count_by_charges();
12190  if( count_by_charges ) {
12191  contained_item.charges = 1;
12192  }
12193  item_location loc;
12194  item_pocket *pocket = nullptr;
12195 
12196  int num_contained = 0;
12197  while( amount > num_contained ) {
12198  if( count_by_charges || pocket == nullptr ||
12199  !pocket->can_contain( contained_item ).success() ) {
12200  if( count_by_charges ) {
12201  contained_item.charges = 1;
12202  }
12203  pocket = best_pocket( contained_item, loc, /*avoid=*/nullptr, allow_sealed,
12204  ignore_settings ).second;
12205  }
12206  if( pocket == nullptr ) {
12207  break;
12208  }
12209  if( count_by_charges ) {
12210  ammotype ammo = contained.ammo_type();
12211  if( pocket->ammo_capacity( ammo ) ) {
12212  contained_item.charges = std::min( amount - num_contained,
12213  pocket->remaining_ammo_capacity( ammo ) );
12214  } else {
12215  contained_item.charges = std::min( { amount - num_contained,
12216  pocket->charges_per_remaining_volume( contained_item ),
12217  pocket->charges_per_remaining_weight( contained_item )
12218  } );
12219  }
12220 
12221  if( contained_item.charges == 0 ) {
12222  break;
12223  }
12224  }
12225 
12226  ret_val<item *> result = pocket->insert_item( contained_item, into_bottom );
12227  if( !result.success() ) {
12228  if( count_by_charges ) {
12229  debugmsg( "charges per remaining pocket volume does not fit in that very volume: %s",
12230  result.str() );
12231  } else {
12232  debugmsg( "best pocket for item cannot actually contain the item: %s", result.str() );
12233  }
12234  break;
12235  }
12236  if( count_by_charges ) {
12237  num_contained += contained_item.charges;
12238  } else {
12239  num_contained++;
12240  }
12241  if( unseal_pockets ) {
12242  pocket->unseal();
12243  }
12244  if( carrier ) {
12245  result.value()->on_pickup( *carrier );
12246  }
12247  }
12248  if( num_contained == 0 ) {
12249  debugmsg( "tried to put an item (%s, amount %d) in a container (%s) that cannot contain it",
12250  contained_item.typeId().str(), contained_item.charges, typeId().str() );
12251  }
12252  on_contents_changed();
12253  return num_contained;
12254 }
12255 
12256 void item::set_countdown( int num_turns )
12257 {
12258  if( num_turns < 0 ) {
12259  debugmsg( "Tried to set a negative countdown value %d.", num_turns );
12260  return;
12261  }
12262  if( !ammo_types().empty() ) {
12263  debugmsg( "Tried to set countdown on an item with ammo." );
12264  return;
12265  }
12266  charges = num_turns;
12267 }
12268 
12269 bool item::use_charges( const itype_id &what, int &qty, std::list<item> &used,
12270  const tripoint &pos, const std::function<bool( const item & )> &filter,
12271  Character *carrier, bool in_tools )
12272 {
12273  std::vector<item *> del;
12274 
12275  visit_items(
12276  [&what, &qty, &used, &pos, &del, &filter, &carrier, &in_tools]( item * e, item * parent ) {
12277  if( qty == 0 ) {
12278  // found sufficient charges
12279  return VisitResponse::ABORT;
12280  }
12281 
12282  if( !filter( *e ) ) {
12283  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
12284  }
12285 
12286  if( e->is_tool() ) {
12287  if( e->typeId() == what || ( in_tools && e->ammo_current() == what ) ) {
12288  int n;
12289  if( carrier ) {
12290  n = e->ammo_consume( qty, pos, carrier );
12291  } else {
12292  n = e->ammo_consume( qty, pos, nullptr );
12293  }
12294 
12295  if( n > 0 ) {
12296  item temp( *e );
12297  used.push_back( temp );
12298  qty -= n;
12299  return VisitResponse::SKIP;
12300  }
12301  }
12302  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
12303 
12304  } else if( e->count_by_charges() ) {
12305  if( e->typeId() == what ) {
12306  // if can supply excess charges split required off leaving remainder in-situ
12307  item obj = e->split( qty );
12308  if( parent ) {
12309  parent->contained_where( *e )->on_contents_changed();
12310  parent->on_contents_changed();
12311  }
12312  if( !obj.is_null() ) {
12313  used.push_back( obj );
12314  qty = 0;
12315  return VisitResponse::ABORT;
12316  }
12317 
12318  qty -= e->charges;
12319  used.push_back( *e );
12320  del.push_back( e );
12321  }
12322  // items counted by charges are not themselves expected to be containers
12323  return VisitResponse::SKIP;
12324  }
12325 
12326  // recurse through any nested containers
12327  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
12328  } );
12329 
12330  bool destroy = false;
12331  for( item *e : del ) {
12332  if( e == this ) {
12333  destroy = true; // cannot remove ourselves...
12334  } else {
12335  remove_item( *e );
12336  }
12337  }
12338 
12339  return destroy;
12340 }
12341 
12342 void item::set_snippet( const snippet_id &id )
12343 {
12344  if( is_null() ) {
12345  return;
12346  }
12347  if( !id.is_valid() ) {
12348  debugmsg( "there's no snippet with id %s", id.str() );
12349  return;
12350  }
12351  snip_id = id;
12352 }
12353 
12354 const item_category &item::get_category_shallow() const
12355 {
12356  static item_category null_category;
12357  return type->category_force.is_valid() ? type->category_force.obj() : null_category;
12358 }
12359 
12360 const item_category &item::get_category_of_contents( int depth, int maxdepth ) const
12361 {
12362  if( depth < maxdepth && type->category_force == item_category_container ) {
12363  if( cached_category.timestamp == calendar::turn ) {
12364  return cached_category.id.obj();
12365  }
12366  ++depth;
12367  if( item::aggregate_t const aggi = aggregated_contents( depth, maxdepth ); aggi ) {
12368  item_category const &cat = aggi.header->get_category_of_contents( depth, maxdepth );
12369  cached_category = { cat.get_id(), calendar::turn };
12370  return cat;
12371  }
12372  }
12373  return this->get_category_shallow();
12374 }
12375 
12376 iteminfo::iteminfo( const std::string &Type, const std::string &Name, const std::string &Fmt,
12377  flags Flags, double Value, double UnitVal )
12378 {
12379  sType = Type;
12380  sName = replace_colors( Name );
12381  sFmt = replace_colors( Fmt );
12382  is_int = !( Flags & is_decimal || Flags & is_three_decimal );
12383  three_decimal = ( Flags & is_three_decimal );
12384  dValue = Value;
12385  dUnitAdjustedVal = UnitVal < std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon() &&
12386  UnitVal > -std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon() ? Value : UnitVal;
12387  bShowPlus = static_cast<bool>( Flags & show_plus );
12388  std::stringstream convert;
12389  if( bShowPlus ) {
12390  convert << std::showpos;
12391  }
12392  if( is_int ) {
12393  convert << std::setprecision( 0 );
12394  } else if( three_decimal ) {
12395  convert << std::setprecision( 3 );
12396  } else {
12397  convert << std::setprecision( 2 );
12398  }
12399  convert << std::fixed << Value;
12400  sValue = convert.str();
12401  bNewLine = !( Flags & no_newline );
12402  bLowerIsBetter = static_cast<bool>( Flags & lower_is_better );
12403  bDrawName = !( Flags & no_name );
12404 }
12405 
12406 iteminfo::iteminfo( const std::string &Type, const std::string &Name, flags Flags )
12407  : iteminfo( Type, Name, "", Flags )
12408 {
12409 }
12410 
12411 iteminfo::iteminfo( const std::string &Type, const std::string &Name, double Value,
12412  double UnitVal )
12413  : iteminfo( Type, Name, "", no_flags, Value, UnitVal )
12414 {
12415 }
12416 
12417 iteminfo vol_to_info( const std::string &type, const std::string &left,
12418  const units::volume &vol, int decimal_places, bool lower_is_better )
12419 {
12420  iteminfo::flags f = iteminfo::no_newline;
12421  if( lower_is_better ) {
12422  f |= iteminfo::lower_is_better;
12423  }
12424  int converted_volume_scale = 0;
12425  const double converted_volume =
12426  round_up( convert_volume( vol.value(), &converted_volume_scale ), decimal_places );
12427  if( converted_volume_scale != 0 ) {
12428  f |= iteminfo::is_decimal;
12429  }
12430  return iteminfo( type, left, string_format( "<num> %s", volume_units_abbr() ), f,
12431  converted_volume );
12432 }
12433 
12434 iteminfo weight_to_info( const std::string &type, const std::string &left,
12435  const units::mass &weight, int /* decimal_places */, bool lower_is_better )
12436 {
12437  iteminfo::flags f = iteminfo::no_newline;
12438  if( lower_is_better ) {
12439  f |= iteminfo::lower_is_better;
12440  }
12441  const double converted_weight = convert_weight( weight );
12442  f |= iteminfo::is_decimal;
12443  return iteminfo( type, left, string_format( "<num> %s", weight_units() ), f,
12444  converted_weight );
12445 }
12446 
12447 bool item::will_explode_in_fire() const
12448 {
12449  if( type->explode_in_fire ) {
12450  return true;
12451  }
12452 
12453  if( type->ammo && ( type->ammo->special_cookoff || type->ammo->cookoff ) ) {
12454  return true;
12455  }
12456 
12457  return false;
12458 }
12459 
12460 bool item::detonate( const tripoint &p, std::vector<item> &drops )
12461 {
12462  const Creature *source = get_player_character().get_faction()->id == owner
12463  ? &get_player_character()
12464  : nullptr;
12465  if( type->explosion.power >= 0 ) {
12466  explosion_handler::explosion( source, p, type->explosion );
12467  return true;
12468  } else if( type->ammo && ( type->ammo->special_cookoff || type->ammo->cookoff ) ) {
12469  int charges_remaining = charges;
12470  const int rounds_exploded = rng( 1, charges_remaining / 2 );
12471  if( type->ammo->special_cookoff ) {
12472  // If it has a special effect just trigger it.
12473  apply_ammo_effects( nullptr, p, type->ammo->ammo_effects );
12474  }
12475  if( type->ammo->cookoff ) {
12476  // If ammo type can burn, then create an explosion proportional to quantity.
12477  float power = 3.0f * std::pow( rounds_exploded / 25.0f, 0.25f );
12478  explosion_handler::explosion( nullptr, p, power, 0.0f, false, 0 );
12479  }
12480  charges_remaining -= rounds_exploded;
12481  if( charges_remaining > 0 ) {
12482  item temp_item = *this;
12483  temp_item.charges = charges_remaining;
12484  drops.push_back( temp_item );
12485  }
12486 
12487  return true;
12488  }
12489 
12490  return false;
12491 }
12492 bool item::has_rotten_away() const
12493 {
12494  if( is_corpse() && !can_revive() ) {
12495  return get_rot() > 10_days;
12496  } else {
12497  return get_relative_rot() > 2.0;
12498  }
12499 }
12500 
12501 bool item_ptr_compare_by_charges( const item *left, const item *right )
12502 {
12503  if( left->empty() ) {
12504  return false;
12505  } else if( right->empty() ) {
12506  return true;
12507  } else {
12508  return right->only_item().charges < left->only_item().charges;
12509  }
12510 }
12511 
12512 bool item_compare_by_charges( const item &left, const item &right )
12513 {
12514  return item_ptr_compare_by_charges( &left, &right );
12515 }
12516 
12517 static const std::string USED_BY_IDS( "USED_BY_IDS" );
12518 bool item::already_used_by_player( const Character &p ) const
12519 {
12520  const auto it = item_vars.find( USED_BY_IDS );
12521  if( it == item_vars.end() ) {
12522  return false;
12523  }
12524  // USED_BY_IDS always starts *and* ends with a ';', the search string
12525  // ';<id>;' matches at most one part of USED_BY_IDS, and only when exactly that
12526  // id has been added.
12527  const std::string needle = string_format( ";%d;", p.getID().get_value() );
12528  return it->second.find( needle ) != std::string::npos;
12529 }
12530 
12531 void item::mark_as_used_by_player( const Character &p )
12532 {
12533  std::string &used_by_ids = item_vars[ USED_BY_IDS ];
12534  if( used_by_ids.empty() ) {
12535  // *always* start with a ';'
12536  used_by_ids = ";";
12537  }
12538  // and always end with a ';'
12539  used_by_ids += string_format( "%d;", p.getID().get_value() );
12540 }
12541 
12542 bool item::can_holster( const item &obj, bool ) const
12543 {
12544  if( !type->can_use( "holster" ) ) {
12545  return false; // item is not a holster
12546  }
12547 
12548  const holster_actor *ptr = dynamic_cast<const holster_actor *>
12549  ( type->get_use( "holster" )->get_actor_ptr() );
12550  return ptr->can_holster( *this, obj );
12551 }
12552 
12553 bool item::will_spill() const
12554 {
12555  return contents.will_spill();
12556 }
12557 
12558 bool item::will_spill_if_unsealed() const
12559 {
12560  return contents.will_spill_if_unsealed();
12561 }
12562 
12563 std::string item::components_to_string() const
12564 {
12565  using t_count_map = std::map<std::string, int>;
12566  t_count_map counts;
12567  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
12568  for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
12569  if( !it.has_flag( flag_BYPRODUCT ) ) {
12570  const std::string name = it.display_name();
12571  counts[name]++;
12572  }
12573  }
12574  }
12575  return enumerate_as_string( counts,
12576  []( const std::pair<std::string, int> &entry ) {
12577  return entry.second != 1
12578  ? string_format( pgettext( "components count", "%d x %s" ), entry.second, entry.first )
12579  : entry.first;
12580  }, enumeration_conjunction::none );
12581 }
12582 
12583 uint64_t item::make_component_hash() const
12584 {
12585  std::string concatenated_ids;
12586  for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
12587  for( size_t i = 0; i < tvp.second.size(); ++i ) {
12588  concatenated_ids += tvp.first.str();
12589  }
12590  }
12591 
12592  std::hash<std::string> hasher;
12593  return hasher( concatenated_ids );
12594 }
12595 
12596 bool item::needs_processing() const
12597 {
12598  return processing_speed() != NO_PROCESSING;
12599 }
12600 
12601 int item::processing_speed() const
12602 {
12603  if( is_corpse() || is_comestible() ) {
12604  return to_turns<int>( 10_minutes );
12605  }
12606 
12607  if( active || ethereal || wetness || has_link_data() ||
12608  has_flag( flag_RADIO_ACTIVATION ) || has_relic_recharge() ||
12609  has_fault_flag( flag_BLACKPOWDER_FOULING_DAMAGE ) || get_var( "gun_heat", 0 ) > 0 ) {
12610  // Unless otherwise indicated, update every turn.
12611  return 1;
12612  }
12613 
12614  return item::NO_PROCESSING;
12615 }
12616 
12617 void item::apply_freezerburn()
12618 {
12619  if( !has_flag( flag_FREEZERBURN ) ) {
12620  return;
12621  }
12622  set_flag( flag_MUSHY );
12623 }
12624 
12625 bool item::process_temperature_rot( float insulation, const tripoint &pos, map &here,
12626  Character *carrier, const temperature_flag flag, float spoil_modifier )
12627 {
12628  const time_point now = calendar::turn;
12629 
12630  // if player debug menu'd the time backward it breaks stuff, just reset the
12631  // last_temp_check in this case
12632  if( now - last_temp_check < 0_turns ) {
12633  reset_temp_check();
12634  return false;
12635  }
12636 
12637  // process temperature and rot at most once every 100_turns (10 min)
12638  // note we're also gated by item::processing_speed
12639  time_duration smallest_interval = 10_minutes;
12640  if( now - last_temp_check < smallest_interval && units::to_joule_per_gram( specific_energy ) > 0 ) {
12641  return false;
12642  }
12643 
12644  units::temperature temp = get_weather().get_temperature( pos );
12645 
12646  switch( flag ) {
12647  case temperature_flag::NORMAL:
12648  // Just use the temperature normally
12649  break;
12650  case temperature_flag::FRIDGE:
12651  temp = std::min( temp, temperatures::fridge );
12652  break;
12653  case temperature_flag::FREEZER:
12654  temp = std::min( temp, temperatures::freezer );
12655  break;
12656  case temperature_flag::HEATER:
12657  temp = std::max( temp, temperatures::normal );
12658  break;
12659  case temperature_flag::ROOT_CELLAR:
12660  temp = AVERAGE_ANNUAL_TEMPERATURE;
12661  break;
12662  default:
12663  debugmsg( "Temperature flag enum not valid. Using current temperature." );
12664  }
12665 
12666  bool carried = carrier != nullptr;
12667  // body heat increases inventory temperature by 5 F (2.77 K) and insulation by 50%
12668  if( carried ) {
12669  insulation *= 1.5;
12670  temp += units::from_fahrenheit_delta( 5 );
12671  }
12672 
12673  time_point time = last_temp_check;
12674  item_internal::scoped_goes_bad_cache _cache( this );
12675  const bool process_rot = goes_bad() && spoil_modifier != 0;
12676 
12677  if( now - time > 1_hours ) {
12678  // This code is for items that were left out of reality bubble for long time
12679 
12680  const weather_generator &wgen = get_weather().get_cur_weather_gen();
12681  const unsigned int seed = g->get_seed();
12682 
12683  units::temperature_delta temp_mod;
12684  // Toilets and vending machines will try to get the heat radiation and convection during mapgen and segfault.
12685  if( !g->new_game ) {
12686  temp_mod = get_heat_radiation( pos );
12687  temp_mod += get_convection_temperature( pos );
12688  temp_mod += here.get_temperature_mod( pos );
12689  } else {
12690  temp_mod = units::from_kelvin_delta( 0 );
12691  }
12692 
12693  if( carried ) {
12694  temp_mod += units::from_fahrenheit_delta( 5 ); // body heat increases inventory temperature
12695  }
12696 
12697  // Process the past of this item in 1h chunks until there is less than 1h left.
12698  time_duration time_delta = 1_hours;
12699 
12700  while( now - time > 1_hours ) {
12701  time += time_delta;
12702 
12703  // Get the environment temperature
12704  // Use weather if above ground, use map temp if below
12705  units::temperature env_temperature;
12706  if( pos.z >= 0 && flag != temperature_flag::ROOT_CELLAR ) {
12707  env_temperature = wgen.get_weather_temperature( pos, time, seed );
12708  } else {
12709  env_temperature = AVERAGE_ANNUAL_TEMPERATURE;
12710  }
12711  env_temperature += temp_mod;
12712 
12713  switch( flag ) {
12714  case temperature_flag::NORMAL:
12715  // Just use the temperature normally
12716  break;
12717  case temperature_flag::FRIDGE:
12718  env_temperature = std::min( env_temperature, temperatures::fridge );
12719  break;
12720  case temperature_flag::FREEZER:
12721  env_temperature = std::min( env_temperature, temperatures::freezer );
12722  break;
12723  case temperature_flag::HEATER:
12724  env_temperature = std::max( env_temperature, temperatures::normal );
12725  break;
12726  case temperature_flag::ROOT_CELLAR:
12727  env_temperature = AVERAGE_ANNUAL_TEMPERATURE;
12728  break;
12729  default:
12730  debugmsg( "Temperature flag enum not valid. Using normal temperature." );
12731  }
12732 
12733  // Calculate item temperature from environment temperature
12734  // If the time was more than 2 d ago we do not care about item temperature.
12735  if( now - time < 2_days ) {
12736  calc_temp( env_temperature, insulation, time_delta );
12737  }
12738  last_temp_check = time;
12739 
12740  // Calculate item rot
12741  if( process_rot ) {
12742  calc_rot( env_temperature, spoil_modifier, time_delta );
12743 
12744  if( has_rotten_away() && carrier == nullptr ) {
12745  // No need to track item that will be gone
12746  return true;
12747  }
12748  }
12749  }
12750  }
12751 
12752  // Remaining <1 h from above
12753  // and items that are held near the player
12754  if( now - time > smallest_interval ) {
12755  calc_temp( temp, insulation, now - time );
12756  last_temp_check = now;
12757  if( process_rot ) {
12758  calc_rot( temp, spoil_modifier, now - time );
12759  return has_rotten_away() && carrier == nullptr;
12760  }
12761  }
12762 
12763  // Just now created items will get here.
12764  if( units::to_joule_per_gram( specific_energy ) < 0 ) {
12765  set_item_temperature( temp );
12766  }
12767  return false;
12768 }
12769 
12770 void item::calc_temp( const units::temperature &temp, const float insulation,
12771  const time_duration &time_delta )
12772 {
12773  const float env_temperature = units::to_kelvin( temp ); // K
12774  const float old_temperature = units::to_kelvin( temperature ); // K
12775  const float temperature_difference = env_temperature - old_temperature;
12776 
12777  // If no or only small temperature difference then no need to do math.
12778  if( std::abs( temperature_difference ) < 0.4 ) {
12779  return;
12780  }
12781  const float mass = to_gram( weight() ); // g
12782 
12783  // If item has negative energy set to environment temperature (it not been processed ever)
12784  if( units::to_joule_per_gram( specific_energy ) < 0 ) {
12785  set_item_temperature( temp );
12786  return;
12787  }
12788 
12789  // specific_energy = item thermal energy (J/g). Stored in the item
12790  // temperature = item temperature (K). Stored in the item
12791  const float conductivity_term = 0.0076 * std::pow( to_milliliter( volume() ),
12792  2.0 / 3.0 ) / insulation;
12793  const float specific_heat_liquid = get_specific_heat_liquid();
12794  const float specific_heat_solid = get_specific_heat_solid();
12795  const float latent_heat = get_latent_heat();
12796  const float freezing_temperature = units::to_kelvin( get_freeze_point() );
12797  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely solid at freezing temperature
12798  const units::specific_energy completely_frozen_specific_energy = units::from_joule_per_gram(
12799  specific_heat_solid * freezing_temperature );
12800  // Energy that the item would have if it was completely liquid at freezing temperature
12801  const units::specific_energy completely_liquid_specific_energy = completely_frozen_specific_energy +
12802  units::from_joule_per_gram( latent_heat );
12803 
12804  float new_specific_energy;
12805  float new_item_temperature;
12806  float freeze_percentage = 0.0f;
12807  int extra_time;
12808 
12809  // Temperature calculations based on Newton's law of cooling.
12810  // Calculations are done assuming that the item stays in its phase.
12811  // This assumption can cause over heating when transitioning from melting to liquid.
12812  // In other transitions the item may cool/heat too little but that won't be a problem.
12813  if( specific_energy < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12814  // Was solid.
12815  new_item_temperature = ( - temperature_difference
12816  * std::exp( - to_turns<int>( time_delta ) * conductivity_term / ( mass * specific_heat_solid ) )
12817  + env_temperature );
12818  new_specific_energy = new_item_temperature * specific_heat_solid;
12819  if( new_item_temperature > freezing_temperature + 0.5 ) {
12820  // Started melting before temp was calculated.
12821  // 0.5 is here because we don't care if it heats up a bit too high
12822  // Calculate how long the item was solid
12823  // and apply rest of the time as melting
12824  extra_time = to_turns<int>( time_delta )
12825  - std::log( - temperature_difference / ( freezing_temperature - env_temperature ) )
12826  * ( mass * specific_heat_solid / conductivity_term );
12827  new_specific_energy = units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_frozen_specific_energy )
12828  + conductivity_term
12829  * ( env_temperature - freezing_temperature ) * extra_time / mass;
12830  new_item_temperature = freezing_temperature;
12831  if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) > completely_liquid_specific_energy ) {
12832  // The item then also finished melting.
12833  // This may happen rarely with very small items
12834  // Just set the item to environment temperature
12835  set_item_temperature( units::from_kelvin( env_temperature ) );
12836  return;
12837  }
12838  }
12839  } else if( specific_energy > completely_liquid_specific_energy ) {
12840  // Was liquid.
12841  new_item_temperature = ( - temperature_difference
12842  * std::exp( - to_turns<int>( time_delta ) * conductivity_term / ( mass *
12843  specific_heat_liquid ) )
12844  + env_temperature );
12845  new_specific_energy = ( new_item_temperature - freezing_temperature ) * specific_heat_liquid +
12846  units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy );
12847  if( new_item_temperature < freezing_temperature - 0.5 ) {
12848  // Started freezing before temp was calculated.
12849  // 0.5 is here because we don't care if it cools down a bit too low
12850  // Calculate how long the item was liquid
12851  // and apply rest of the time as freezing
12852  extra_time = to_turns<int>( time_delta )
12853  - std::log( - temperature_difference / ( freezing_temperature - env_temperature ) )
12854  * ( mass * specific_heat_liquid / conductivity_term );
12855  new_specific_energy = units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy )
12856  + conductivity_term
12857  * ( env_temperature - freezing_temperature ) * extra_time / mass;
12858  new_item_temperature = freezing_temperature;
12859  if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12860  // The item then also finished freezing.
12861  // This may happen rarely with very small items
12862  // Just set the item to environment temperature
12863  set_item_temperature( units::from_kelvin( env_temperature ) );
12864  return;
12865  }
12866  }
12867  } else {
12868  // Was melting or freezing
12869  new_specific_energy = units::to_joule_per_gram( specific_energy ) + conductivity_term *
12870  temperature_difference * to_turns<int>( time_delta ) / mass;
12871  new_item_temperature = freezing_temperature;
12872  if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) > completely_liquid_specific_energy ) {
12873  // Item melted before temp was calculated
12874  // Calculate how long the item was melting
12875  // and apply rest of the time as liquid
12876  extra_time = to_turns<int>( time_delta ) - ( mass / ( conductivity_term * temperature_difference ) )
12877  *
12878  units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy - specific_energy );
12879  new_item_temperature = ( ( freezing_temperature - env_temperature )
12880  * std::exp( - extra_time * conductivity_term / ( mass *
12881  specific_heat_liquid ) )
12882  + env_temperature );
12883  new_specific_energy = ( new_item_temperature - freezing_temperature ) * specific_heat_liquid +
12884  units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy );
12885  } else if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12886  // Item froze before temp was calculated
12887  // Calculate how long the item was freezing
12888  // and apply rest of the time as solid
12889  extra_time = to_turns<int>( time_delta ) - ( mass / ( conductivity_term * temperature_difference ) )
12890  *
12891  units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_frozen_specific_energy - specific_energy );
12892  new_item_temperature = ( ( freezing_temperature - env_temperature )
12893  * std::exp( - extra_time * conductivity_term / ( mass *
12894  specific_heat_solid ) )
12895  + env_temperature );
12896  new_specific_energy = new_item_temperature * specific_heat_solid;
12897  }
12898  }
12899  // Check freeze status now based on energies.
12900  if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) > completely_liquid_specific_energy ) {
12901  freeze_percentage = 0;
12902  } else if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12903  // Item is solid
12904  freeze_percentage = 1;
12905  } else {
12906  // Item is partially solid
12907  freeze_percentage = ( units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy ) -
12908  new_specific_energy ) /
12909  units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy - completely_frozen_specific_energy );
12910  }
12911 
12912  temperature = units::from_kelvin( new_item_temperature );
12913  specific_energy = units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy );
12914  set_temp_flags( temperature, freeze_percentage );
12915 }
12916 
12917 void item::set_temp_flags( units::temperature new_temperature, float freeze_percentage )
12918 {
12919  units::temperature freezing_temperature = get_freeze_point();
12920  // Apply temperature tags tags
12921  // Hot = over temperatures::hot
12922  // Warm = over temperatures::warm
12923  // Cold = below temperatures::cold
12924  // Frozen = Over 50% frozen
12925  if( has_own_flag( flag_FROZEN ) ) {
12926  unset_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12927  if( freeze_percentage < 0.5 ) {
12928  // Item melts and becomes mushy
12929  current_phase = type->phase;
12930  apply_freezerburn();
12931  unset_flag( flag_SHREDDED );
12932  if( made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
12933  set_flag( flag_FROM_FROZEN_LIQUID );
12934  }
12935  }
12936  } else if( has_own_flag( flag_COLD ) ) {
12937  unset_flag( flag_COLD );
12938  } else if( has_own_flag( flag_HOT ) ) {
12939  unset_flag( flag_HOT );
12940  }
12941  if( new_temperature > temperatures::hot ) {
12942  set_flag( flag_HOT );
12943  } else if( freeze_percentage > 0.5 ) {
12944  set_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12945  current_phase = phase_id::SOLID;
12946  // If below freezing temp AND the food may have parasites AND food does not have "NO_PARASITES" tag then add the "NO_PARASITES" tag.
12947  if( is_food() && new_temperature < freezing_temperature && get_comestible()->parasites > 0 ) {
12948  set_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES );
12949  }
12950  } else if( new_temperature < temperatures::cold ) {
12951  set_flag( flag_COLD );
12952  }
12953 
12954  // Convert water into clean water if it starts boiling
12955  if( typeId() == itype_water && new_temperature > temperatures::boiling ) {
12956  convert( itype_water_clean ).poison = 0;
12957  }
12958 }
12959 
12960 float item::get_item_thermal_energy() const
12961 {
12962  const float mass = to_gram( weight() ); // g
12963  return units::to_joule_per_gram( specific_energy ) * mass;
12964 }
12965 
12966 void item::heat_up()
12967 {
12968  unset_flag( flag_COLD );
12969  unset_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12970  unset_flag( flag_SHREDDED );
12971  set_flag( flag_HOT );
12972  current_phase = type->phase;
12973  // Set item temperature to 60 C (333.15 K, 122 F)
12974  // Also set the energy to match
12975  temperature = units::from_celsius( 60 );
12976  specific_energy = get_specific_energy_from_temperature( units::from_celsius( 60 ) );
12977 
12978  reset_temp_check();
12979 }
12980 
12981 void item::cold_up()
12982 {
12983  unset_flag( flag_HOT );
12984  unset_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12985  unset_flag( flag_SHREDDED );
12986  set_flag( flag_COLD );
12987  current_phase = type->phase;
12988  // Set item temperature to 3 C (276.15 K, 37.4 F)
12989  // Also set the energy to match
12990  temperature = units::from_celsius( 3 );
12991  specific_energy = get_specific_energy_from_temperature( units::from_celsius( 3 ) );
12992 
12993  reset_temp_check();
12994 }
12995 
12996 void item::reset_temp_check()
12997 {
12998  last_temp_check = calendar::turn;
12999 }
13000 
13001 std::vector<trait_id> item::mutations_from_wearing( const Character &guy, bool removing ) const
13002 {
13003  if( !is_relic() ) {
13004  return std::vector<trait_id> {};
13005  }
13006  std::vector<trait_id> muts;
13007 
13008  for( const enchant_cache &ench : relic_data->get_proc_enchantments() ) {
13009  for( const trait_id &mut : ench.get_mutations() ) {
13010  // this may not be perfectly accurate due to conditions
13011  muts.push_back( mut );
13012  }
13013  }
13014  if( type->relic_data ) {
13015  for( const enchantment &ench : type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments() ) {
13016  for( const trait_id &mut : ench.get_mutations() ) {
13017  // this may not be perfectly accurate due to conditions
13018  muts.push_back( mut );
13019  }
13020  }
13021  }
13022  for( const trait_id &char_mut : guy.get_mutations( true, removing ) ) {
13023  for( auto iter = muts.begin(); iter != muts.end(); ) {
13024  if( char_mut == *iter ) {
13025  iter = muts.erase( iter );
13026  } else {
13027  ++iter;
13028  }
13029  }
13030  }
13031 
13032  return muts;
13033 }
13034 
13035 void item::overwrite_relic( const relic &nrelic )
13036 {
13037  this->relic_data = cata::make_value<relic>( nrelic );
13038 }
13039 
13040 bool item::use_relic( Character &guy, const tripoint &pos )
13041 {
13042  return relic_data->activate( guy, pos );
13043 }
13044 
13045 void item::process_relic( Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13046 {
13047  if( !is_relic() ) {
13048  return;
13049  }
13050 
13051  relic_data->try_recharge( *this, carrier, pos );
13052 }
13053 
13054 bool item::process_corpse( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13055 {
13056  // some corpses rez over time
13057  if( corpse == nullptr || damage() >= max_damage() ) {
13058  return false;
13059  }
13060 
13061  if( corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_DORMANT ) ) {
13062  //if dormant, ensure trap still exists.
13063  const trap *trap_here = &here.tr_at( pos );
13064  if( trap_here->is_null() ) {
13065  // if there isn't a trap, we need to add one again.
13066  here.trap_set( pos, trap_id( "tr_dormant_corpse" ) );
13067  } else if( trap_here->loadid != trap_id( "tr_dormant_corpse" ) ) {
13068  // if there is a trap, but it isn't the right one, we need to revive the zombie manually.
13069  return g->revive_corpse( pos, *this, 3 );
13070  }
13071  return false;
13072  }
13073 
13074  // handle human corpses rising as zombies
13075  if( corpse->id == mtype_id::NULL_ID() && !has_var( "zombie_form" ) &&
13076  !mon_human->zombify_into.is_empty() ) {
13077  set_var( "zombie_form", mon_human->zombify_into.c_str() );
13078  }
13079 
13080  if( !ready_to_revive( here, pos ) ) {
13081  return false;
13082  }
13083  if( rng( 0, volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor ) > burnt && g->revive_corpse( pos, *this ) ) {
13084  if( carrier == nullptr ) {
13085  if( corpse->in_species( species_ROBOT ) ) {
13086  add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_warning, _( "A nearby robot has repaired itself and stands up!" ) );
13087  } else {
13088  add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_warning, _( "A nearby corpse rises and moves towards you!" ) );
13089  }
13090  } else {
13091  if( corpse->in_species( species_ROBOT ) ) {
13092  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning,
13093  _( "Oh dear god, a robot you're carrying has started moving!" ) );
13094  } else {
13095  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning,
13096  _( "Oh dear god, a corpse you're carrying has started moving!" ) );
13097  }
13098  }
13099  // Destroy this corpse item
13100  return true;
13101  }
13102 
13103  return false;
13104 }
13105 
13106 bool item::process_fake_mill( map &here, Character * /*carrier*/, const tripoint &pos )
13107 {
13108  if( here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_wind_mill_active &&
13109  here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_water_mill_active ) {
13110  item_counter = 0;
13111  return true; //destroy fake mill
13112  }
13113  if( age() >= 6_hours || item_counter == 0 ) {
13114  iexamine::mill_finalize( get_avatar(), pos ); //activate effects when timers goes to zero
13115  return true; //destroy fake mill item
13116  }
13117 
13118  return false;
13119 }
13120 
13121 bool item::process_fake_smoke( map &here, Character * /*carrier*/, const tripoint &pos )
13122 {
13123  if( here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_smoking_rack_active &&
13124  here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_metal_smoking_rack_active ) {
13125  item_counter = 0;
13126  return true; //destroy fake smoke
13127  }
13128 
13129  if( age() >= 6_hours || item_counter == 0 ) {
13130  iexamine::on_smoke_out( pos, birthday() ); //activate effects when timers goes to zero
13131  return true; //destroy fake smoke when it 'burns out'
13132  }
13133 
13134  return false;
13135 }
13136 
13137 bool item::process_litcig( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13138 {
13139  // cig dies out
13140  if( item_counter == 0 ) {
13141  if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13142  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You finish your %s." ), tname() );
13143  }
13144  if( typeId() == itype_cig_lit ) {
13145  convert( itype_cig_butt, carrier );
13146  } else if( typeId() == itype_cigar_lit ) {
13147  convert( itype_cigar_butt, carrier );
13148  } else { // joint
13149  convert( itype_joint_roach, carrier );
13150  if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13151  carrier->add_effect( effect_weed_high, 1_minutes ); // one last puff
13152  here.add_field( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), field_type_id( "fd_weedsmoke" ), 2 );
13153  weed_msg( *carrier );
13154  }
13155  }
13156  active = false;
13157  return false;
13158  }
13159 
13160  if( !one_in( 10 ) ) {
13161  return false;
13162  }
13163  process_extinguish( here, carrier, pos );
13164  // process_extinguish might have extinguished the item already
13165  if( !active ) {
13166  return false;
13167  }
13168  // if carried by someone:
13169  if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13170  time_duration duration = 15_seconds;
13171  if( carrier->has_trait( trait_TOLERANCE ) ) {
13172  duration = 7_seconds;
13173  } else if( carrier->has_trait( trait_LIGHTWEIGHT ) ) {
13174  duration = 30_seconds;
13175  }
13176  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You take a puff of your %s." ), tname() );
13177  if( has_flag( flag_TOBACCO ) ) {
13178  carrier->add_effect( effect_cig, duration );
13179  } else {
13180  carrier->add_effect( effect_weed_high, duration / 2 );
13181  }
13182  carrier->mod_moves( -to_moves<int>( 1_seconds ) * 0.15 );
13183 
13184  if( ( carrier->has_effect( effect_shakes ) && one_in( 10 ) ) ||
13185  ( carrier->has_trait( trait_JITTERY ) && one_in( 200 ) ) ) {
13186  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your shaking hand causes you to drop your %s." ),
13187  tname() );
13188  here.add_item_or_charges( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), *this );
13189  return true; // removes the item that has just been added to the map
13190  }
13191 
13192  if( carrier->has_effect( effect_sleep ) ) {
13193  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You fall asleep and drop your %s." ),
13194  tname() );
13195  here.add_item_or_charges( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), *this );
13196  return true; // removes the item that has just been added to the map
13197  }
13198  } else {
13199  // If not carried by someone, but laying on the ground:
13200  if( item_counter % 5 == 0 ) {
13201  // lit cigarette can start fires
13202  if( here.flammable_items_at( pos ) ||
13203  here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE, pos ) ||
13204  here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE_ASH, pos ) ) {
13205  here.add_field( pos, fd_fire, 1 );
13206  }
13207  }
13208  }
13209 
13210  // Item remains
13211  return false;
13212 }
13213 
13214 bool item::process_extinguish( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13215 {
13216  // checks for water
13217  bool extinguish = false;
13218  bool in_inv = carrier != nullptr && carrier->has_item( *this );
13219  bool submerged = false;
13220  bool precipitation = false;
13221  bool windtoostrong = false;
13222  bool in_veh = carrier != nullptr && carrier->in_vehicle;
13223  w_point weatherPoint = *get_weather().weather_precise;
13224  int windpower = get_weather().windspeed;
13225  switch( get_weather().weather_id->precip ) {
13226  case precip_class::very_light:
13227  precipitation = one_in( 100 );
13228  break;
13229  case precip_class::light:
13230  precipitation = one_in( 50 );
13231  break;
13232  case precip_class::heavy:
13233  precipitation = one_in( 10 );
13234  break;
13235  default:
13236  break;
13237  }
13238  if( in_inv && !in_veh && here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, pos ) ) {
13239  extinguish = true;
13240  submerged = true;
13241  }
13242  if( ( !in_inv && here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_LIQUID, pos ) && !here.veh_at( pos ) ) ||
13243  ( precipitation && !g->is_sheltered( pos ) ) ) {
13244  extinguish = true;
13245  }
13246  if( in_inv && windpower > 5 && !g->is_sheltered( pos ) &&
13247  this->has_flag( flag_WIND_EXTINGUISH ) ) {
13248  windtoostrong = true;
13249  extinguish = true;
13250  }
13251  if( !extinguish ||
13252  ( in_inv && precipitation && carrier->get_wielded_item() &&
13253  carrier->get_wielded_item()->has_flag( flag_RAIN_PROTECT ) ) ) {
13254  return false; //nothing happens
13255  }
13256  if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13257  if( submerged ) {
13258  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is quenched by water." ), tname() );
13259  } else if( precipitation ) {
13260  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is quenched by precipitation." ),
13261  tname() );
13262  } else if( windtoostrong ) {
13263  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is blown out by the wind." ),
13264  tname() );
13265  }
13266  }
13267 
13268  // cig dies out
13269  if( has_flag( flag_LITCIG ) ) {
13270  if( typeId() == itype_cig_lit ) {
13271  convert( itype_cig_butt, carrier );
13272  } else if( typeId() == itype_cigar_lit ) {
13273  convert( itype_cigar_butt, carrier );
13274  } else { // joint
13275  convert( itype_joint_roach, carrier );
13276  }
13277  } else { // transform (lit) items
13278  if( type->revert_to ) {
13279  convert( *type->revert_to, carrier );
13280  } else {
13281  type->invoke( carrier, *this, pos, "transform" );
13282  }
13283 
13284  }
13285  active = false;
13286  // Item remains
13287  return false;
13288 }
13289 
13290 item::link_data &item::link()
13291 {
13292  if( link_ ) {
13293  return *link_;
13294  }
13295  if( !can_link_up() ) {
13296  debugmsg( "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link().",
13297  tname() );
13298  }
13299  return *( link_ = cata::make_value<item::link_data>() );
13300 }
13301 
13302 const item::link_data &item::link() const
13303 {
13304  if( link_ ) {
13305  return *link_;
13306  }
13307  if( !can_link_up() ) {
13308  debugmsg( "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link().",
13309  tname() );
13310  }
13311  return *( link_ = cata::make_value<item::link_data>() );
13312 }
13313 
13314 bool item::has_link_data() const
13315 {
13316  return !!link_;
13317 }
13318 
13319 bool item::can_link_up() const
13320 {
13321  return has_link_data() || type->can_use( "link_up" );
13322 }
13323 
13324 bool item::link_has_state( link_state state ) const
13325 {
13326  return !has_link_data() ? state == link_state::no_link :
13327  link_->source == state || link_->target == state;
13328 }
13329 
13330 bool item::link_has_states( link_state source, link_state target ) const
13331 {
13332  return !has_link_data() ? source == link_state::no_link && target == link_state::no_link :
13333  ( link_->source == source || link_->source == link_state::automatic ) &&
13334  ( link_->target == target || link_->target == link_state::automatic );
13335 }
13336 
13337 bool item::has_no_links() const
13338 {
13339  return !has_link_data() ? true :
13340  link_->source == link_state::no_link && link_->target == link_state::no_link;
13341 }
13342 
13343 std::string item::link_name() const
13344 {
13345  return has_flag( flag_CABLE_SPOOL ) ? label( 1 ) : string_format( " %s's cable", label( 1 ) );
13346 }
13347 
13348 ret_val<void> item::link_to( const optional_vpart_position &linked_vp, link_state link_type )
13349 {
13350  return linked_vp ? link_to( linked_vp->vehicle(), linked_vp->mount(), link_type ) :
13351  ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13352 }
13353 
13354 ret_val<void> item::link_to( const optional_vpart_position &first_linked_vp,
13355  const optional_vpart_position &second_linked_vp, link_state link_type )
13356 {
13357  if( !first_linked_vp || !second_linked_vp ) {
13358  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13359  }
13360  // Link up the second vehicle first so, if it's a tow cable, the first vehicle will tow the second.
13361  ret_val<void> result = link_to( second_linked_vp->vehicle(), second_linked_vp->mount(), link_type );
13362  if( !result.success() ) {
13363  return result;
13364  }
13365  return link_to( first_linked_vp->vehicle(), first_linked_vp->mount(), link_type );
13366 }
13367 
13368 ret_val<void> item::link_to( vehicle &veh, const point &mount, link_state link_type )
13369 {
13370  if( !can_link_up() ) {
13371  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %s doesn't have a cable!" ), type_name() );
13372  }
13373 
13374  // First, check if the desired link is actually possible.
13375 
13376  if( link_type == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13377  if( veh.has_tow_attached() || veh.is_towed() || veh.is_towing() ) {
13378  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "That vehicle already has a tow-line attached." ) );
13379  } else if( !veh.is_external_part( veh.mount_to_tripoint( mount ) ) ) {
13380  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach a tow-line to an internal part." ) );
13381  } else {
13382  const int part_at = veh.part_at( veh.coord_translate( mount ) );
13383  if( part_at != -1 && !veh.part( part_at ).carried_stack.empty() ) {
13384  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach a tow-line to a racked part." ) );
13385  }
13386  }
13387  } else {
13388  const link_up_actor *it_actor = static_cast<const link_up_actor *>
13389  ( get_use( "link_up" )->get_actor_ptr() );
13390  bool can_link_port = ( link_type == link_state::vehicle_port ||
13391  link_type == link_state::automatic ) &&
13392  it_actor->targets.find( link_state::vehicle_port ) != it_actor->targets.end() &&
13393  veh.avail_linkable_part( mount, true ) != -1;
13394 
13395  bool can_link_battery = ( link_type == link_state::vehicle_battery ||
13396  link_type == link_state::automatic ) &&
13397  it_actor->targets.find( link_state::vehicle_battery ) != it_actor->targets.end() &&
13398  veh.avail_linkable_part( mount, false ) != -1;
13399 
13400  if( !can_link_port && !can_link_battery ) {
13401  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %s can't connect to that." ), type_name() );
13402  } else if( link_type == link_state::automatic ) {
13403  link_type = can_link_port ? link_state::vehicle_port : link_state::vehicle_battery;
13404  }
13405  }
13406 
13407  bool bio_link = link_has_states( link_state::no_link, link_state::bio_cable );
13408  if( bio_link || has_no_links() ) {
13409 
13410  // No link exists, so start a new link to a vehicle/appliance.
13411 
13412  link().source = bio_link ? link_state::bio_cable : link_state::no_link;
13413  link().target = link_type;
13414  link().t_veh = veh.get_safe_reference();
13415  link().t_abs_pos = get_map().getglobal( link().t_veh->global_pos3() );
13416  link().t_mount = mount;
13417  link().s_bub_pos = tripoint_min; // Forces the item to check the length during process_link.
13418 
13419  update_link_traits();
13420  return ret_val<void>::make_success();
13421  }
13422 
13423  // There's already a link, so connect the previous vehicle/appliance to the new one.
13424 
13425  if( !link_has_state( link_state::no_link ) ) {
13426  debugmsg( "Failed to connect the %s, both ends are already connected!", tname() );
13427  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13428  }
13429  if( !link().t_veh ) {
13430  vehicle *found_veh = vehicle::find_vehicle( link().t_abs_pos );
13431  if( found_veh ) {
13432  link().t_veh = found_veh->get_safe_reference();
13433  } else {
13434  debugmsg( "Failed to connect the %s, it lost its vehicle pointer!", tname() );
13435  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13436  }
13437  }
13438  vehicle *prev_veh = link().t_veh.get();
13439  if( prev_veh == &veh ) {
13440  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You cannot connect the %s to itself." ), prev_veh->name );
13441  }
13442 
13443  // Prepare target tripoints for the cable parts that'll be added to the selected/previous vehicles
13444  const std::pair<tripoint, tripoint> prev_part_target = std::make_pair(
13445  ( veh.global_square_location() + veh.coord_translate( mount ) ).raw(),
13446  veh.global_square_location().raw() );
13447  const std::pair<tripoint, tripoint> sel_part_target = std::make_pair(
13448  ( link().t_abs_pos + prev_veh->coord_translate( link().t_mount ) ).raw(),
13449  link().t_abs_pos.raw() );
13450 
13451  for( const vpart_reference &vpr : prev_veh->get_any_parts( VPFLAG_POWER_TRANSFER ) ) {
13452  if( vpr.part().target.first == prev_part_target.first &&
13453  vpr.part().target.second == prev_part_target.second ) {
13454  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %1$s and %2$s are already connected." ),
13455  veh.name, prev_veh->name );
13456  }
13457  }
13458 
13459  if( rl_dist( prev_part_target.first, sel_part_target.first ) > link().max_length ) {
13460  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %s can't stretch that far!" ), type_name() );
13461  }
13462 
13463  const itype_id item_id = typeId();
13464  vpart_id vpid = vpart_id::NULL_ID();
13465  for( const vpart_info &e : vehicles::parts::get_all() ) {
13466  if( e.base_item == item_id ) {
13467  vpid = e.id;
13468  break;
13469  }
13470  }
13471 
13472  if( vpid.is_null() ) {
13473  debugmsg( "item %s is not base item of any vehicle part!", item_id.c_str() );
13474  return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13475  }
13476 
13477  const point prev_mount = link().t_mount;
13478 
13479  const ret_val<void> can_mount1 = prev_veh->can_mount( prev_mount, *vpid );
13480  if( !can_mount1.success() ) {
13481  //~ %1$s - cable name, %2$s - the reason why it failed
13482  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach the %1$s: %2$s" ),
13483  type_name(), can_mount1.str() );
13484  }
13485  const ret_val<void> can_mount2 = veh.can_mount( mount, *vpid );
13486  if( !can_mount2.success() ) {
13487  //~ %1$s - cable name, %2$s - the reason why it failed
13488  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach the %1$s: %2$s" ),
13489  type_name(), can_mount2.str() );
13490  }
13491 
13492  vehicle_part prev_veh_part( vpid, item( *this ) );
13493  prev_veh_part.target.first = prev_part_target.first;
13494  prev_veh_part.target.second = prev_part_target.second;
13495  prev_veh->install_part( prev_mount, std::move( prev_veh_part ) );
13496  prev_veh->precalc_mounts( 1, prev_veh->pivot_rotation[1], prev_veh->pivot_anchor[1] );
13497 
13498  vehicle_part sel_veh_part( vpid, item( *this ) );
13499  sel_veh_part.target.first = sel_part_target.first;
13500  sel_veh_part.target.second = sel_part_target.second;
13501  veh.install_part( mount, std::move( sel_veh_part ) );
13502  veh.precalc_mounts( 1, veh.pivot_rotation[1], veh.pivot_anchor[1] );
13503 
13504  if( link_type == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13505  if( link().source == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13506  veh.tow_data.set_towing( prev_veh, &veh ); // Previous vehicle is towing.
13507  } else {
13508  veh.tow_data.set_towing( &veh, prev_veh ); // Previous vehicle is being towed.
13509  }
13510  }
13511 
13512  if( typeId() != itype_power_cord ) {
13513  // Remove linked_flag from attached parts - the just-added cable vehicle parts do the same thing.
13514  reset_link();
13515  }
13516  //~ %1$s - first vehicle name, %2$s - second vehicle name - %3$s - cable name,
13517  return ret_val<void>::make_success( _( "You connect the %1$s and %2$s with the %3$s." ),
13518  prev_veh->disp_name(), veh.disp_name(), type_name() );
13519 }
13520 
13521 void item::update_link_traits()
13522 {
13523  if( !can_link_up() ) {
13524  return;
13525  }
13526 
13527  const link_up_actor *it_actor = static_cast<const link_up_actor *>
13528  ( get_use( "link_up" )->get_actor_ptr() );
13529  link().max_length = it_actor->cable_length == -1 ? type->maximum_charges() : it_actor->cable_length;
13530  link().efficiency = it_actor->efficiency < MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ? 0.0f : it_actor->efficiency;
13531  // Reset s_bub_pos to force the item to check the length during process_link.
13532  link().s_bub_pos = tripoint_min;
13533  link().last_processed = calendar::turn;
13534 
13535  for( const item *cable : cables() ) {
13536  if( !cable->can_link_up() ) {
13537  continue;
13538  }
13539  const link_up_actor *actor = static_cast<const link_up_actor *>
13540  ( cable->get_use( "link_up" )->get_actor_ptr() );
13541  link().max_length += actor->cable_length == -1 ? cable->type->maximum_charges() :
13542  actor->cable_length;
13543  link().efficiency = link().efficiency < MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ? 0.0f :
13544  link().efficiency * actor->efficiency;
13545  }
13546 
13547  if( link().efficiency >= MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ) {
13548  link().charge_rate = it_actor->charge_rate.value();
13549  // Convert charge_rate to how long it takes to charge 1 kW, the unit batteries use.
13550  // 0 means batteries won't be charged, but it can still provide power to devices unless efficiency is also 0.
13551  if( it_actor->charge_rate != 0_W ) {
13552  double charge_rate = std::floor( 1000000.0 / abs( it_actor->charge_rate.value() ) + 0.5 );
13553  link().charge_interval = std::max( 1, static_cast<int>( charge_rate ) );
13554  }
13555  }
13556 }
13557 
13558 int item::link_length() const
13559 {
13560  return has_no_links() ? -2 :
13561  link_has_state( link_state::needs_reeling ) ? -1 : link().length;
13562 }
13563 
13564 int item::max_link_length() const
13565 {
13566  return !has_link_data() ? -2 :
13567  link().max_length != -1 ? link().max_length : type->maximum_charges();
13568 }
13569 
13570 int item::link_sort_key() const
13571 {
13572  const int length = link_length();
13573  int key = length >= 0 ? -1000000000 : length == -1 ? 0 : 1000000000;
13574  key += max_link_length() * 100000;
13575  return key - length;
13576 }
13577 
13578 bool item::process_link( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13579 {
13580  if( link_length() < 0 ) {
13581  return false;
13582  }
13583 
13584  const bool is_cable_item = has_flag( flag_CABLE_SPOOL );
13585 
13586  // Handle links to items in the inventory.
13587  if( link().source == link_state::solarpack ) {
13588  if( carrier == nullptr || !carrier->worn_with_flag( flag_SOLARPACK_ON ) ) {
13589  add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_bad, _( "The %s has come loose from the solar pack." ),
13590  link_name() );
13591  reset_link( true, carrier );
13592  return false;
13593  }
13594  }
13595  const item_filter used_ups = [&]( const item & itm ) {
13596  return itm.get_var( "cable" ) == "plugged_in";
13597  };
13598  if( link().source == link_state::ups ) {
13599  if( carrier == nullptr || !carrier->cache_has_item_with( flag_IS_UPS, used_ups ) ) {
13600  add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_bad, _( "The %s has come loose from the UPS." ), link_name() );
13601  reset_link( true, carrier );
13602  return false;
13603  }
13604  }
13605  // Certain cable states should skip processing and also become inactive if dropped.
13606  if( ( link().target == link_state::no_link && link().source != link_state::vehicle_tow ) ||
13607  link().target == link_state::bio_cable ) {
13608  if( carrier == nullptr ) {
13609  return reset_link( true, nullptr, -1, true, pos );
13610  }
13611  return false;
13612  }
13613 
13614  const bool last_t_abs_pos_is_oob = !here.inbounds( link().t_abs_pos );
13615 
13616  // Lambda function for checking if a cable has been stretched too long, resetting it if so.
13617  // @return True if the cable is disconnected.
13618  const auto check_length = [this, carrier, pos, last_t_abs_pos_is_oob, is_cable_item]() {
13619  if( debug_mode ) {
13620  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_IUSE, "%s linked to %s%s, length %d/%d", type_name(),
13621  link().t_abs_pos.to_string_writable(), last_t_abs_pos_is_oob ? " (OoB)" : "",
13622  link().length, link().max_length );
13623  }
13624  if( link().length > link().max_length ) {
13625  std::string cable_name = is_cable_item ? string_format( "over-extended %s", label( 1 ) ) :
13626  string_format( "%s's over-extended cable", label( 1 ) );
13627  if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13628  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your %s breaks loose!" ), cable_name );
13629  } else {
13630  add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_bad, _( "Your %s breaks loose!" ), cable_name );
13631  }
13632  return true;
13633  } else if( link().length + M_SQRT2 >= link().max_length + 1 && carrier != nullptr ) {
13634  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "Your %s is stretched to its limit!" ), link_name() );
13635  }
13636  return false;
13637  };
13638 
13639  // Check if the item has moved positions this turn.
13640  bool length_check_needed = false;
13641  if( link().s_bub_pos != pos ) {
13642  link().s_bub_pos = pos;
13643  length_check_needed = true;
13644  }
13645 
13646  // Re-establish vehicle pointer if it got lost or if this item just got loaded.
13647  if( !link().t_veh ) {
13648  vehicle *found_veh = vehicle::find_vehicle( link().t_abs_pos );
13649  if( !found_veh ) {
13650  return reset_link( true, carrier, -2, true, pos );
13651  }
13652  if( debug_mode ) {
13653  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_IUSE, "Re-established link of %s to %s.", type_name(),
13654  found_veh->disp_name() );
13655  }
13656  link().t_veh = found_veh->get_safe_reference();
13657  }
13658 
13659  // Regular pointers are faster, so make one now that we know the reference is valid.
13660  vehicle *t_veh = link().t_veh.get();
13661 
13662  // We should skip processing if the last saved target point is out of bounds, since vehicles give innacurate absolute coordinates when out of bounds.
13663  // However, if the linked vehicle is moving fast enough, we should always do processing to avoid erroneously skipping linked items riding inside of it.
13664  if( last_t_abs_pos_is_oob && t_veh->velocity < HALF_MAPSIZE_X * 400 ) {
13665  if( !length_check_needed ) {
13666  return false;
13667  }
13668  link().length = rl_dist( here.getabs( pos ), link().t_abs_pos.raw() ) +
13669  link().t_mount.abs().x + link().t_mount.abs().y;
13670  if( check_length() ) {
13671  return reset_link( true, carrier );
13672  }
13673  return false;
13674  }
13675 
13676  // Find the vp_part index the cable is linked to.
13677  int link_vp_index = -1;
13678  if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_port ) {
13679  for( int idx : t_veh->cable_ports ) {
13680  if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13681  link_vp_index = idx;
13682  break;
13683  }
13684  }
13685  } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_battery ) {
13686  for( int idx : t_veh->batteries ) {
13687  if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13688  link_vp_index = idx;
13689  break;
13690  }
13691  }
13692  if( link_vp_index == -1 ) {
13693  // Check cable_ports, since that includes appliances
13694  for( int idx : t_veh->cable_ports ) {
13695  if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13696  link_vp_index = idx;
13697  break;
13698  }
13699  }
13700  }
13701  } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_tow || link().source == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13702  link_vp_index = t_veh->part_at( t_veh->coord_translate( link().t_mount ) );
13703  }
13704  if( link_vp_index == -1 ) {
13705  // The part with cable ports was lost, so disconnect the cable.
13706  return reset_link( true, carrier, -2, true, pos );
13707  }
13708 
13709  if( link().last_processed <= t_veh->part( link_vp_index ).last_disconnected ) {
13710  add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_warning, string_format( _( "You detached the %s." ), type_name() ) );
13711  return reset_link( true, carrier, -2 );
13712  }
13713  t_veh->part( link_vp_index ).set_flag( vp_flag::linked_flag );
13714 
13715  int turns_elapsed = to_turns<int>( calendar::turn - link().last_processed );
13716  link().last_processed = calendar::turn;
13717 
13718  // Set the new absolute position to the vehicle's origin.
13719  tripoint t_veh_bub_pos = t_veh->global_pos3();
13720  tripoint_abs_ms new_t_abs_pos = here.getglobal( t_veh_bub_pos );
13721  if( link().t_abs_pos != new_t_abs_pos ) {
13722  link().t_abs_pos = new_t_abs_pos;
13723  length_check_needed = true;
13724  }
13725 
13726  // If either of the link's connected sides moved, check the cable's length.
13727  if( length_check_needed ) {
13728  link().length = rl_dist( pos, t_veh_bub_pos + t_veh->part( link_vp_index ).precalc[0] );
13729  if( check_length() ) {
13730  return reset_link( true, carrier, link_vp_index );
13731  }
13732  }
13733 
13734  // Extra behaviors for the cabled item.
13735  if( !is_cable_item ) {
13736  int power_draw = 0;
13737 
13738  if( link().efficiency < MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ) {
13739  return false;
13740  }
13741  // Recharge or charge linked batteries
13742  power_draw -= charge_linked_batteries( *t_veh, turns_elapsed );
13743 
13744  // Tool power draw display
13745  if( active && type->tool && type->tool->power_draw > 0_W ) {
13746  power_draw -= type->tool->power_draw.value();
13747  }
13748 
13749  // Send total power draw to the vehicle so it can be displayed.
13750  if( power_draw != 0 ) {
13751  t_veh->linked_item_epower_this_turn += units::from_milliwatt( power_draw );
13752  }
13753  } else if( has_flag( flag_NO_DROP ) ) {
13754  debugmsg( "%s shouldn't exist outside of an item or vehicle part.", tname() );
13755  return true;
13756  }
13757 
13758  return false;
13759 }
13760 
13761 int item::charge_linked_batteries( vehicle &linked_veh, int turns_elapsed )
13762 {
13763  if( !has_link_data() || link().charge_rate == 0 || link().charge_interval < 1 ) {
13764  return 0;
13765  }
13766 
13767  if( !is_battery() ) {
13768  const item *parent_mag = magazine_current();
13769  if( !parent_mag || !parent_mag->has_flag( flag_RECHARGE ) ) {
13770  return 0;
13771  }
13772  }
13773 
13774  const bool power_in = link().charge_rate > 0;
13775  if( power_in ? ammo_remaining() >= ammo_capacity( ammo_battery ) :
13776  ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
13777  return 0;
13778  }
13779 
13780  // Normally efficiency is the chance to get a charge every charge_interval, but if we're catching up from
13781  // time spent ouside the reality bubble it should be applied as a percentage of the total instead.
13782  bool short_time_passed = turns_elapsed <= link().charge_interval;
13783 
13784  if( turns_elapsed < 1 || ( short_time_passed &&
13785  !calendar::once_every( time_duration::from_turns( link().charge_interval ) ) ) ) {
13786  return link().charge_rate;
13787  }
13788 
13789  // If a long time passed, multiply the total by the efficiency rather than cancelling a charge.
13790  int transfer_total = short_time_passed ? 1 :
13791  ( turns_elapsed * 1.0f / link().charge_interval ) * link().charge_interval;
13792 
13793  if( power_in ) {
13794  const int battery_deficit = linked_veh.discharge_battery( transfer_total, true );
13795  // Around 85% efficient by default; a few of the discharges don't actually recharge
13796  if( battery_deficit == 0 && ( !short_time_passed || rng_float( 0.0, 1.0 ) <= link().efficiency ) ) {
13797  ammo_set( itype_battery, ammo_remaining() + transfer_total );
13798  }
13799  } else {
13800  // Around 85% efficient by default; a few of the discharges don't actually charge
13801  if( !short_time_passed || rng_float( 0.0, 1.0 ) <= link().efficiency ) {
13802  const int battery_surplus = linked_veh.charge_battery( transfer_total, true );
13803  if( battery_surplus == 0 ) {
13804  ammo_set( itype_battery, ammo_remaining() - transfer_total );
13805  }
13806  } else {
13807  const std::pair<int, int> linked_levels = linked_veh.connected_battery_power_level();
13808  if( linked_levels.first < linked_levels.second ) {
13809  ammo_set( itype_battery, ammo_remaining() - transfer_total );
13810  }
13811  }
13812  }
13813  return link().charge_rate;
13814 }
13815 
13816 bool item::reset_link( bool unspool_if_too_long, Character *p, int vpart_index,
13817  const bool loose_message, const tripoint cable_position )
13818 {
13819  if( !has_link_data() ) {
13820  return has_flag( flag_NO_DROP );
13821  }
13822  if( unspool_if_too_long && link_has_state( link_state::needs_reeling ) ) {
13823  // Cables that need reeling should be reset with a reel_cable_activity_actor instead.
13824  return false;
13825  }
13826 
13827  if( vpart_index != -2 && link().t_veh ) {
13828  if( vpart_index == -1 ) {
13829  vehicle *t_veh = link().t_veh.get();
13830  // Find the vp_part index the cable is linked to.
13831  if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_port ) {
13832  for( int idx : t_veh->cable_ports ) {
13833  if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13834  vpart_index = idx;
13835  break;
13836  }
13837  }
13838  } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_battery ) {
13839  for( int idx : t_veh->batteries ) {
13840  if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13841  vpart_index = idx;
13842  break;
13843  }
13844  }
13845  } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_tow || link().source == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13846  vpart_index = t_veh->part_at( t_veh->coord_translate( link().t_mount ) );
13847  }
13848  }
13849  if( vpart_index != -1 ) {
13850  link().t_veh->part( vpart_index ).remove_flag( vp_flag::linked_flag );
13851  }
13852  }
13853 
13854  if( loose_message ) {
13855  if( p != nullptr ) {
13856  p->add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "Your %s has come loose." ), link_name() );
13857  } else {
13858  add_msg_if_player_sees( cable_position, m_warning, _( "The %s has come loose." ), link_name() );
13859  }
13860  }
13861 
13862  if( unspool_if_too_long && link().length > LINK_RESPOOL_THRESHOLD ) {
13863  // Cables that are too long need to be manually rewound before reuse.
13864  link().source = link_state::needs_reeling;
13865  return false;
13866  }
13867 
13868  if( loose_message && p ) {
13869  p->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You reel in the %s and wind it up." ), link_name() );
13870  }
13871 
13872  link_.reset();
13873  if( !cables().empty() ) {
13874  // If there are extensions, keep link active to maintain max_length.
13875  update_link_traits();
13876  }
13877  return has_flag( flag_NO_DROP );
13878 }
13879 
13880 bool item::process_linked_item( Character *carrier, const tripoint & /*pos*/,
13881  const link_state required_state )
13882 {
13883  if( carrier == nullptr ) {
13884  erase_var( "cable" );
13885  active = false;
13886  return false;
13887  }
13888  bool has_connected_cable = carrier->cache_has_item_with( "can_link_up", &item::can_link_up,
13889  [&required_state]( const item & it ) {
13890  return it.link_has_state( required_state );
13891  } );
13892  if( !has_connected_cable ) {
13893  erase_var( "cable" );
13894  active = false;
13895  }
13896  return false;
13897 }
13898 
13899 bool item::process_wet( Character *carrier, const tripoint & /*pos*/ )
13900 {
13901  if( item_counter == 0 ) {
13902  if( type->revert_to ) {
13903  convert( *type->revert_to, carrier );
13904  }
13905  unset_flag( flag_WET );
13906  active = false;
13907  }
13908  // Always return true so our caller will bail out instead of processing us as a tool.
13909  return true;
13910 }
13911 
13912 bool item::process_tool( Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13913 {
13914  // FIXME: remove this once power armors don't need to be TOOL_ARMOR anymore
13915  if( is_power_armor() && carrier && carrier->can_interface_armor() && carrier->has_power() ) {
13916  return false;
13917  }
13918 
13919  // if insufficient available charges shutdown the tool
13920  if( ( type->tool->turns_per_charge > 0 || type->tool->power_draw > 0_W ) &&
13921  ammo_remaining( carrier, true ) == 0 ) {
13922  if( carrier && has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
13923  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You need an UPS to run the %s!" ), tname() );
13924  }
13925  if( carrier ) {
13926  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "The %s ran out of energy!" ), tname() );
13927  }
13928  if( type->revert_to.has_value() ) {
13929  deactivate( carrier );
13930  return false;
13931  } else {
13932  return true;
13933  }
13934  }
13935 
13936  int energy = 0;
13937  if( type->tool->turns_per_charge > 0 &&
13938  to_turn<int>( calendar::turn ) % type->tool->turns_per_charge == 0 ) {
13939  energy = std::max( ammo_required(), 1 );
13940  } else if( type->tool->power_draw > 0_W ) {
13941  // kJ (battery unit) per second
13942  energy = units::to_kilowatt( type->tool->power_draw );
13943  // energy_bat remainder results in chance at additional charge/discharge
13944  const int kw_in_mw = units::to_milliwatt( 1_kW );
13945  energy += x_in_y( units::to_milliwatt( type->tool->power_draw ) % kw_in_mw, kw_in_mw ) ? 1 : 0;
13946  }
13947 
13948  if( energy > 0 ) {
13949  ammo_consume( energy, pos, carrier );
13950  }
13951 
13952  type->tick( carrier, *this, pos );
13953  return false;
13954 }
13955 
13956 bool item::process_blackpowder_fouling( Character *carrier )
13957 {
13958  // rust is deterministic. 12 hours for first rust, then 24 (36 total), then 36 (72 total) and finally 48 (120 hours to go to XX)
13959  // this speeds up by the amount the gun is dirty, 2-6x as fast depending on dirt level.
13960  set_var( "rust_timer", get_var( "rust_timer", 0 ) + 1 + get_var( "dirt", 0 ) / 2000 );
13961  double time_mult = 1.0 + ( 4.0 * static_cast<double>( damage() ) ) / static_cast<double>
13962  ( max_damage() );
13963  if( damage() < max_damage() && get_var( "rust_timer", 0 ) > 43200.0 * time_mult ) {
13964  inc_damage();
13965  set_var( "rust_timer", 0 );
13966  if( carrier ) {
13967  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your %s rusts due to corrosive powder fouling." ), tname() );
13968  }
13969  }
13970  return false;
13971 }
13972 
13973 bool item::process_gun_cooling( Character *carrier )
13974 {
13975  double heat = get_var( "gun_heat", 0 );
13976  double overheat_modifier = 0;
13977  float overheat_multiplier = 1.0f;
13978  double cooling_modifier = 0;
13979  float cooling_multiplier = 1.0f;
13980  for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
13981  overheat_modifier += mod->type->gunmod->overheat_threshold_modifier;
13982  overheat_multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->overheat_threshold_multiplier;
13983  cooling_modifier += mod->type->gunmod->cooling_value_modifier;
13984  cooling_multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->cooling_value_multiplier;
13985  }
13986  double threshold = std::max( ( type->gun->overheat_threshold * overheat_multiplier ) +
13987  overheat_modifier, 5.0 );
13988  heat -= std::max( ( type->gun->cooling_value * cooling_multiplier ) + cooling_modifier, 0.5 );
13989  set_var( "gun_heat", std::max( 0.0, heat ) );
13990  if( faults.count( fault_overheat_safety ) && heat < threshold * 0.2 ) {
13991  faults.erase( fault_overheat_safety );
13992  if( carrier ) {
13993  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Your %s beeps as its cooling cycle concludes." ), tname() );
13994  }
13995  }
13996  if( carrier ) {
13997  if( heat > threshold ) {
13998  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
13999  _( "You can feel the struggling systems of your %s beneath the blare of the overheat alarm." ),
14000  tname() );
14001  } else if( heat > threshold * 0.8 ) {
14002  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your %s frantically sounds an overheat alarm." ), tname() );
14003  } else if( heat > threshold * 0.6 ) {
14004  carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "Your %s sounds a heat warning chime!" ), tname() );
14005  }
14006  }
14007  return false;
14008 }
14009 
14010 bool item::process( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos, float insulation,
14011  temperature_flag flag, float spoil_multiplier_parent, bool recursive )
14012 {
14013  process_relic( carrier, pos );
14014  if( recursive ) {
14015  contents.process( here, carrier, pos, type->insulation_factor * insulation, flag,
14016  spoil_multiplier_parent );
14017  }
14018  return process_internal( here, carrier, pos, insulation, flag, spoil_multiplier_parent );
14019 }
14020 
14021 bool item::leak( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos, item_pocket *pocke )
14022 {
14023  if( is_container() ) {
14024  contents.leak( here, carrier, pos, pocke );
14025  return false;
14026  } else if( this->made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) && !this->is_frozen_liquid() ) {
14027  if( pocke ) {
14028  if( pocke->watertight() ) {
14029  unset_flag( flag_FROM_FROZEN_LIQUID );
14030  return false;
14031  }
14032  return true;
14033  }
14034  return true;
14035  }
14036  return false;
14037 }
14038 
14039 void item::set_last_temp_check( const time_point &pt )
14040 {
14041  last_temp_check = pt;
14042 }
14043 
14044 bool item::process_internal( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos,
14045  float insulation, const temperature_flag flag, float spoil_modifier )
14046 {
14047  if( ethereal ) {
14048  if( !has_var( "ethereal" ) ) {
14049  return true;
14050  }
14051  set_var( "ethereal", std::stoi( get_var( "ethereal" ) ) - 1 );
14052  const bool processed = std::stoi( get_var( "ethereal" ) ) <= 0;
14053  if( processed && carrier != nullptr ) {
14054  carrier->add_msg_if_player( _( "Your %s disappears!" ), tname() );
14055  }
14056  return processed;
14057  }
14058 
14059  // How this works: it checks what kind of processing has to be done
14060  // (e.g. for food, for drying towels, lit cigars), and if that matches,
14061  // call the processing function. If that function returns true, the item
14062  // has been destroyed by the processing, so no further processing has to be
14063  // done.
14064  // Otherwise processing continues. This allows items that are processed as
14065  // food and as litcig and as ...
14066 
14067  if( wetness > 0 ) {
14068  wetness -= 1;
14069  }
14070 
14071  if( has_link_data() ) {
14072  process_link( here, carrier, pos );
14073  }
14074 
14075  // Remaining stuff is only done for active items.
14076  if( active ) {
14077 
14078  if( wetness && has_flag( flag_WATER_BREAK ) ) {
14079  deactivate();
14080  set_fault( random_entry( fault::get_by_type( std::string( "wet" ) ) ) );
14081  if( has_flag( flag_ELECTRONIC ) ) {
14082  set_fault( random_entry( fault::get_by_type( std::string( "shorted" ) ) ) );
14083  }
14084  }
14085 
14086  if( !is_food() && item_counter > 0 ) {
14087  item_counter--;
14088  }
14089 
14090  if( calendar::turn >= countdown_point ) {
14091  active = false;
14092  if( type->countdown_action ) {
14093  type->countdown_action.call( carrier, *this, pos );
14094  }
14095  countdown_point = calendar::turn_max;
14096  if( type->revert_to ) {
14097  convert( *type->revert_to, carrier );
14098 
14099  active = needs_processing();
14100  } else {
14101  return true;
14102  }
14103  }
14104 
14105  for( const emit_id &e : type->emits ) {
14106  here.emit_field( pos, e );
14107  }
14108 
14109  if( requires_tags_processing ) {
14110  // `mark` becomes true if any of the flags that require processing are present
14111  bool mark = false;
14112  const auto mark_flag = [&mark]() {
14113  mark = true;
14114  return true;
14115  };
14116 
14117  if( has_flag( flag_FAKE_SMOKE ) && mark_flag() && process_fake_smoke( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14118  return true;
14119  }
14120  if( has_flag( flag_FAKE_MILL ) && mark_flag() && process_fake_mill( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14121  return true;
14122  }
14123  if( is_corpse() && mark_flag() && process_corpse( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14124  return true;
14125  }
14126  if( has_flag( flag_WET ) && mark_flag() && process_wet( carrier, pos ) ) {
14127  // Drying items are never destroyed, but we want to exit so they don't get processed as tools.
14128  return false;
14129  }
14130  if( has_flag( flag_LITCIG ) && mark_flag() && process_litcig( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14131  return true;
14132  }
14133  if( ( has_flag( flag_WATER_EXTINGUISH ) || has_flag( flag_WIND_EXTINGUISH ) ) &&
14134  mark_flag() && process_extinguish( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14135  return false;
14136  }
14137  if( has_flag( flag_CABLE_SPOOL ) && mark_flag() ) {
14138  // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
14139  // Cables have been reworked and shouldn't be active items anymore.
14140  active = false;
14141  return false;
14142  }
14143  if( has_flag( flag_IS_UPS ) && mark_flag() ) {
14144  // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
14145  return process_linked_item( carrier, pos, link_state::ups );
14146  }
14147  if( ( has_flag( flag_SOLARPACK ) || has_flag( flag_SOLARPACK_ON ) ) && mark_flag() ) {
14148  // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
14149  return process_linked_item( carrier, pos, link_state::solarpack );
14150  }
14151 
14152  if( !mark ) {
14153  // no flag checks above were successful and no additional processing logic
14154  // that could've changed flags was executed
14155  requires_tags_processing = false;
14156  }
14157  }
14158 
14159  if( is_tool() ) {
14160  return process_tool( carrier, pos );
14161  }
14162  // All foods that go bad have temperature
14163  if( has_temperature() &&
14164  process_temperature_rot( insulation, pos, here, carrier, flag, spoil_modifier ) ) {
14165  if( is_comestible() ) {
14166  here.rotten_item_spawn( *this, pos );
14167  }
14168  return true;
14169  }
14170  } else {
14171  // guns are never active so we only need to tick this on inactive items. For performance reasons.
14172  if( has_fault_flag( flag_BLACKPOWDER_FOULING_DAMAGE ) ) {
14173  return process_blackpowder_fouling( carrier );
14174  }
14175  if( get_var( "gun_heat", 0 ) > 0 ) {
14176  return process_gun_cooling( carrier );
14177  }
14178  }
14179 
14180  return false;
14181 }
14182 
14183 void item::mod_charges( int mod )
14184 {
14185  if( has_infinite_charges() ) {
14186  return;
14187  }
14188 
14189  if( !count_by_charges() ) {
14190  debugmsg( "Tried to remove %s by charges, but item is not counted by charges.", tname() );
14191  } else if( mod < 0 && charges + mod < 0 ) {
14192  debugmsg( "Tried to remove charges that do not exist, removing maximum available charges instead." );
14193  charges = 0;
14194  } else if( mod > 0 && charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES - mod ) {
14195  charges = INFINITE_CHARGES - 1; // Highly unlikely, but finite charges should not become infinite.
14196  } else {
14197  charges += mod;
14198  }
14199 }
14200 
14201 bool item::is_seed() const
14202 {
14203  return !!type->seed;
14204 }
14205 
14206 time_duration item::get_plant_epoch( int num_epochs ) const
14207 {
14208  if( !type->seed ) {
14209  return 0_turns;
14210  }
14211  // Growing times have been based around real world season length rather than
14212  // the default in-game season length to give
14213  // more accuracy for longer season lengths
14214  // Also note that seed->grow is the time it takes from seeding to harvest, this is
14215  // divided by number of growth stages (usually 3) to get the time it takes from one plant state to the next.
14216  // TODO: move this into the islot_seed
14217  return type->seed->grow * calendar::season_ratio() / num_epochs;
14218 }
14219 
14220 std::string item::get_plant_name() const
14221 {
14222  if( !type->seed ) {
14223  return std::string{};
14224  }
14225  return type->seed->plant_name.translated();
14226 }
14227 
14228 bool item::is_dangerous() const
14229 {
14230  if( has_flag( flag_DANGEROUS ) ) {
14231  return true;
14232  }
14233 
14234  // Note: Item should be dangerous regardless of what type of a container is it
14235  // Visitable interface would skip some options
14236  for( const item *it : contents.all_items_top() ) {
14237  if( it->is_dangerous() ) {
14238  return true;
14239  }
14240  }
14241  return false;
14242 }
14243 
14244 bool item::is_tainted() const
14245 {
14246  return corpse && corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_POISON );
14247 }
14248 
14249 bool item::is_soft() const
14250 {
14251  if( has_flag( flag_SOFT ) ) {
14252  return true;
14253  } else if( has_flag( flag_HARD ) ) {
14254  return false;
14255  }
14256 
14257  const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
14258  return std::all_of( mats.begin(), mats.end(), []( const std::pair<material_id, int> &mid ) {
14259  return mid.first->soft();
14260  } );
14261 }
14262
